description: Substation is a first-person shooter. The story focuses on an underwater base taken over by aliens. The player has to enter the game as a marine and investigate what has happened down there. The game also supports multiplayer with multiple Ataris connected via the Midi-port.

sample_screenshots.caption: A red blood puddle. I was not it.
My health are 23%. I search for food to rise up my health
I start the game with a knife

title: Substation

description:
Bolo is a "Breakout" clone with a twist. You have to destroy all the bricks on the screen using your paddle to go to the next level but, in Bolo, your paddle is not restricted to the bottom of the screen -- it can move all around the screen, giving a whole new dimension to the "breakout" concept.

The game includes two different sets of 50 levels each, randomly selected when you begin a new game. It also features 46 different types of bricks with different properties, bonuses and penalties.

The main menu allows you to access Training mode, from which you can select to play any of the 100 available layouts.

Bolo's graphics are black and white only, but the game can be played either on a monochrome or color monitor. The graphics are however much sharper on a monochrome monitor. The animations are fast and smooth, and the paddle reacts quickly to the mouse movements.

sample_screenshots.caption: Careful not to hit the bad bricks...

title: Bolo

description:
Your task in this action puzzler is to keep the Buckingham Palace bins neatly arranged. Pieces will drop towards you and they must be arranged in a neat line, so as to activate the destruction mechanism. Unfortunately, they have not been neatly arranged, and drop towards you in a range of uneven shapes.

In case you can't tell, this is a Tetris-influenced game. It's written in GFA Basic and using single-colour shapes on a black background, with 10 skill levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting a new game with the white background option
An unlucky set of starting blocks this time
Game over - the blocks are fading out

title: Fourfit

description: Walls of Illusion is an RPG similar to Dungeon Master and other dungeon crawlers. Your party of four starts with nothing. No weapons, no armour and no spells. So you must collect these before engaging in combat. Since the enemies are superior the use of tactics becomes more important. You will come across a lots of traps and other obstacles during your journey through the dungeon. Like normal in role playing games you gain experience for defeating your enemies and after awhile you will get to a new level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Throwing a dagger at the enemy
Sometime you will come across messages written on the wall.

title: Walls of Illusion

description:
The story of the game is inspired by popular games of the same time, such as Speedball and Smash T.V.: In the not-too-distant future, the most popular television show lets contestants battle it out in an all-out fighting match called the Ultimate Arena.

What this turns out to be is a man-versus-man fighting game with digitised graphics, which was à la mode in American coin-ops at the time, such as Pit-Fighter and Mortal Kombat, complete with sprays of blood for every hit. On the Atari, the sprites aren't quite as large as in arcade games, though.

At the start of a one-player game, two characters are available to play with: Terry from France and Sandy from London. All seven characters are available to choose from in two-player mode.

Each player has the usual assortment of 18 jumps, kicks and punches, most of which are easily executed with a normal Atari joystick, as well as a few special moves. Some carry weapons, while some can fire energy bolts. Instead of the common best-out-of-three system, sudden death is enforced, so a opponent must be beaten on the first attempt. If you do so, another stands in line. Being pushed into a corner is also more dangerous than other similar games, since the ringside is electrified. Stay close to the centre of the arena, or you will be burnt to a crisp.

Released at the far end of the Atari's commercial life, Ultimate Arena is notable for being one of few STE-only games, which makes the digitised sounds and graphics more natural than had it been a normal ST game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Turn blood on and off in the options

title: The Ultimate Arena

description: Pacman for GEM is a conversion of the classic arcade game running in a window on the GEM desktop. Like the arcade version, and unlike most home versions, the playfield has a vertical orientation. It is no straight conversion, however, with all levels being new (and creatable by users) and the number of ghosts on-screen being variable. Ten levels are contained in the standard distribution. While the standard look mimics the original Pac-Man, the tilesets are user-creatable, in the form of standard ST resource files. Another sample tileset comes with the game. Steering is handled via keyboard, and the game is system-friendly, running on anything from an old ST (low-res screens are too small to fit the standard tileset, though) to powerful 68060-based clones and with both standard TOS and replacement operating systems.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 10 has three ghosts following you around
The ghosts is blue and tasty
You can choose any starting level

title: Pacman for GEM

description:
Mc Coy is a variant of Dr. Mario, without Mario and running in a GEM window.

The objective is the same as in the original – take the falling pills with two different colours, twist and arrange them until you form lines of four pills of the same colour. To complicate things, the playfield has got some viruses, which must be eliminated using pills of the same colour. Once all the viruses are eliminated, the level is clear.

sample_screenshots.caption: One green virus buried under red pills

title: Mc Coy

description: This is a fairly faithful replica of Atari's classic arcade game, Asteroids, only running in a window on the GEM desktop. As in the original, you have a ship trapped in an asteroid field. Shoot the asteroids, and they split into smaller ones, until they are eventually small enough to be destroyed completely. Your ship rotates in all directions, and the playfield wraps at the edges. In order to get out of cramped situations, you can activate your hyperspace function to be transported to a random location on the screen – hopefully with fewer asteroids. From time to time, a flying saucer will fly across the screen and shoot at you. Like the arcade original, this version uses vector graphics to depict the on-screen objects (albeit rendered to a raster screen). This makes the window resizable. The game can be controlled using both keyboard and, rather uncommonly, the mouse.

sample_screenshots.caption: The window can be resized to any dimensions
Shoot the asteroids into smaller pieces

title: Asteroids for GEM

description:
This top-down soccer game has a similar long-range look to Sensible Soccer. The ball runs close to the player, but some fine control is required. Passing involves pushing the controller in the pass direction while hitting fire.

The English Premiership teams of the time are included, with 22 man squads and 8 formation options. You can play individual matches or league or cup tournaments. Match lengths can be set between 2 and 20 minutes, with 3 levels of wind, 3 levels of referee toughness, and 5 pitch styles. Replays can be viewed in 3 speeds, and stored for later viewing.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's like an early version of Sensible
Stan didn't really play as much as his talent merited though

title: Team

description:
Dominique, that careless girl, has been kidnapped again, and naturally it is up to Cobra and his mechanical mate, Lady, to rescue her.

Cobra II plays almost exactly as the previous game, only with new level layouts and slightly more rich gameplay. The isometric playfield is the same, and even the border decorations are the same. You control both Cobra and Lady, though optionally a second player may take control of Lady. You still shoot anything that moves, and have a stockpile of smart bombs to destroy anything that you failed to shoot. A star moves around the corners of the screen; follow it to find the exit to the next level. A new feature is that sessions can be saved and loaded at any point.

sample_screenshots.caption: Found the lift to the next level
The graphics are very strange at some points
A message from the captured Dominique

title: Cobra 2

description:
The task of the game is to successfully manage six toilet lots and earn more money than your competition. You can furnish your lots with different kinds of toilet seats ranging from a normal plastic one to a very expensive platinum one. You also need to supply your visitors with toilet paper which also comes in several quality classes from normal paper to silk. For the finally touch you can add some items in the toilet room like soap or condom dispensers.

Depending on the quality, cleanliness and price of your toilets, you will get more or less visitors at the end of each round. To boost revenue a bit more, you can also launch three different ad-campaigns.

But you're not alone in the city. Up to four players can compete against each other. Each player can also launch a sabotage attack on the lot of the enemy to increase his repair costs or send the health office down to check if the lots are clean.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is your wall of stalls
This is the wash room and your appliances

title: Klomanager: Spül mir das Lied vom Kot

description:
Ripcord is a small game where you have to make sure that a parachute jumper lands in the designated area. A plane crosses the screen from right to left and by clicking the left mouse button you decide where the guy will jump, a click on the right mouse button will then release the parachute. The target area will move between jumps and sometimes wind affects the jumper. When wind affects the jump it is important to release the chute at the right time, however there is no indication of any winds until the parachute is released.

A game consists of 8 jumps. There is no music in the game, only sound effects.

sample_screenshots.caption: On target but without an open chute
Landing without an open chute is lethal

title: Ripcord

description:
Dungeon is a Hack 'n slash role-playing game made in Talespin Adventure Creation System with graphics almost entirely from the Fantasy Graphic Disk by Deltronics.

When the game starts an old man, the great Shaa, tells you about the game and what to do to complete it. The aim of the game is to travel through the dungeon and at the end defeat the necromancer Malik Adbul Aziz so that you can recover the Great Orb of Thoth. Before you enter the dungeon you must select the type of character you would like to play. There are seven classes and the starting equipment depends on which class you choose: Warrior (sword), Fighter (dagger & shield), Cleric (cloth armour & one healing portion), Mage (cloth armour & two magic scrolls), Thief (dagger & 40 gold coins), Barbarian (Axe & 10 gold coins) and Superhero (nothing).

In the dungeon you will encounter enemies such as zombies, skeletons, bats, etc. When you have defeated an enemy a treasure chest appears which is yours to loot. Now and then you will encounter stairs in the dungeon. These stairs leads to villages where you can buy better equipment, have a drink in the tavern and deposit gold in the bank.

The amount of stuff you can carry is limited. You can carry one hand weapon, one range weapon, one set of range ammo, one armour type, one shield, three potions, three scrolls and up to 99 gold coins (extra gold can be deposited in the bank).

The game is totally mouse controlled.

sample_screenshots.caption: A zombie is about to attack
The adventure is about to begin
Have a drink at the tavern
At the blacksmith you can get new weapons and armor

title: Dungeon

description:
Blackscar Mountain is a text adventure written with the ST Adventure Creator.

The kingdom of Zamara is one of the most prosperous kingdoms of the world. The only thing that clouds the sky over Zamara is the curse of Blackscar. A demon, Skairos, has made the montain of Blackscar his home and he is trying to spread evil in the land. Time after time Skairos creates armies and send them to raid the surrounding contryside and time after time the royal army wipes them out. Skairos is looking for the crystal skull and the only way to banish the demon is to destroy the skull.

The players task is to venture up the Blackscar mountain, locate the crystal skull and destroy it. The adventure starts in the small village of Briarswood and the only equipment in the inventory is a magical money belt containing 45 crowns.

Almost all locations you can visit in the game are illustrated with a color picture.

sample_screenshots.caption: The starting point, outside the Unicorn Inn
The village church lies in ruins

title: Blackscar Mountain

description:
Bounty Hunter is an adventure game taking place in the wild west 1847 and you play the role of a bounty hunter. The goal of the game is to hunt down the 20 most wanted man and make the west a safer place to live.

When the game starts you are presented with a map showing seven cities, moving the mouse over a city makes the game show you city name and the time it takes to travel there. In each city there is five different places to visit: The saloon, the sheriff, the store, the doctor and the undertaker. In the saloon you can have a drink, play cards and get tips about stranger in town. Wanted men usually hangs out in the saloon and sometimes they have company. At the sheriffs office you can have a look at the wanted poster and ask about last seen outlaw. In the store you can buy ammo and food supply. It's wise to now and then visit the doctor and have him check you up.

The game is controlled both with keyboard and mouse. Map movements, menu interaction and duels is controlled with the mouse and city movements with the joystick.

sample_screenshots.caption: The undertaker drags away the dead outlaw
The travel map, here you select which city you want to visit
You spot a stranger in the saloon
If you're wounded the doctor can heal you

title: Bounty Hunter

description:
Billy boy is a scrolling platform game written in STOS.

You find yourself in various enchanted places and to finish each level you have to find its guarding, who will let you out. Collecting yellow stars along the way gives you points. Pressing buttons along the way might reveal pink stars, these should be collected before exiting the level. Enemies such as moving trees and slime blobs will reduce your energy when touched. Almost all enemies can be jumped on so that they sink in to the ground for a while. Food items restores energy. If you catch enough balloons to spell the word bonus you start the next level with the health at 100.

The game is controlled by joystick.

sample_screenshots.caption: The guy to the right of billy is the one you have to toutch to complete the level
The second level is a mine
At the start of the first level

title: Billy Boy

description:
Goin' Down with the Captain is a freeware platform game written in GFA BASIC v3.5 with Sprite Works Development Kit.

While on a short trip out at see the ships pipes starts to leak. Your job as a cabin boy is to fetch all the ships life buoys inside the ship and place them in their holders on deck. You can only carry two buoys at a time so on the later levels you have to make several trips down into the ship. If you encounter a leak you can fix it simply by moving onto it. The only enemies you encounter in this game is crabs who have invaded the lower decks of the ship.

Each level is one screen wide and at least two screens deep. The game is controlled by joystick.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level two complete and not a minute too soon, note that the water has risen over the deck
The start of level 1. Two empty life buoy holders

title: Goin' Down with the Captain

description:
Trader 2 is a trading game coded in STOS. The game is set in the Middle Ages (starting year is 1357) and has the player start their career as a trader in Bristol with only a sloop, one crew member and just under 1000 pounds at their disposal. There are seven different goods available for trade: corn, wood, spices, salt, wool, gems, and ale. Ships and their crew can be armed with four different weapons (cannons, guns, bows, and swords) to increase the chances of the player's fleet to fend off attacks from the pirates they might attract. Once a ship is loaded and enough crew members have been hired, one of seven different cities can be selected to trade with (there are eight cities in the game): London, Brugge, Hamburg, Lübeck, Malmö, Riga and Novgorod.

Random events such as floods can affect the prices of certain types of goods. With enough money, the merchant fleet can also be expanded with new ships. In Trader 2, there are three types of ships, all with different cargo capacity: Hulk (100 tons), Merchantman (60 tons) and Sloop (20 tons).

The game has no sound and is controlled with the mouse.

sample_screenshots.caption: You must always have money at hand
Here you can buy a new ship or sell an old one
Everytime you travel between cities you get to see this news screen. Special events is reported here such as floods
I lost against the pirates, Game Over

title: Trader 2

description:
A game named after an East-Asian city is invariably either a variation on the Shanghai or the Towers of Hanoi theme. Peking is a version of the aforementioned, for the Atari ST series.

The point is to identify pairs of tiles in a pyramid arrangement viewed from above, thereby removing them from the stack. Only tiles which are not covered by other tiles can be removed, which calls for care when choosing which tiles to remove in which order.

Version 2.0 of Peking is well-endowed with options, allowing you to save and load games, save screenshots, an undo function and a function to identify pairs when you are lost. Even more cheat-oriented is the option to remove tiles from the pile Additionally, two players can play at once, each player being given a set number of seconds to find a pair before relinquishing to mouse to the opponent. When the game is ended, the score for each player is calculated.

To vary things a bit, a number of tilesets are integrated in the game. Apart from the traditional mahjongg tiles, there is a set of flags, a traffic sign set and a set of pictogrammes. The game runs in both colour and black and white, in high and low resolutions.

sample_screenshots.caption: No free pairs left, time to forfeit
A big neat pile, ready to be picked

title: Peking 2.0

description:
Peking 3.0 is a thorough modernisation of version 2.0, rewritten to take advantage of advances in hardware since 1993. It is now fully GEM compliant, and works on anything from a lowly Atari ST to a modern ST clone or in replacement operating systems.

The basic game is still the same Shanghai, where you eliminate pairs of tiles in a pyramid. While the old version had four different tilesets built in, version 3 keeps tiles as separate data files, which can be downloaded or created by the user. A set of traditional tiles in three different resolutions is part of the standard package, with more available at the game's homepage, including cards, flags, traffic signs, a Christmas theme as well as a high resolution mahjong tileset digitised from actual pieces.

Not only the tiles can be changed, but also the layout, which is stored as separate files. No longer is the game limited to the typical Shanghai pyramid. The backdrop colour can be altered, and there is a floating toolbar for retracting or suggesting moves. The two-player mode is still available, as are all the other features of version 2.0.
title: Peking 3.0

description:
Midi-Maze, played on Atari STs linked up via MIDI cables, is among the first multiplayer first-person shooter for home micros, and a descendant of the original Maze War from the 1970s.

The game is set in a maze with 90° corners, and all graphics are drawn with filled polygons. Weapon systems are limited to a plain gun with a small reloading interval. All the participants are represented by big, floating smiling faces. Up to sixteen players may compete simultaneously, but those who wish to train before a match can do it alone against drones. It is possible both to play one against all or to team up.

sample_screenshots.caption: Before the match, you are shown an overhead map
Looks like my teammate has engaged the enemy

title: Midi-Maze

description: SantaFly is a christmas-themed rehash of SuperFly, with Father Christmas replacing the vehicles of the original. As the story goes, Santa's mischievous helpers have run away with items essential to christmas. It therefore stands to reason that Santa must fly in his sleigh through undulating landscapes and pick up these items; snow, presents, christmas trees, stars and every child's favourite gift – Ataris. Each level is completed when Santa picks up a set number of items, just as in the Starsearch mode of Superfly.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh, and what would christmas be without the trees?
The intro to the first stage
Take the stars, or there will be no christmas

title: SantaFly

description:
Godpey, a clone of Gunpey, is all about lines. On a playfield filled with squares, tiles with diagonal and angled lines pop up from below, and it is your job to make a connection from the left to the right by moving the tiles so that the lines with their different angles connect. Moving tiles is done by moving a cursor, two tiles high, which will swap out the two tiles it is covering.

The actual story of Godpey is about a poor monkey who has lost all his vegetables. After rejecting the idea of making vegetables out of Alan Titchmarsh, he comes to the conclusion that drawing lines will somehow take him to his veggies.

Godpey features a lot of gameplay modes, unlocked by gathering experience points. While the most basic mode is just about simple connecting for as long as you can stand it, the next mode adds a stress elements since no tile must ever be pushed off the playfield. In other modes, you play against time for points, or are presented with screens already filled with tiles that you must arrange into one big branching line involving each and every tile. The final mode is the story mode, which tells the story of the monkey in pretty cut-scenes. As you level up, the monkey is adorned with a new vegetable-themed hat.

Godpey can be played alone, against a friend or against the computer.

sample_screenshots.caption: Once there are no lines at all, you get a clear bonus
A double line, that's a lot of points
In stage mode, clear a set number of tiles to progress

title: GodPey

description:
You are a pilot of space jet in this top view arcade game. On 15 levels from one to another you should eliminate the maintenance of certain kind placed on the asteroids of different forms, which complexity is increased with level's number. Hostile space crafts as attack you as want to collide with you as kamikaze. You may shoot them with a weapon and move in four directions on the screen to avoid them or their shots.

Between the levels to acquire a bonus you (without ability to shoot) should break through different arcade sequences such as fly through the series of small asteroids, or enemy space jets, or acquire the bullets or enhanced weapon avoiding the collisions.

Each collision means decrease of your available space jets, which quantity may increase with the score. Also the amount of bullets for each your space jets on each level is limited so shoot wisely.

Finishing the game you may be enlisted in High Score table.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting your perilous mission on 0th level...
You were killed on the 2nd level...

title: Quasar

description:
Insects from Trifid Nebula attacked Earth, and you should defend the native planet from the invaders.

The game is a platform arcade shooter, where you should control your space craft in top-down view on static levels. During 99 levels the enemies of certain kinds are flying in certain different paths and shooting at you in one direction. The Challenge occurs on each level number divisible by 5. During the challenge indestructible probe with AI helps the programmed flying enemies to defeat you. The Super Challenge occurs on 33, 66, and 99 levels, and it means that enemies of various kinds will fly in certain different paths and will shoot at you.

Killing each enemy will increase your score. When you kill all the enemies on the level, you'll be awarded with the bonus points. If you'll progress in the game without being killed, your space craft will be upgraded as visually as by number of bullets you may shoot at once. 3 levels of your space craft is available.

Finishing the 99th level you'll be transferred to the 1st level again with all your points, upgrades, and lives. When all your lives will be exhausted, you may be enlisted in High Score table based on your scores.

sample_screenshots.caption: You gained the bonus for killing all the enemies on the level...

title: Trifide

description:
In this top-down arcade shooter you are a pilot of space craft, breaking through a strongly defended enemy space station somewhere near Altair. Enemy guns are set either behind the indestructible borders or in free positions. All of them are shooting at you in certain directions. Flying on a scrolling playscreen, you may move in four directions and shoot towards you. You should avoid the enemy bullets and blocking structures to do not to be killed. The bosses appear in certain parts, where screen-scrolling mode stops until the boss will be eliminated.

On your way 12 saving points will mark the positions, from where you'll restart after losing one of your lives. You should keep your energy level, shooting certain energy cells to increase it. Also you should shoot a combination of four letters "FIRE" to upgrade your weapon to 2nd level, or 4 items of square to add some kind of missiles for you possession.

Finishing your way after 12th saving point, you'll be transferred to the initial starting position with all points, energy, and missiles, but without weapon upgrade.

sample_screenshots.caption: You should pass through these items...
You should shoot the "FIRE" letters to upgrade the weapon to 2nd level...
Main developers are pilots of your assault space craft...
Two paths divided by lethal border in front of you...

title: Altaïr

description:
In the game you are a racer on the circuit with three other racers. Entire track is visible on the playscreen and gameplay is flowed in top-down view. You may turn left or right, and accelerate your car, which drives much faster than other cars. Finishing 5 laps on each track of different shape, players must come in first to participate in next race. Otherwise, the game will be over. Sometimes your car can be immobilized for the rest of the race.

The game is available for 1 or 2 players. In 2 players mode one player should use keyboard and another player should use joystick to play simultaneously, while in 1 player mode player may choose between the controllers.
title: Turbo GT

description:
Onyx is a side scrolling shoot em up game coded in 68000 machine code in which the player controls a spaceship.

The game scrolls from right to left and as the game progress the enemies travels faster and faster. The enemies comes in groups and once a group has been eliminated a fuel bonus appears at the position of the last enemy, this bonus has to be collected before it lands on the ground where it becomes inaccessible. The game ends when the player runs out of fuel.
title: Onyx

description:
Exterminate is a side scrolling shoot em up game.

On a far away planet the forces of evil have begun their latest attack on mankind. The player has to battle his way through a cave to reach a huge egg fabricated by the devil himself.

The time the player has to complete the game is limited to 6000 time units and he/she has only one life, once the ships shield is gone it's game over. As the player gets deeper into the cave the enemies gets tougher and at given times boss type enemies appears. Points are awarded for every killed enemy.

sample_screenshots.caption: Tougher enemies awaits the player further in
Two types of enemies at once

title: Exterminate

description:
The Rollercoaster Experience is a puzzle game where you have to connect the beginning of a track with the end before a ball a ball starts to follow the track. The game consists of 100 levels.

When a level starts you get a number of different tiles to build a track from, you have to use all the pieces else you will lose the ball. If you have to build a track that requires more pieces than you were given at the beginning of the level you are free to move pieces that the ball have passed to new positions. You get extra bonus if you let the ball start rolling before the start timer reaches zero.

sample_screenshots.caption: A tutorial shows you how to play

title: The Rollercoaster Experience

description:
Castle Frankenstein is a platform game in which you play a scientist who's goal is to create a monster out of a pile of bones that has gone missing. The bones are scattered throughout the first 19 levels of the game (not all levels contains bones) and all the player has to do is take them to level 20 where the monster will be created.

Each level is one screen wide and several screens high. Once you have collected all items in a level you head to the exit door at the bottom of the level and because every level has a time limit you have to move quickly. To aid the player in the game there are such floor tiles as teleporters and anti-gravity pads. There are also floor tiles that will hinder the player such as electric shock pads and tiles covered in green mould.

sample_screenshots.caption: The time is about to run out

title: Castle Frankenstein

description: Colony is a scrolling Missile Command clone. As in Missile Command the aim of the game is to protect bases (you have six of them) from incoming missiles. Beside ordinary missiles, blue and red multi-missiles will be fired at your bases by bombers and attack satellites. After every fifth level you are awarded with an extra base and as in missile command the game is lost when all your bases has been destroyed. The game is controlled by the joystick.
title: Colony

description: Bounce Out is a Pac-Man clone with an isometric perspective. At the beginning of the game you have three lives and three bombs (the amount of bombs is restored at the beginning of each new level) and to advance to the next level you have to collect all the red dots. Special bonus dots give you increased speed for a short time. Monsters such as ghosts, candles and light bulbs move around the levels and you have to avoid them, placing a bomb in an enemy's path blows him up. A map in the lower right part of the screen shows you where you are and where the monsters are.

sample_screenshots.caption: A red ghost just steped on a bomb

title: Bounce Out

description: Douglas Rockmoor is a Boulder Dash clone. You control Douglas Rockmoor and have to dig through caves and collect diamonds to get to the next level. You have to be careful of falling rocks, falling diamonds and monsters. Hitting monster with a rock kills them, hitting them with a diamond kills them and produces more diamonds.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level two is about to start
This is going to be tricky...

title: Douglas Rockmoor

description: Douglas Rockmoor 2 is a Boulder Dash clone and sequel to Douglas Rockmoor. Once again you control Douglas Rockmoor and have to dig through caves and collect diamonds to get to the next level. You have to be careful of falling rocks, falling diamonds and monsters. Hitting monster with a rock kills them, hitting them with a diamond kills them and produces more diamonds. There are 24 levels in the game and every level has its own color scheme.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is going to be tricky...

title: Douglas Rockmoor 2

description:
Aerial Combat ST is a two player dogfight game written in STOS. Since this is a dogfight the aim is to destroy your opponent before he/she destroys you.

Backgrounds and plane types is selectable from disc and the game comes with three backgrounds and three plane types (World War 1, Present and Future). The background image is in the .PI1 Degas file-format so you can add your own backgrounds to the game. Both players have 5 lives at the start of the game. The game area is one screen in size and if a player exits the screen to the left or right he/she will appear again on the opposite side. The players can only fire one shot at a time each.

sample_screenshots.caption: Futuristic background and a mid air collision

title: Aerial Combat ST

description:
Aerial Combat 2 is a two player dogfight game written in STOS and sequel to Aerial Combat ST. Since this is a dogfight game the aim of the game is to destroy your opponent before he/she destroys you.

The game comes with three sets of backgrounds and aircraft and more can be added with data discs. The game area is one screen in size and if a player exits the screen to the left or right he/she will appear again on the opposite side. The players can only fire one shoot at a time each.

At the beginning of each combat both players have three lives. Points is awarded for shooting down the opponent, forcing opponent to crash, colliding in mid air, shooting or colliding with horizontally moving object, shooting or colliding with vertically moving object and lives left at the end of the game.
title: Aerial  Combat 2

description:
Aerial Kombat 3: The Final Encounter is a two player dogfight game written in STOS and sequel to Aerial Combat 2. Since this is a dogfight, the aim of the game is to destroy your opponent before he/she destroys you. The players can only fire one shoot at a time each.

AK3 comes with three scenarios: World War 1, Hoover-cars and Choppers, additional scenarios can be loaded from data discs. A big difference between this game and it's predecessors is that different scenarios have different map layouts and not only different graphics.

sample_screenshots.caption: Every time some one loses this type of screen shows up

title: Aerial  Kombat 3: The Final Encounter

description: Air to Air Combat is a two-player dogfight game. The game area is one screen in size and if a player exits the screen to the left or right he/she will appear again on the opposite side. Since this is a dogfight, the aim of the game is to destroy your opponent before he/she destroys you, and the first to score five kills wins. Sometimes barrage balloons appears and shooting them decreases your opponents score by one. Gravity can be turned on (default) or off. With gravity on one must make sure to always have enough speed not to stall or crash. Flying too high will make you plane engine stall because of lack of oxygen.
title: Air to Air Combat

description: Zerphod is a mouse controlled 3D labyrinth game. The aim of the game is to collect three globules before the time runs out. You select your movement by choosing it from the menu to the upper right. You are not alone in the labyrinth, two monsters prowls the halls of the labyrinth and if they get you it's game over. A map in the right corner of the screen helps you keep track of your and the monsters positions.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the things you have to collect
one of the monsters got me

title: Zerphod

description:
Goldrush is a single screen multi-level Lode runner clone.

The background story tells us that its the year 3081 and you are a new class III runner. Your first mission is to recover the PosiGold stolen from the Galactic Government on the planet Supre-60. The PosiGold is located on a spaceship where every deck is guarded by a single class II droid. You carry a 4D plastic carrier bag to carry the recovered PosiGold in plus thousands of bombs.

Bombs only works on the floor and not on ladders, glass or the guard. After a while the ships computer will restore the damaged floor without any regard for what's in its place. Once a level has been cleared of stolen PosiGold the level exit will be revealed. Droids can be heat seeking or motion seeking (players choice).

sample_screenshots.caption: When all PosiGold is collected the exit appears

title: Goldrush

description: Plax Atax is a shoot em up game written in STOS. This is a one screen game that takes place in a mouth. You control a tube of toothpaste and your job is to eliminate the bacterias before they destroy too many of the teeth. Every level lasts for 20 seconds and then a level bonus is computed and the teeth restored for the next level.
title: Plax Atax

description: Byte-Man is a collect em up written in STOS that resembles Pac-Man a bit. You are Byte-Man and your job is to collect dots. There are 20 levels and to complete a level you must collect all the dots. If you complete a level quick enough you will receive a time bonus. Various bonus items will appear in bubbles now and then. A moving vehicle at the bottom of the screen releases enemies. These enemies lives for a certain amount of time before they disappears and are replaced with new ones.
title: Byte-Man

description: Bridge It is a board game for one player coded in GFA BASIC 3.5. The object of the game is to get from the start to the finish before the computer. The human player and the computer takes turns rolling a die and moving their piece accordingly, rolling a six means an extra roll. Scattered around the board is colored squares. Two squares of the same color are connected by a bridge. I you land on a colored square you automatically travel across the bridge to the other side, this might not always be a good thing. If you roll a six and land on a colored square you are not affected by it.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game is about to start

title: Bridge It

description: Cyber Snake is a "snake" game where you have to collect all the diamonds in each level before the time runs out. Every time you eat a diamond the snake grows. If you crash into a wall or into your own tail you die. Every level contains a variety of other devices, most of them potentially lethal. At the end of each level you get bonus points for remaining time and you also get a password so that you don't have to start from the beginning next time you play. Among the devices you encounter in the game are doors (which requires keys), mushrooms (which reverses the controls a short time) and bombs (explodes when activated).
title: Cyber Snake

description: Missile Alert! is a missile command variant for one or two players written in 68000 assembler. You have to protect you tank and radar station from incoming missiles. Destroy the missiles and enemy planes before they do to much damage to the city (5 hits = game over). Ammo is limited and you can aim with the cursor or with the tank.
title: Missile Alert!

description: Autorama is a labyrinth game written in 68000 assembler. You control a racing car, and on each level you have to collect all flags before you run out of gas. Certain flags gives you more gas. Enemy cars are chasing you and they do their best to crash into you. If they get too close you can press the fire button to release a puff of smoke that will confuse them for a while. As the game progresses more enemies appear and other things which makes the game harder, like boulders, appear on the level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Second level. Two enemies and a boulder

title: Autorama

description:
The Blag is an adventure game created with STAC. You take on the roll of Detective Constable Adrian Blunder newly transferred to the small British village Woolendon. Woolendon is a lovely place to live if you are after the quiet way of life, but that was exactly what Blunder didn't want. He wanted crime and plenty of it. By the end of his first day in Woolendon things changes and he finds himself investigating a bank robbery.

The game attempts to follow the line of a police investigation of a serious crime at a quiet town, right through to the eventual trial of the accused. When you think that you have conducted a sufficient investigation type court at the prompt to see how the trial goes. One can say that the game consists of two parts mixed together: exploring and questioning. In exploring mode you walk, drive, look, pick up things etc like in any other text adventure. The questioning mode is invoked by the ask command and can be used when you encounter a villager. When you think you have finished the questioning just type thanks to return to exploring mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: A map over the village area
The police station where the game starts

title: The Blag

description: Runaway is a action game written in 68000 assembler. You have to guide a small drone ship through the tunnels of the moon. Due to a power drive control system failure the ship cannot slow down. You have plenty of fuel but you have to be careful so that you don't crash into the walls. You have six tries to save the drone ship. A sort of radar map on the right side of the screen shows you how far it is to safety.

sample_screenshots.caption: Its dangerous to get too close to the wall

title: Runaway

description: Crystal Caverns is a platform game coded in STOS. The aim of the game is to find three crystals hidden in a cave the size of 120 screens. Once you find a crystal you have to take it to its proper place and you can only carry one crystal at a time. The cave is filled with monsters. At some locations you can find magic spells that can aid you in your quest. You have to be careful when exploring the caves because you got only one life and there are many monsters lurking down there. The game is controlled by joystick.

sample_screenshots.caption: A teleport placed in a hard to reach location

title: Crystal Caverns

description: Push 'n' Shove is a freeware puzzle game coded in STOS. The goal of each level is to push blocks into their corresponding holes. Blocks have different shapes and so does the holes. Some floor tiles are special: allowing travel in one direction only, etc.
title: Push 'n' Shove

description: Let's Go Memo! is a memory game written in GFA BASIC 3.5. The game can be played by one or two players and is controlled by the mouse. Let's Go Memo comes with four different sets of cards (Alphabet, Couleur, Kanji and standard) but since the card-files are in PI1-format you can easily create your own set of cards (there is even a template-file included so that you get the right size for the cards). The game area consists of 6 x 10 memory cards.

sample_screenshots.caption: Two player mode with the Couleur card-set

title: Let's Go Memo!

description:
Ace Invaders is a Space Invaders clone written in 68000 assembler. You control your ship with the joystick and your mission is to destroy as many aliens as possible. If the action gets to heavy you can always dodge the bullets or hide behind one of your four shields, but once your shields are gone you are unprotected. You have only three lives and if an alien manages to land directly on you you lose them all at once. As in the original Space Invaders the aliens moves faster as they get fewer.

The game features two playing modes: Original Edition and Limited Edition. The difference between the two modes is that the graphics is Limited Edition is better than in the Original one and that the color scheme is changing from game to game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Limited edition mode is more colorful than the original edition mode

title: Ace Invaders

description:
Annihilator is a Galaxian variant written in 68000 assembler.

Your ship is at the bottom of the screen and you control it with the joystick. The aim of the game is to destroy as many aliens as possible before you lose your only ship. On every level a large group of aliens comes down from the top of the screen to the middle of the screen and you have to move left and right to avoid them and fire your ships weapon to destroy them.

At given intervals aliens will break formation and fly down the screen against you. When they reach the bottom of the screen they will reappear at the top. Some aliens can be destroyed with only one shot while others can take several rounds before they are destroyed. As you progress in the game the aliens will move faster and in larger number. Some aliens will leave power-ups after being destroyed. These power-ups can give extra energy or time limited shields.
title: Annihilator

description:
Rockfall is a Boulder Dash clone written in 68000 assembler where you on every level (there is a total of 48 levels in the game) have to collect all the diamonds before the time runs out. Be careful of boulders because they will only stay still on flat surfaces and once they fall you cannot out run them. At later levels monsters and pulsators will start to appear. There can be up to 4 of each in a level. Both monsters and pulsators has to be disposed of in one way or another. Monsters walks randomly in the level while pulsators always follows the walls and they will always turn left if they have to choose direction. Monsters can be killed using boulders while you need to use traps to kill pulsators.

At the start of the game you have 180 seconds to complete the first level. For following levels, you get an extra 120 seconds in addition to what you have left from the previous level. If the timer reaches zero it's game over.
title: Rockfall

description:
Rockfall Special Edition is an enhanced version of the original Rockfall written in 68000 assembler. You control Spud and aim of the game is to collect all the diamonds on every level before the time runs out. Be careful of boulders because they will only stay still on flat surfaces and once they fall you cannot out run them. At later levels monsters and pulsators will start to appear. There can be up to 4 of each in a level. Both monsters and pulsators has to be disposed of in one way or another. Monsters walks randomly in the level while pulsators always follows the walls and the will always turn left if they have to choose direction. Monsters can be killed using boulders while you need to use traps to kill pulsators. After completing a level you will gain a time bonus of 120 seconds that will be added to your remaining time.

New in this version is the possibility to continue the game from the level you died at, redrawn graphics and the possibility to use new sets of levels.
title: Rockfall Special Edition

description:
Rockfall 2 - The Perils of Spud is a Boulder Dash clone and sequel to Rockfall. You control Spud and the aim of the game is to collect all the diamonds on every level before the time runs out. Before you start a new level you will see a map of the level and various bits of information about the level. As you dig and collect diamonds you have to be careful of boulders, because they will only stay still on flat surfaces and once they fall you cannot out run them. Monsters and pulsators will try to stop you in your quest and they have to be killed in order to complete the level. Monsters will follow Spud around the screen and can be killed using boulders. Pulsators always follows the walls and the will always turn left if they have to choose direction. To kill a pulsator you have to guide it into a trap where it will turn into a diamond.

In some levels you will encounter teleporters. They will teleport Spud to another position in the level, but they can only be used once. All teleporters must be used before a level can be completed.

A password system lets you start on any level you visited so far. Rockfall 2 also comes with a built in level editor (a included level can be edited once you have completed it and received it's editor code). Each set of levels have their own high score list which is saved to disc. 2 sets of levels are included with the game, representing a total of 90 levels. The default set is completely new, unlike the other set which is based on those levels which came with Rockfall Special Edition.

sample_screenshots.caption: The level editors object selection menu

title: Rockfall 2: The Perils of Spud

description:
Rockfall 3 is a Boulder Dash clone and sequel to Rockfall 2. The game comes with two executable files -one for 520 K systems and one for 1 Meg systems.

The player controls Yaj and the aim of the game is to collect all the diamonds on every level (there is a total of 30 levels in the game) before the time runs out. Every level is a square the size of four screens. Monsters, pulsators and deadly skulls will try to stop the player in their quest and they have to be killed in order to complete the level. Monsters will follow Spud around the screen and can be killed using boulders. Pulsators always follows the walls and the will always turn left if they have to choose direction. To kill a pulsator you have to guide it into a trap where it will turn into a diamond. There can be up to 16 monsters and pulsators in a level (4 per screen). On their quest the player will also encounter various bonus items such as maps and watches and if they collect the letters B, O, N, U, S they will get a big bonus.

In some levels the player will encounter teleporters. They will take Yaj to another point in the level. There can be up to 16 teleporters in one level, but they can only be used once. Switch operated doors and blockades that appear from nowhere is also things that are new in Rockfall 3.

Rockfall 3 comes with a built-in level editor, a password and editor code system, and savable high score tables.
title: Rockfall 3

description:
PicrossST is a nonogramme puzzle game for the Atari ST, similar to Nintendo's Picross series.

The player is presented with a grid, surrounded by numbers on the top and left sides. These numbers represent the number of squares on that row or column that shall be filled. On a 15x15 grid, a number fifteen means that the entire row or column should form a straight line across the grid, whereas the numbers ”10, 3” on the left mean that that row should have one line of 10 filled squares and another shorter line of 3 squares. These lines must have at least one blank square to separate them. Using deduction, it is possible to fill in all the right squares, thereby forming a simple picture.

The implementation in PicrossST starts out with the program choosing to reveal a row and column at random to help the player out. After that, he is on his own. Using the mouse, squares can either be coloured or marked as presumably empty, a bit like Minesweeper. Marking a blank square as empty is punished with a time deduction, which means that you can trade time for hints.

Two players may play at once, but in a cooperative manner. The game also comes with a grids editor for constructing puzzles of your own.

sample_screenshots.caption: Looks like some kind of arrow

title: PicrossST

description:
PSTAC2k8E is a special tournament edition of PicrossST released on the Atari Convention 2008 in France.

Like the ”real” PicrossST, it is a ”nonogramme” puzzle where a grid must be filled according to numbers placed on its sides. However, the AC 2008 edition is a test of endurance and fast thinking. All puzzles are random-generated so that it is not possible to solve the puzzle by trying to see a picture in it. Furthermore, it is very unforgiving, with a fast countdown. Time is added to the countdown when the player marks a filled cell in the grid correctly. Controversely, erroneously filling a cell results in a big deduction on the time available. The aim is to get as high a score as possible, rather than just playing for leisure.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out on a random field.

title: PicrossST: AC 2008 Edition

description:
In the reign of King Louis VI, in the second medieval age, many thousands of years from now the king used to imprison his victims in a lonely cell atop the sentinel tower. The cell had two exits: one unlocked and one locked. The unlocked one was one of the seven gates leading directly to hell and the other exit, which led to freedom was locked by a strange device which was always some sort of puzzle. This game features one of those puzzles.

The goal of the game is to collect the seven keys (one of each tile colour) that are needed to escape the cell. You collect a key by cover all color fields, except your chosen colour. Fourteen covering tiles are available, seven each of two different shapes (a straight one and a bent one). Pick these up using the mouse, rotate them by pressing the right mouse button and drop them at the desired location with the left mouse button. If you are successful in covering all colors but one, you will attain that color key.
title: Escapade

description:
Pacman on E's is a colorful Pac-Man clone for one or two players coded in 68000 assembler. The aim of the game is to collect the yellow dots in every level. At given intervals bonus items will appear at the players starting point, these can give you extra points, extra life or something less good like turbo enemies. The game features a total of 100 levels.

During two player games special power-ups will appear that makes the game more interesting, effects can be things like "reverse joystick directions" or "Inflict 'it' upon a player".
title: Pacman on E's

description:
Sam in Monster's Garden is a freeware collect-'em-up game not completely unlike Dig Dug. As Sam you have to collect fruits and flowers. As you dig your way to the flowers and fruits you have to watch out for the apples, if they don't have enough supporting ground underneath they will fall down and they can crush you to death.

Every level is free of monster when it starts but after a while monsters starts to appear. There are two types of monsters: yellow ones and lilac ones. The yellow monsters can only follow existing paths while the lilac ones digs new ones.
title: Sam in Monster's Garden

description:
Maelstrom is a vertical scrolling shoot 'em up game written in 68000 assembler. You control a spaceship and have to battle you way through asteroid fields and waves of enemy spaceships. The length of each level is determined by how fast the player kills the enemies; for every killed enemy the energy meter to the right on the screen goes up a bit and when it reaches 100% the player has completed the level. As the game progresses levels takes longer and longer to complete. When a level has been completed the earned points for the level is added to the players score.

The game comes with no background story, but level names such as "Border patrols" suggests that the designer had some kind of story in mind.
title: Maelstrom

description:
Twot Tot and the Mansion of Madness is a multi-screen platform game where you have to collect items and use them solve puzzles.

Twot Tot is trapped in the Mansion of Madness and you have to help him escape. To be able to escape Twot has to befriend the inmates of the mansion. You will often find that the inmates block Twots way and that they demand payment for passage, what kind of payment they want varies from inmate to inmate. When you explore the mansion you will encounter many items which can be used to solve the problems Twot Tot encounters, but you can only carry two at a time and sometimes two or more items has to be combined to solve a problem. The place is infested with bugs which must be avoided, if they hit Twot he loses one life and he's only got seven. In some room you will find poems and anagrams and these can give you useful information if they are solved.

sample_screenshots.caption: Two bugs, a sword and a clue
This is where the game starts

title: Twot Tot and the Mansion of Madness

description:
Color Clash is a platform puzzle game. The player controls a chameleon that can change into different colors, each color gives it a different skill.

The evil Dr Nippon has trapped in his experiments and you must complete all 36 stages to escape from the maze. A stage is completed when you have eaten all insects. Avoid touching the monsters or you'll explode. You can eat color blocks to change color and thus change your special ability.

Yellow, jumping ability (default). Green, use your tail to break blocks or kill enemies. Red, float like a helium balloon only stopped by blocks. Blue, use your tongue to grab and move blocks.

There are five types of enemies you must avoid. Red grunts simply walk left and right. Green monsters can also jump down platforms. Robots try to seek you out and can also climb up platforms. There are two types of floating enemies, rockets that move from left to right and squid like creatures that go up and down. Both the chameleon and the monsters can jump down any gap at the bottom of the screen and reappear at the top. However, this doesn't work for any gaps at the left or right side of the screen.

There also are two special blocks, a grey block which kills you if you eat it and a fire block that shoots a horizontal laser beam destroying blocks and enemies in its path.

sample_screenshots.caption: Stage 9, enemies can walk through the colored blocks
Stage 5, don't eat the grey block
Stage 4, blue block, grab and move a block
Stage 1, jump on the platform to avoid the monster

title: Color Clash

description: Minos is a first person labyrinth game with 40 levels. The aim of each level is to first find a key and then the exit door. At the start of the game you can choose which level you want to play. At the start of every level you have one torch. You have to find the exit before the torch goes out or else it's game over. On later levels you can find extra torches lying on the floor in the labyrinth and you can carry up to three extra torches, four if you don't have the key.

sample_screenshots.caption: A typical tunnel in the labyrinth
There is a key on the floot

title: Minos

description:
Bombs Away is a freeware Bomberman clone written in GFA Basic 3.5 with the Sprite Works Development Kit.

The aim of the game is to find the exit which is hidden behind one of the brick walls. Brick walls can be destroyed by placing a bomb right next to them. There is something hidden behind each wall, but not everything is worth collecting. Things you may find includes extra bombs, power increase, score bonuses and a mystery pick up. The game consists of ten levels and every level must be completed under 2 minutes and 30 seconds.

At the first level there is one enemy and as you progress the number of enemies increases, they don't lay bombs but they kill on contact. The more walls you destroy and enemies you kill the more points you get, if you leave a level without killing all enemies or destroying all the walls a large number of points will be deducted from your score. Last but not least: you only have one life.
title: Bombs Away

description: Aliens is a shoot'em-up game for high-resolution only. Just like in Space Invaders you control a spaceship at the bottom of the screen and fire at enemies at the upper part of the screen. Enemies enters the screen from left or right, some will move around the upper parts of the screen a while before they start to descend while others will aim for you directly. If any of the enemies hits you or the ground you lose a life. There are 20 types of enemies and once destroyed they give you 50 to 300 points depending on type.

sample_screenshots.caption: Many enemies at the same time
He's making a dive at the player

title: Aliens

description:
Battle Zone is a Worms clone and just like in the original Worms the aim of the game is to erase the other team from the map. Unlike the original game there is no time limit for the turns or the whole match.

There are two game modes: "Single Match" and "Tournament". Tournament mode allows up to ten players to compete. Players can choose among 30 teams to play and each team consists of 4 worms. The game features 13 different landscapes with names such as City, Food and Atarist.

Every team has an arsenal that consists of 14 different things: bazooka, rocket, grenade, cluster bomb, dynamite, air strike, teleport, fire punch, tunnel, grinders, machine gun, kamikaze, plasma gun and skip go. Everything in the arsenal is limited, even the "skip go"-option which is set to 99. When firing a projectile weapon or throwing a grenade attention must be paid to the wind, both strength and direction matters.
title: Battle Zone

description:
The Pairs are Gone is a puzzle game where you have to eliminate cards from the board. The cards must be eliminated pairwise and this can be done horizontally, vertically, or diagonally (gives most points). If you end up with cards that can't be removed you lose a life and when all lives are gone you lose the game.

The game consists of 25 levels and as you progress you will have to remove more and more cards and new cards will also show up.

The game is heavily inspired by one of the mini games in Super Mario Bros on the Nintendo DS. The DMA music is ripped from the N64 game Mario Party and the graphics comes from Zoo Keeper.
title: The Pairs are Gone

description: Manga Puzzle is a picture puzzle game where you reorder scrambled manga pictures of girls. The player can use the keyboard or joystick to slide the pieces in place. Once a picture has been successfully assembled just press a key for the next picture. The game has a total of 43 pictures.
title: Manga Puzzle

description: Operation Angelica is a game where you drive a field ambulance and have to save wounded soldiers in the field. Mines and attack jest makes your mission more difficult. There are nine scenes and at the start of each scene you have 14 stretchers in your ambulance. You don't have to complete a level to move to the next one, just press F1 when you feel for a new level. Holding down the joysticks fire button while driving will paint a line after the ambulance making it possible to retrace a known safe route. The game is coded in 68000 assembler.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ouch! I tried to drive over a mine (and failed)

title: Operation Angelica

description:
Parabellum is a multi-screen platform game written in STOS.

In an earlier life you were a terrible person and as punishment for this you have been confined to the depths of hell for centuries. Now a chance for freedom has arrived! The aim of the game is to escape hell. You have to move from room to room until you reach the exit. In every room there is four candles of different colors which you have to collect in a certain order. When you have collected all four candles you are allowed to pick up the key which allows you to progress to the next room. The order in which the candles has to be collected varies between rooms. Various monsters will also try to stop you on your quest and there is a time limit. Every room also contains four bonus items: extra life, freeze enemies, pause timer and bonus points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Second level, it's a bit trickier

title: Parabellum

description:
Psicotic is a multi-screen shoot'em up game coded in STOS. Aliens from the planet ZzalazZ has almost destroyed earth and as head of Earth Security you have to avenge your dead fellow humans. The intergalactic bank has agreed to pay you three things for every alien ship you render defenceless:

  1. 3 credits

  2. 500 or 1000 points bonus

  3. 1 part of a bomb

Once you get all the bomb parts you can assemble a bomb powerful enough to destroy the whole alien fleet.

One alien ship consists of five screens. After destroying all enemies in one screen you are presented with a bonus: a credit, a bonus token or a piece of the bomb. Once you have destroyed an entire ship you can participate in the intergalactic banks code game where you can win 0, 1 or 2 bonus credits. I you fail to win the bonus game you will lose all credits you collected on the level. After the bonus game you will be transferred to a shop where you can spend your credits on various equipment or points.

As you progress in the game the number of enemies you encounter will increases and they will also be faster and fire faster bullets.

sample_screenshots.caption: Small, grey and fast moving enemies fiering at me

title: Psicotic

description:
Seventh Heaven is a text adventure created in STAC. You play a man who four years ago was diagnosed with an terminal illness. The doctor told you that you had at most five years left to live. After two nervous breakdowns and a suicide attempt you got locked up in a secure psychiatric ward. During recreation periods in the garden you used to sleep on a bench and there you dreamt dreams, dreams that hinted of a promise. The dreams told you about the astral plane.

Every time you sleep on the bench you travel to the astral plane. The astral plane is divided into seven levels and at the start of the game you only have access to the first level. To gain access to a new level you have to complete a specific task. On the seventh level you'll find the cure for your illness.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first level of the astral plane

title: Seventh Heaven

description: Mr Dig is a conversion of the Atari 8-bit game Mr. Do! coded in STOS. As Mr Dig you have to collect all the cherries in each level. If you collect a group of six at a time you will get bonus points. Collecting crystals gives you 1000 points. Now and then letters will appear in the level, if you collect the word BONUS you will get an extra life and a smart bomb (smart bombs will kill all monsters in the level when used). Monsters roam the levels and they kill you on contact. You can kill the monsters by dropping apples on them. If you don't finish the level fast enough the monsters will become bored and mutate. At the start of the game you have three lives and two smart bombs.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to kill a monster with an apple

title: Mr Dig

description:
Island Strike: The Ultimate Conflict is a shoot'em-up game in which you control a helicopter. You have to rescue lost soldiers and blow up bridges.

The game is set in the early 21st Century when the world faces its deadliest challenge yet. D.C. Genoce, a ruthless billionaire, has used his fortune to purchase key areas of the world. Now he is planning to take over the world with the aid of his army who were made redundant after the cold war. This must be stopped and that's why you are fighting.

As you fight your way through the islands you have to keep an eye on your ammo, armour and fuel meters. You can find extra ammo, armour and fuel on the ground but there is only a limited supply. To aid you in your quest you have a co-pilot and depending on his skill you gain some extra help (extra help on map info, extra fuel, extra armour and extra ammo).

sample_screenshots.caption: Game over. But I got a high score

title: Island Strike: The Ultimate Conflict

description:
Phantom Zone is an adventure game created with STAC

You are the adventurer and collector of rare artifacts Dan Yell Flint. You share your interest in the acquisition of antiques and archaeological finds with your grandmother. One day after she returns from a holiday she calls to see you. When you meet her she gives you a mirror, which she tells you she found in a little curiosity shop in Forshibad. At home you place the mirror in your drawing room and don't give it much thought, but every time you enter the room it feels like the mirror is calling out to you. Upon closer inspection you find an arcane inscription in the mirror and before you know it you are trapped in the mirror. Your quest is to escape from the strange world in the mirror.

sample_screenshots.caption: You find a dying old man
A gate is in your way

title: Phantom Zone

description: Safe as Houses is a version of the classic monopoly board game for one to eighth players written in GFA Basic. Just like in the original game you buy streets, build houses and try to drive your opponents to bankruptcy. The name of the streets can be British, Irish or American. On each turn the player(s) is presented with a menu with 7 choices: Build, Mortgage, Unmortgage, Trade, Information, Resign and Roll the dice. Classic monopoly rules apply such as you have to buy a free property when you land on it (if you can't afford it it will be auctioned out) and if you roll doubles three times in a row you have to go to jail (without passing go).

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm getting some money from the computer player

title: Safe as Houses

description: Tank Battle is a two player tank duel game written in STOS. Two players take control over a tank each and then try to kill the opponent. The game area consists of one screen with some obstacles in. Bullets will bounce on the wall so care must be taken when firing. There are six different map layouts and number of kills to win can be adjusted.

sample_screenshots.caption: This level is a bit harder that the others

title: Tank Battle

description:
Trolls is a kind of maze game coded in 68000 assembler.

Little Billy is always fantasizing and day-dreaming. It has gone so far that he even has forgot his friends and family. To teach him a lesson a spirit has zapped him into a world of fantasy and danger. You have to guide Billy through 9 levels so that he may escape the fantasy world. Every level is filled with traps and trolls will chase you.

To avoid traps you have to keep an eye on the "Trap meter" on the right side of the screen, this will tell you if you are close to a trap (but not where it is). To see the traps you have to collect and use magic pebbles. The exit is located at the top of each maze. Since it's a fantasy world you have infinite lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trolls always come from the bottom of the screen
The level exit is just ahead

title: Trolls

description:
Tycoon is a management game coded in Fast BASIC. You start the game with $ 100 m in cash and a share price at 250. The game area consist of two islands which are yours (and you competitors) to exploit. The aim of the game is to make as much money as possible by operating mines, drill for oil and gas or trading with shares. Events happens in real time during the game but they player(s) has to press the next button in order to execute the turns orders. Every turn you can explore, test drill, build stuff, check out your mines or trade with shares.

Exploration can be made in four different ways: "Aerial", "soil", "gravi" or "test drill". The stock market contains 13 different companies (not counting companies owned by players) whose shares can be traded.
title: Tycoon

description:
Escape is a RPG-like labyrinth game for medium resolution coded in assembler.

Your mission is to find the exit of the maze. On your way to the exit you will encounter many obstacles, like bombs, magic traps, teleporters, locked doors and an infinite supply of monsters. Many things in the maze will also aid you in your quest such as bandages, first aid kits, potions, scrolls, money, weapons, rings, belts, wands, and armor. Your inventory may contain up to eight items.

When you start the game you have no health points so it is very easy to get killed right in the beginning. Your maximum health will increase every time you kill a monster.

sample_screenshots.caption: I walked right into a trap
Here is where the game starts
A locked door blocks my way

title: Escape

description:
ST Checkers is a computer version of the classic board game checkers for one player.

There are seven levels of difficulty, what you alter is the maximum time the computer is allowed to calculate its next move. Level 0 allow it to think for 5 seconds and level 6 for 8 hours. After every computer move you have to press the left mouse button to execute it. The game is playable in medium or high resolution.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is not going my way

title: ST Checkers

description:
WindowBall is a small GEM based break-out game for all resolutions.

A level consists of 50 bricks ordered in five rows. Bricks in the first row gives 60 points and the value increases with 10 points per row, so the bricks in the highest row gives 100 points.

There are two game modes: catch and Throw. When playing catch you can press and hold down the right mouse button to catch the ball. You may also select if the bricks takes one or two hits before they are destroyed.

You start with four lives. There are no power-up's and no extra lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Playing a game where the bricks takes two hits (High resolution)

title: WindowBall

description:
Ogre is a char-set war game for medium or high resolution. You command a force of infantry, armor, and howitzers pitted against a large cybernetic tank, the Ogre. Your mission is to destroy the Ogre, or at least render it immobile, before it reaches and destroys your command post. The game based on a MicroGame with the same name created by Steve Jackson in 1977.

The battlefield is represented by dots and stars marks craters. The units at your disposal are: howitzer (H), heavy tank (T), missile tank (M), GEV (G), infantry (1-9 depending on strength) and the command post (C). When you have placed all of your units the Ogre (represented by an O) shows up at the left of the screen. After the Ogre appears the real game starts and it consist of 5 phases:

  • 1: You may move your units.
  • 2: Units within firing range of the Ogre may fire.
  • 3: You may move your GEV:s.
  • 4: The Ogre moves.
  • 5: The Ogre fires at everything in range, disabled units will be replaced with their corresponding lower case letter and destroyed units will be removed from the game.

These phases is repeated until you or the Ogre wins.
title: Ogre

description:
Black Jack Plus 3 is a highly customizable Black Jack game in medium resolution for up to seven players.

Computer players can have one of seven strategies and those strategies can be edited in the strategies window. There you can set options like "max bet", insurance yes/no, etc, etc. Human players can play all by them selves or with feedback from the computer. Four different house rules can be edited. The rules include what to do when getting 17, when the dealer should be able to use double down and if the dealer should be able to surrender.

You can play with 1-9 decks and a game can consist of up to 999999 deals. The gameplay can be logged to file or printer.
title: Black Jack Plus 3

description: Illusion is a colorful break-out game for one player. The theme of the game is computers so the bricks are arranged as logos of computer companies (Amiga, Apple, etc). The player starts the game with four lives and there are no power-ups. However, you do get an extra life now and then.

sample_screenshots.caption: Unbelivable; first level in an Atari ST game is an Amiga logo

title: Illusion

description: Skull-Diggery is a Boulder Dash-clone for medium resolution. As in the original game you have to collect a certain number of gems in each level to complete it. As you dig your way to the gems you have to be careful so that you don't get crushed by a skull. In some levels there are monsters, if you hit a monster with a skull it will explode and destroy anything within 3x3 square, this can be used to open up walls to sealed gem rooms. Sometimes you have to convert skulls to gems to get enough of them to complete the level.

sample_screenshots.caption: In this level you have to be fast
Every level has its own name

title: Skull-Diggery

description:
Crazy Cubes is a labyrinth game for high resolution where you have to guide two or more balls to the exit. Every level is made up of several different tiles; there are walls that are impassable, tiles that stops your ball and only allows it to leave the tile in a given direction, bombs, mirrors, tiles that gives bonus points and the lightning tile that can do several things (like make one ball disappear or create a bomb). You control the balls with the joystick. When you want to move the balls you have to press the fire button, else they wont move. Every level has a time limit and if you don't complete the level in that time it's game over.

At given points you will face qualifying games, that if successfully completed allows you to continue to play. You may choose between "entering" the arcade and play one of three qualifying games (Asteroids, Formula 1 or Lunar) or take a three question quiz with questions such as who was singer in X.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lunar: one of the qualifying games

title: Crazy Cubes

description:
Thriller is a collect'em-up game in high resolution for one player.

You control a ball that moves on a track and have to collect a certain number of hearts to be able to move to the next level. To make things harder there are traps on the track and balls that moves in the opposite direction. The "enemy" balls doesn't appear before you roll into the ball activation square. It has a changing number on it that will decide how many balls that will appear (1-4) at the beginning. The rest of the balls will follow after a while. Hitting a ball or a trap means losing one life, when the number of lives are at zero it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level two is much harder than it looks

title: Thriller

description:
Railway Motion is a sliding puzzle in high resolution for one or two player.

The aim of the game is to make a clear path for a train through each level, you do this by moving around tiles so that you get a connected route from start to finish. You can only move tiles that have an empty square as a neighbour, tiles marked block can't be moved at all. The game comes with 13 levels, all in the size of 10 x 7 tiles.

You start the game with 250 points and a bonus of 250. The score and bonus will decrease over time and when a level is complete the bonus will be added to the score and the new values are transferred to the next level. When the bonus reaches 0 it will go back to 250 at the next level and start to decrease again.

sample_screenshots.caption: Result fot player A after level one
This looks like a harder level.

title: Railway Motion

description:
Avina Blue is a shoot'em-up written in 68000 assembler.

Many hundred years from the computer revolution of the late 1900's software companies operates from huge satellite moons and the human spirit is almost dead. The Ego Mind rules everything and it destroys and represses any threats. A small band of programmers operating through the name of Budgie UK have found and reclaimed some long lost spirit of creativity and programming magic. But since the Ego Mind sees this as a threat it is developing a counter measure inside an orbiting software satellite known as Avina Blue. The game that the Ego Mind develops is so powerful it will turn mankind into a race of zombies. It is your job to pilot a small spaceship inside Avina Blue and destroy the threat to mankind.

This game is similar to Chris Skellern's earlier game Runaway in that you guide a space ship at high speed through narrow passages. Unlike his earlier game this one is side-scrolling, there is plenty of enemies and you can shoot them. You have 12 lives at the beginning.
title: Avina Blue

description: Atari Master Mind is a computer version of the classical board game. The computer selects a secret color combination of five colors and you have to figure it out by selecting your own combinations and let the computer evaluate them.
