How well your combination matches the one the computer selects is indicated by two types of dots: A white dot indicates that you have the right color but in the wrong position and a black dot indicates that you have booth the right color and right position for it.
title: Atari Master Mind

description: Dallas is a game for 2 to 6 players where you try to lead the most profitable oil company. Every player starts with $300,000 in cash. The first task is to buy an oil field (there are 12 in the game) and then some drilling equipment. When you find oil you have to buy a tank car firm and some tank car's. After each players turn he/she gets to decide the amount of oil to sell this week, the maximum value is decided by how much oil and how many tank cars the player have. The richest player after 52 weeks (a year) wins. If the competitors are doing too well one can always try to sabotage his/her operation.

sample_screenshots.caption: I've drilled 473 meters and still no oil
When everything else fails: sabotage your oponents operation

title: Dallas

description:
Fighting Sail is a ship battle game written in HiSoft Basic. There are two game modes: Campaign and One battle. In campaign mode you control the USS Constitution during the war of 1812. In one battle mode you can choose to control one of five different ships: Sloop, Brig, Frigate, 74 S-O-L or 100 S-O-L. After you have chosen which ship to control you see and info screen presenting your and your enemy's ships plus a historical note about the battle you will enter.

When you engaged an enemy ship you can load you cannons with four types of ammunition:* Single ball: standard ammunition, it has the longest range.

  • Chain shot: this type of ammo is used to damage the rigging
  • Grape shot: ammunition very effective against the crew.
  • Double ball: to balls loaded at once, has a maximum range of one.

If you feel confident enough to win you can board the enemy ship and let your crew fight the other crew hand to hand.
title: Fighting Sail

description: Poker Night is a poker game for one player in medium resolution written in GFA Basic. You play against five computer players and all have $248 in cash at the beginning. At every new hand the game variant can change, it's up to the dealer. The variants are: 5 card draw, 5 card stud or 7 card stud. Betting limit can be either $1-$2, $5-$10 or $25-$50, if you have less money that four times the maximum betting limit you can take a loan.

sample_screenshots.caption: The dealer has decided on game

title: Poker Night

description: Roulette is a one player roulette game written in Laser C. You start with a bank roll of $10K and you have five different markers to place bets with: $1,$5, $25, $100 and $500. There is no goal or high score and when you run out of money, there is no way to continue so you have to restart the computer.
title: Roulette

description: Rabbit Jump is a collect'em-up game where you control a fox who acts as a spring board for a rabbit. You have to help the rabbit collect all the carrots in each level. The carrots travels in three rows at the upper part of the screen. When all carrots in a row has been collected you get some bonus points: 100 points for the lowest row, 500 points for the middle row and 1000 points for the highest row. As you progresses through the levels the number of carrots in the rows increases.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got bonus for clearing a row

title: Rabbit Jump

description:
Querg Draughts is a checkers game in medium resolution written in C for one player.

The game can be played at 11 different difficulty levels. At level one the computer may use 0,5 seconds to calculate it's next move and at level 11 it may use 4 minutes. To make a move just click on the piece you want to move and then on the square you want to move it to. Only legal moves are allowed. If you change your mind after clicking on a piece just click on it again to cancel the move.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to make an illegal move

title: Querg Draughts

description: Dynabusters is a multiplayer bomb'em-up game for up to six players which reminds a lot of Dynablaster. To win you have to survive until all other players are dead. You can only die from the fire of a bomb. Sometimes items can appear under stones destroyed by bombs. At the beginning of the game you can place one bomb and it has a range of two squares, both bombs and their range can be increased by collecting power-up's. Skull power-up's have negative effects that lasts for about a minute, bottles causes the same effects as the skulls but only lasts for 20 seconds. Picking up a clock power-up will cease any negative effects immediately. The game comes with several level layouts.
title: Dynabusters

description:
Caesar is a strategy game written GFA Basic 3 that takes place during the days of the Roman empire. The game starts in 200 B.C. and you can take control of one of the following states: Bosphorus, Carthage, Macedonia, Persia, Rome or Venetia. The aim of the game is to annihilate the other palyers. But it is not as easy as just to wage war on your enemies, you have to manage your economy, buy and sell food, recruit soldiers for your armies and build ships.

When it's the players turn he/she have three moves; these move can be spent on attacking other provinces, raising armies, building ships or negotiate with other empires. Each turn represents a season, so there is four turns per year. Certain actions are only available in certain seasons, you can for example only fortify a province in the summer. At the end of each round a summary is given; the status of every player is given in a global index, considering countries, capitals, ships, troops, population, gold and corn. The player with the highest index, shown graphically and in figures, is winning. The index also decides the order of play. To win the game 180 index points, or more than 7 capitals are needed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Enter name and select contry to play

title: Caesar

description:
Darklyte is a turn based combat game written in STOS. You control a team of four droids who are fighting four computer controlled droids. The play area consists of 9x9 square with metal-, grass- and pit-tiles. The pits can not be passed. In the right corner of the screen you can see what weapon current droid is carrying, how many moves it has left and how much health it has. In the left corner an arrow indicates which droid you control at the moment. At the left side of the screen you have four icons: attack, end turn, scan enemy and use item. Each of the droids has six items. They can be used at any time, and when you do so they turn dark grey to show they have been used up. The six items are:

  • An injection: Restores the droids energy.
  • A microchip: This gives the droid 9 moves.
  • A powerglove: This gives the droid a greater damage on the next attack.
  • A shield: Better defence when you are next attacked.
  • A target: This makes the enemy droids confused.
  • A skull: This gives the droid an advantage in the next attack round.

When you destroy a droid, the players droid will receive some gold and experience points. When you have killed all enemy droids in a level the exit (in the form of stairs leading down) will appear. If your commander droid is destroyed it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of my droids got killed

title: Darklyte

description: Aliens is a turn based combat game inspired by the movie with the same name. You take control of the eight marines and have to get them to the exit. The game consists of three levels and at level one you must get at least four to the exit and at level two and three two men. Aliens will appear continuously until you finish the level. Your marines are armed with either pistol, machine-gun, shotgun or flamethrower. How much damage they do and how far they reach depends on if you let them aim the weapons before firing; for example a pistol does 2 damage at range one unaimed and 6 damage aimed. On level two and three you may also use grenades. When an alien is hit by anything, except the flamethrower, there will be an acid splash which may hurt nearby marines.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of my marines is almost at the exit

title: Aliens

description:
World Fighting Championship is a versus fighting game written in GFA Basic 3.5. Nine of the worlds greatest fighters have entered the world fighting championship, all with the goal to become the champion. The player can choose among three of them to play.

The game has a standard fighting game structure: win two rounds to win a match in order to continue. When the player character gets hit, his special power meter increases; when it reaches the top, the fighter can execute a power attack.

sample_screenshots.caption: The match is about to beging

title: World Fighting Championship

description:
Blat is a one player freeware block game that resembles Columns. As in Columns blocks in groups of three falls from the top of the screen and you have to arrange them into sequences of 3 or more, either horizontally, vertically or diagonally. Sequences of 4 or 5 gives more points. Created sequences does not disappear all at once; if you manage to create more than one the game starts with eliminating the sequence that starts highest up to the left and moving from left to right. so if you have a horizontal sequence and a diagonal sequence booth starting at the same square you will only get points for the horizontal one and if you create a diagonal sequence and a vertical one you will only get points for the diagonal one.

To make the game more interesting there are plenty of special blocks such as dynamites, flames, clocks, hammers, and so on. Different levels have different sets of blocks, from the standard square ones to pieces that looks like they are from Pipedream/Pipe Mania. If the situation looks grim you could always use the smart bomb to ease things up.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level one is about to start
A lot of blocks and two sticks of dynamite

title: Blat

description:
Match is a matching game written in GFA Basic where you have to match stone tiles so that you could draw a line between them. Two similar stones can be removed if they are:* Adjacent

  • Connect-able via a line
  • Connect-able via a line with one edge
  • Connect-able via a line with two edges

The game has three game levels:* Level 1, Stage 1-11: Easy to difficult

  • Level 2, Stage 1-4: Predefined levels
  • Level 3, Stage 1-?: Changing stone-sets, random sizes

The game runs on time and when the time is up it's game over

sample_screenshots.caption: The computer is precalculating a level, probably to make sure that it's solvable

title: Match

description:
Oh No! Not More Radioactive Mineshafts! is a collect'em-up game for one player. You have been dumped at the bottom of a huge mineshaft and in order to escape you must escape from each level of this gigantic mineshaft. To complete a level you must do one of two things: either collect as many of the blocks as possible or collect a specific number of each coloured block within the time limit.

Blocks of different colors falls from the top of the screen down to the bottom and then slides to the left or right. The blocks has to be collected in the air by hitting them with your head or you will lose a life. Blocks appear at random so there is no guarantee that you can collect the right combination of blocks to complete the level. The faster a block moves the more points it gives.
title: Oh No! Not More Radioactive Mineshafts!

description:
H Mec 2 is the sequel to H Mec and a Pac-Man clone. After the first game our hero retired to France and thought that the adventures were over. But now the ghosts are back and they want to electrocute H Mec.

The aim of the game is to collect as many pills as possible and complete as many mazes as possible. Beware of the ghosts and traps. To earn lots of points you have to be fast, if you don't collect a pill within 5 seconds from the last one points will start getting deducted from your total score and if you are really slow you will lose a life. Walls can hide bonuses, such as extra time, level warp or an extra life.
title: H Mec 2

description: The Original is a Boulder Dash clone for 1-4 players. The game comes with 90 levels and in each of them you have to collect a specific amount of gems before the level exit opens. You have three lives at the beginning and if you get hit by a gem, boulder or monster you lose a life. You have to complete each level within the time limit or you lose a life.
title: The Original

description:
England Team Manager is a management game for one player where you lead the English national football team.

In the competition your team will face nine other teams and the nation that is top of the league at the end of the game will be declared champions. To lead your team to victory you must take care in setting up your team and train them well. The game is completely menu driven and you make your choices by pressing the appropriate key.

sample_screenshots.caption: The odds does not look good
Manager's records. I'm a lousy manager

title: England Team Manager

description:
Smash Hit is a tennis game for one player.

You can choose between thee difficulty levels: Easy, Tough, and Far out man! Your opponent can use one of three playing styles: Defensive, All-round, and Aggressive. You have a top down view of the tennis court and you always play the guy in white closest to the bottom of the screen. A game can consist of one, two, or five sets.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ball is in the air

title: Smash Hit

description: Roll 'N Nudge is a basic four wheel fruit machine simulator for one player. You start with 40 coins. Some wheel combinations enables the nudge option so that you can move the wheels a bit, other combinations enables the hold option and some even lets you gamble for high prizes, but the gambling option may backfire and make you lose some coins. When you run out of coins you may restart with 40 new coins or exit to GEM.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm holding the three melons and hope for the best
The gambling option in action, x4 would not be bad to get.

title: Roll 'N Nudge

description:
Fruity is a three wheel fruit machine simulator for one player written in 68000 machine code. At the start of the game you may decide how many coins you'll start with, you may select any value between 1 and 999. The wheels spin in turns, first the left one and last the right one. When you have a winning combination you may collect the coins or select to gamble with them (except if you win £2). Certain wheel combinations allows you to use the hold option. There is a random nudge feature which gives you up to five nudges in an upward direction.

A number of fruits have numbers superimposed on them, these numbers will cause the digits on the feature line to light up. If the "Feature held" light appears the feature line will be held for the next go. If you manage to reach 15 the feature game will start, here you can win one of three prizes:* Cash plus: stop the middle wheel five times. All numbers superimposed on fruits will add x 10 p to the current win.

  • Skill stop: Stop the middle wheel on a fruit and win the amount that a line of that fruit gives.
  • Next win: Makes a row of the fruit the first wheel stands on and you win that amount of money.
title: Fruity

description: Fruit Machine is a four wheel fruit machine simulator for one player. You start the game with £2.00 and every spin costs 10p. When you get a winning combination you may choose to collect the money, save it or gamble with it; if you choose to gamble there is a 1/2 chance of losing or double it. If you win the gamble you may try again and again until you either lose the money or selects one of the other options. Certain wheel combinations allows you to use the hold option. The money you can win each spin ranges from 10p to £10.

sample_screenshots.caption: What should I do with the money I won?

title: Fruit Machine

description: ST Keno is a keno simulation in low or high resolution for one player. You may select 1 to 15 out of 80 numbers and hope that yours will be selected when the computer chooses the 20 winning ones. You start with $1000 in cash and may bet between $1 and so much money you have each game. Depending on how many numbers you have selected the number of needed correct one varies from 1 to 7. Selecting more numbers gives you chance to win more money. Once you win you may choose to try to double the money won; you have to guess if the number the computer selects will be odd or even.

sample_screenshots.caption: Time to put down my numbers

title: ST Keno

description:
Quest for Tanda is a RPG based on Robert Asprins Myth-series written in GFA Basic.

You are one of Aahz's knights and his daughter, Tanda, has been kidnapped. It is the evil Istvan who is behind it and he is demanding a ransom of 1.000.000 gold. Now it's your job to rescue her. You can choose to play one of three characters: Skeeve, Garkin or Frumple. Your adventure takes place in the land of Khlad, a land with two castles and six towns. A grid divides the map into 8 x 7 squares. At the games main menu you can select you desired action: Rest, Eat, Drink, Move, Cast spell, check your stats or remind yourself of your quest. After each move there might be a fight.

There are two difficulty settings; hard and easy. If you select hard you have to search for the boat (Istvan lives on an island) by going to various towns and listen to the hints the towns people offers you. If you select easy you can ignore that and go straight to the town on the North Peninsula and someone there will tell you how to defeat Istvan.

sample_screenshots.caption: This ransom note is the first thing you see in the game

title: Quest for Tanda

description:
Night Crawlers is a game for one to four players who has to guide their worms so that they get as much points as possible.

The game board consists of 400 dots arranged so that each dot has six neighbors. The board wraps on all sides. Worms eat their way from dot to neighboring dot leaving a trail behind them. A worm can not follow the trail left by another worm but must strike out in a new direction. If a worm takes the last trail leading from a dot it wins one point. If a worm enters a dot which has no free exit lines it dies.

Even the human controlled worms act autonomously, but if they encounter a situation that's new to them they will wait for input from the player. The input will be stored in the worms memory so that it can recall how to act in that situation in the future. Each worm has a memory that makes it able to remember how it should act in given situations. Every worms memory can be erased. If computer controlled worms encounter a situation they don't recognise they will act at random.

sample_screenshots.caption: It isn't easy at this point

title: Night Crawlers

description:
Cadenza Bog is a word game in medium or high resolution for one player. You have to make words out of 16 letters that are selected at random (but the probability that a letter appears is directly proportional to to the number of times that it appears in the dictionary file). The letters are arranged in cubes in a 4 x 4 pattern. Words must be formed from adjacent cubes and no cube can be used more than once. Every Cube has at least three and at most eight adjacent cubes.

When you think you found all possible words press quit and see if the computer can beat you. A limitation is that the computer only can find words with at most six letters in them while a human player can find words with up to eight letters. The dictionary contains 2400 words, but it is possible to switch it with a larger one. The game is written in OSS Personal Pascal 2.0.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting a game in medium resolution

title: Cadenza Bog

description:
ST Krak is a colorful break-out game for one player.

Every level has two passages at the upper part of the screen, one to the left and one to the right. If there is an arrow here you can use the passage to go to the next (right) or previous (left) level. You can of course also advance to the next level the usual way; by eliminating all removable bricks from the level. Certain bricks give special bonuses, such as black ones which enables your ball to cut through the bricks like a hot knife cuts butter. If you take too long to complete a level a thing will appear and start to move around the screen; every tile it touches will be altered.

A level editor enables the player to create his/her own levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: That thing to the left changes all bricks it comes in contact with.
Level two. Those grey bicks are indestructible

title: ST Krak

description:
The Obscure Naturalist is a text adventure created with STAC.

The game is set in the early summer and at the start you are sitting on the head wall of a dam enjoying the nature. Suddenly a large and very rare Heron flies over your head. You follow it's flight with your binoculars and you see that it has a nest and young chicks. If you could get a close-up picture of them it would make you world famous. The aim of the game is to get to the island where the nest is and take that photo.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is what you see when you start

title: The Obscure Naturalist

description:
Coarse Angler is a one player fishing simulator written in STOS. The idea with the game is to provide an amusement for seasoned anglers and a good introduction to coarse fishing for the beginner.

From the games main menu you may select to practice, play a match or specimen hunt. There are 12 locations to fish from in the game. Among the locations are a river, a pond and a canal. If you choose to practice you may fish at any of the locations, during a match however, you are given a location. During specimen hunt you are only suppose to catch one given type of fish.

The in-game screen is split in two main parts: the fishing view to the left and the equipment window to the right. You have a plethora of equipment to experiment with, such as 10 hook sizes, four rod types and so on. As bait you may use maggots, luncheon meat, bread and so on. A log keeps track of your catches and records, etc.

sample_screenshots.caption: A lake with a house in the vicinity

title: The Computer Coarse Angler

description:
The Village is a text adventure created with STAC.

You are a computer expert who have been hired to work on a secret project. The project is so secret that everyone who work on it lives in a highly protected village. You have been working there for three years and you contract is near it's end when you notice how some of your colleagues disappears. There are rumors about a termination programme floating about. You must now escape from the village as soon as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: It seems you have been locked out from your own house
Shifty tries to sell you a dock pass

title: The Village

description:
Hostile Reception is a multi screen shoot'em-up game written in STOS.

You must destroy the evil Slians and restore peace to the planet. You fire you gun to the left and may move between screens by moving your ship to that side of the screen you desire to move to. Some aliens gives power-ups when destroyed. The game can be played at four different difficulty levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is what happens when you try to play at the lowest level of difficulty
Game over, but I got a high score

title: Hostile Reception

description:
Super Break-Out is a break-out game in high resolution for one player.

The game features 40 different bricks and many power-ups/bonuses and several types of monsters. Bonuses are marked with letters or numbers and will fall down if you hit the right brick. Among them you may find two or five extra balls, lots of bonus points and kill all the monsters.

You get 100 points for every normal brick you hit, 2500 points for completing a level, 400 points for each bonus you catch and 100 points for every monster you kill.

When you lost all your bats you are given the choice to either continue at the last level, start new at the beginning or quit

With the included level editor anyone can make his/her own levels.
title: Super Break-Out

description:
Leonid is a Tetris clone in high resolution for one player written in GFA Basic.

At the main menu the player may select whether they want to play with pieces consisting of four or five blocks, which level setup they would prefer (there are eight to choose from), and how fast the pieces should drop.

The main game screen is divided into three parts: the actual Tetris game is to the left, the score and such things are in the middle, and to the right is a picture of Leonid Brezhnev (other communist leaders may also appear). Every block has a circle on it that marks the point of rotation.

Players can use the mouse to shoot at the blocks to make them disappear or at the picture of Brezhnev. Shooting at the picture gets players extra bonus points, but shooting at blocks decreases their score.

sample_screenshots.caption: This levels starting setup makes it rather difficult

title: Leonid

description:
Quatris is a puzzle game for one player coded in STOS.

The aim of the game is to stop the quats from filling the play-room. A quat is a square block and it can be of one of four different types. The quats falls into the play-room in groups of four (arranged as a square) and they can be destroyed in two different ways: either by forming a 2x2 box of similar quats or by forming a line of at least four similar quats (lines may be horizontal, vertical or diagonal). Forming lines gives more points.

The game ends when the time runs out, or when the play-room gets totally flooded with quats.
title: Quatris

description:
Cyberstorm is a one player shoot'em-up game coded in 68000 assembler.

You have decided to take on the Imagons. The game starts at The Sea of Mesopotamia and you are armed with a laser, three smart bombs and a cloaking device. You start the game with three lives. The gameplay reminds much of that in Defender; you can steer your space ship to the left or right and at the bottom of the screen you have a scanner that shows where the enemies are. When you have destroyed all enemies in a level you advance to the next one.

sample_screenshots.caption: That thing under my ship fires when I fire
Starting the game. Nice colour scheme

title: Cyberstorm

description:
Darklyte II is a turn based combat game written in STOS and the sequel to Darklyte.

Your mission is to destroy the Darklyte forces. You take control of four droids and in every level you need to wipe out the enemy team and protect your commander droid. If you lose the commander droid it's game over. The levels in the game consists of a 9x9 grid of squares. Many of the squares contain puzzle elements. There are a number of pits, water, lava, and colour coded squares. There are also message squares about which can yield clues. The game comes with 4 worlds with a total of 22 levels.

Every time you make a successful attack you droid will be awarded with a specific number of experience points and gold. At the left side of the screen there are six icons: Attack, End turn, Transfer gold, Scan enemy droid, Use equipment, and Show droid statistics.

In the original game there were six items that the droids could equip, now you have 12 items to play with:

  • High power energy injection: Gives the droid full energy
  • Acceleration chip: Gives the droid 9 moves.
  • Power canisters: Gives the droid extra damage capabilities for 1 attack.
  • Shield: Gives the droid greater defence capabilities for 1 defend.
  • Confuser: Enemy droids will move towards the top of the grid and not to a players droid.
  • Skull of banishment: Gives the droid 30 points of extra damage, next attack.
  • Cloaking shield: For the next 3 turns enemy droids will have an 80% chance of not attempting to attack a cloaked droid.
  • Teleport lines: Two of your droids may change place.
  • Smart bomb: All enemy droids lose half their hit points. Wont work on last level.
  • Devastator: An enemy will lose 2 armour if successfully hit by a droid.
  • Cloud killer: Click on an enemy droid and it loses 20 energy units.
  • Lightning: For 3 attacks the droid has 20 extra damage capabilities.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of my droids bites the dust

title: Darklyte II

description:
Quizz is a quiz game in medium resolution for one player written in GFA Basic.

The game comes with 59 questions and every question has four possible answers. The points you get from answering a question decreases with time. The maximum points that can be earned from answering a question varies between the difficulty levels: novice = 10, regular = 20 and professional = 30. The questions can be edited within the program and you can also load you own files with questions.
title: Quizz

description:
Trivia Master is a quiz game in medium resolution for one player written in OSS Personal Pascal.

A game consists of 10 questions and to every question you get four possible answers; if you select the wrong one a beep sounds and you are presented with the right answer. For every right answer you get 10 points. The questions are stored in a plain text-file so anyone can write his/her own set of questions and load them into the program.
title: Trivia Master

description:
Manical Drop is a puzzle game for one or two players based on Magical Drop from Data East. This is a puzzle game in which different blocks are falling down and you must match at least three blocks of the same type to make them disappear and to prevent them from crushing you. The player is running sideways on the bottom of the screen, and is moving the blocks to make them change shapes and match each other. The player can hold several blocks of the same type at once.

In single player mode the width of the game area can be set to any value between three and 19, in two player mode it can be set to any value between three and nine. Special blocks can be turned on or off before the game starts

The game is written in C and uses the GODLIB by Reservoir Gods.

sample_screenshots.caption: A two player game with the smalles play area

title: Manical Drop

description:
Asteroidia is a Asteroids clone for one player. You start with five lives and gain one extra for every 20.000 points collected. You earn points by destroying as many asteroids as possible.

Instead of having a one screen game area with wrapping edges you can travel as far as you want in any direction without ever leaving the game area. Now and then alien ships will appear and they will shoot at you or chase you. Asteroids can give you between 50 and 200 points. Some times bonus items such as the shield restorer or the space guy (gives 1000 points if collected) can appear.
title: Asteroidia

description: Multi Pakman is a multiplayer Pac-Man clone. Two players (or one and the computer) competes for the highest score. The game features three kinds of special items: score bonuses, the question mark and death. If you run across a question mark you may get one of several different bonuses, such as reversed joystick controls or extra points. If you run across the death item you lose a life. If the time runs out before the lives runs out it's on to the next level and the same thing happens if all the dots are eaten. Once it's game over you get to see player statistics and the high score table.
title: Multi Pakman

description:
Trivia Quiz is a quiz game in medium resolution for one or two players written in GFA Basic.

Every question you get has four possible answers, a right answer is awarded with 10 points. The game comes with 150 questions. At the beginning of the game you may choose to play a game with all the questions, half of them or with only 1/4 of them.
title: Trivia Quiz

description:
X-Trivia is a quiz game in medium resolution for one player written in C.

A game can consist of 10, 25 or 50 questions. Subjects are loaded from file and the game comes with four of them: General, History, Sport and TV. Every question has four possible answers. Once every question has been answered you get to see the results.
title: X-Trivia

description: STrivia is a humorous quiz game for one player written in BASIC. Every question has five possible answers. The game comes with only three questions but the question sets are stored in plain text files so it is easy to create home made question sets.
title: STrivia

description: Wheel of Fortune is q quiz game written in GFA Basic that simulates the famous TV game show , where you guess letters until you can guess the phrase (a phrase can be "Thing", "Title", "Person", etc.). A game can be played by two or three players and consists of three rounds. The game come with 20 puzzle files and every file contains 104 puzzles.
title: Wheel of Fortune

description: Sliding Puzzler is a sliding puzzle game written in GFA Basic. The game loads any Neochrome or Degas picture that the player enters and divides it into squares that are then shuffled.

sample_screenshots.caption: Status box, I have not made any moves yet. (a picture from the game ST Vegas is used as illustration)
Time to start (a picture from the game ST Vegas is used as illustration)
The picture has been scrambled. (a picture from the game ST Vegas is used as illustration)

title: Sliding Puzzler

description: Chain Reaction is a Columns clone for one or two players. Blocks falls down from the top of the screen in groups of three. Combine three or more blocks of the same color in lines to get points. The more blocks you can remove a time the more points you get. At the earlier levels you can rotate the blocks to best suit your needs but this is not possible on later levels. The game can be played at three levels of difficulty. The harder the game the more colors you have to deal with. Every difficulty level has it's own high score table.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the high score tables
A game at the hardest difficulty level

title: Chain Reaction

description: ST Vegas is a collection of five common casino games: Roulette, Poker, Black Jack and Slots. At the start of the game you have $500. Bet limits are $20 for poker, $200 for Black Jack & Roulette and $5 for slots. The game's graphics are heavily inspired by Vegas Gambler.

sample_screenshots.caption: First hand and I got Black Jack

title: ST Vegas

description: Mr Dice is a puzzle game written in STOS. You control Mr Dice at the bottom of the screen and you have to arrange dice in the right combination to make them disappear and get points. By removing dice in specific order you can create combos which gives you extra points. You may choose freely how many eyes it should be on the die you are about to use. As the game progresses the dice will move downwards and when they reach the bottom of the screen it's game over.
title: Mr Dice

description: Blokdrop is a one player Tetris clone. Block falls down from the top in formations of four at a time. You gain points for forming horizontal lines of blocks (which then disappears). Before a game starts you may select on which level you want to start (1-9) and how many levels of blocks that should already be in play (0,4,7,10 or 14).

sample_screenshots.caption: At the beginning of level one

title: Blokdrop

description:
Valgus is a one to two player Tetris clone. In every level you have to clear a specific number of lines and when this is done you get bonus based on how many completely free lines it is to the top of the game area. Levels after level one will already have blocks in them when you begin. In two player mode the player who finish a level first will get an extra 1000 points bonus.

In this game the block formations has names such as Bosco, Iggy and Tyrone.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game over, but I got a high score!
A two player game in progress

title: Valgus

description:
Blox is a puzzle game where you have to form rings of hexagons.

You place your pieces on the center structure to make rings. Complete rings disappear which causes the board to collapse in. You keep placing pieces until there's no more room on the board for a piece, at which point it's game over. Pieces come out from six different directions, the current direction switches automatically but you can also change it manually.

If you get stuck you can force the inner ring to collapse by nuking the board. You start out with three nukes and get a free one every 5000 points.

The game has two difficulty levels; at novice the hexagons comes in groups of three, at standard they come in groups of four. There are three types of hexagons: normal ones with color, indestructible ones that are white and heavy ones which are clear with a white outline. The last two hexagons prevent rings from collapsing.
title: Blox

description: Kubes is a puzzle game written in STOS where you have to arrange falling blocks of similar colors into groups. When you get a vertical or horizontal group it will disappear and you get some points. When the blocks reaches the top of the game area it's game over. Before the game starts you may select which level to start on and how many blocks a group has to have before it disappears. You can not move individual blocks but you can move whole rows; move the marker to the row you want to move and then use the keys to move that row to the left or right.
title: Kubes

description: Warzone is duel game written in STOS for up to six players. The aim of the game is to destroy the other players guns before the get you. Every turn you choose ammunition, set the angle and power of you gun and fire. Every player can have up to three guns.
title: Warzone

description:
Mission X is a vertically scrolling shooter in which you pilot an air plane.

The game features four levels with lots of both airborne and ground based enemies. Many of the enemies produces power-ups when destroyed, but not all power-ups are useful. When you lose a life a powerful explosion will erase all enemies within a certain range to give you a fighting chance when continuing with your mission. You start with three lives and with every 10.000 points you gain an extra life.

The game is written in Pure C and assembler and works both in low and high resolution.

sample_screenshots.caption: Going down in flames (High resolution mode)

title: Mission X

description: In the game similar to Moon Blaster, you are a pilot of ground-skimming jet sent on the surface of some dark hostile planet to eliminate the enemies blasting them off. There are four kinds of enemies determined by brain and force in 4-points scale, and you may assign them before the start of your mission. Sitting in the cockpit in first-person view, you may speed up or turn your jet, collect different weapons such as lasers, missiles, powers, and blast the enemy tanks or environment off. You should examine the scanner to see the directions and distances of the threats, and watch the shield level until it reaches zero.
title: Dark-Sat

description: ABC Jumble is a game in high resolution for kids where you have to order the letters in the alphabet. When you are done and all letters are in order you get to see how many moves you did it in. Help is given in two ways: by playing the alphabet song and lighting up the corresponding letter and by a help screen that shows the letters in alphabetical order.

sample_screenshots.caption: No, that's not the right order
Yes! I did it and in only 22 moves too

title: ABC Jumble

description:
Frustration is a two player word search game in high resolution.

Each player, in turn, tries to create words from a random combination of letters spread over an 11x11 grid. How many point you get for a word depends on how long it is (the longer the better), you must also have created the word within the time limit or you will score zero points in that turn. Each game lets you build 10 words. Words can only be constructed from adjacent letters and each letter square may only be used once per word.

The game has three difficulty levels. At the easies level you have 99 second to build a single word and it may have a length of 1 to 11 letters. At the normal level you have 50 seconds to build a single word which has to have at least 3 letters in it. At the hardest level you have 25 seconds to construct a word with at least 4 letters in it. Words may only be used once per game and singular and plural are counted as different words.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm suffering from lack of imagination

title: Frustration!

description: Wordbid is a one player word guessing game. At the beginning of each round you get to know how many letters the current word has and how many vowels there are in the word. You start the game with $200 in cash and for every wrong guess you lose $20 and for every right guess you earn $10. If you think you can guess the whole word press enter and type it. If you guessed right next round starts. The game is over when you run out of cash.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is not going my way.

title: Wordbid

description: Mumbo Jumbo is a one player word guessing game in high resolution. Before you start a game you may choose how many letter the word should consist of; it may be any value between 3 and 12. Then the computer presents you with the word with the letters mixed up. You job is now to type in the correct word. Puzzles can be printed or saved to disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is a hard one to solve...

title: Mumbo Jumbo

description: Bridge-it! is a two player board game written in GFA Basic. The aim of the game is to cross from one side to the other before your opponent. You have to construct a bridge between your two sides (red player has to construct the bridge between the top and bottom of the screen and yellow player between the left and right side of the screen). Each player has 20 bridge pieces to play with. The game area has 60 squares in it; 30 red and 30 yellow. The players build their bridges between these squares. Once a bridge piece has been placed it can not be removed and the other player can not pass it.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game is about to start.

title: Bridge-it!

description: Dominoes is tile laying game for low or high resolutions. Despite the name this game has nothing to do with the original domino game, instead being based on the same concept as KaleidoKubes. The aim of the game is to cover the board with coloured tiles, the colour of each tile must match all of its neighbours (including the sides of the game area). Possible moves will be displayed at all times. The game area consists of a 5x5 square without the center square.
title: Dominoes

description:
Celestial Ceasars is a space strategy/combat game in medium resolution for 1-4 players. The aim of the game is to explore as much of the grid as possible and to control as many planets as possible. The player with the highest score will win. A game can consist of any number of turns between 10 and 25. The grid consists of 20x9 squares.

Every player starts with one planet and a small fleet. In every turn you may move every fleet one square (click on a fleet, then on the destination square and then decide how many ships to send there), if you end up on an enemy planet or enemy fleet a battle will take place after the movement phase. If a player retreats from battle he/she will lose 10% of the ships in the fleet and the remaining fleet will be withheld from play for between 1 and 4 turns. After the battle phase each planet builds it's allotted number of ships (home-worlds builds 15, neutral and captured planets builds 3-6 ships). After every fifth turn a status report is displayed. The score is computed as follows: 500/controlled planet, 50/explored square and 10/ship.

sample_screenshots.caption: A new turn is about to begin.

title: Celestial Ceasars

description:
Air Traffic Controller is a one player game written in ST-Pascal for high resolution where you take on the role as an air traffic controller. The goal of the game is to keep going as long as possible. The game ends when:

  • A plane crashes, i.e. when it's altitude is zero in the wrong place.
  • A plane leaves the area at the wrong altitude or in the wrong place.
  • A plane lands instead of exiting the area and the other way around.
  • A plane lands at the wrong airport.
  • Two planes collide.

The radar displays jets as lower case letters and propeller planes as upper case letters, the digit attached to the letter is the planes altitude. Airports is marked with an 'a' and an arrow that shows the direction on which planes are supposed to take off or land. Beacons are represented by '*', you can tell a plane in advance to do something once it gets to a beacon. The active list shows you what planes are in the air, their altitude, where they are heading and whether delayed commands have been issued. Under 'holdings' you can also see what planes are waiting at airports fore take-off.

The game comes with 13 game files and since they are in plain ASCII (and explained in the manual) the player can easily construct his/her own game files.

sample_screenshots.caption: Disaser is iminent. (Plane a and C are on the same altitude)

title: Air Traffic Controller

description: Dr. Zock is a one player break-out game. You start the game with three balls and you get an extra ball for every 3000 points. The blocks are in pixel size (except red ones that are two pixels in width) and there are four types: green ones that moves when hit and gives 10 points, yellow ones that gives 15 points, blue ones that make a red brick appear and gives 25 points and red ones which gives 50 points when hit and turns into several yellow ones.
title: Dr. Zock

description: Fuffy is a Yahtzee game written in GFA Basic for 1-4 players. In every turn the player may roll the dice three times and in every roll select which dice to keep so that he/she can combine them to get the best possible score. As in the original Yahtzee-game there are 13 combinations that gives points. The game comes with a statistics part where the player can see dice and player stats.
title: Fuffy

description: Wall Street is a stock market simulation game in medium resolution written in GFA Basic. You start the game with $10,000 in cash and the goal is to make at least $1,000,000 in a year. There are 16 companies on the games stock market and if you are unsure which shares to buy you can consult one of three brokers. The brokers all have different strategies and a consultation costs $50. After each turn you are presented with the present status screen that tells you how well you are doing. At any time during the game you can have a look at the market index.

sample_screenshots.caption: A major upswing for one of the shares
This is not going too well

title: Wall Street

description:
Conqueror is a turn based strategy game for up to six players. Every turn consists of three phases:1. Reinforce armies 2. Move armies. 3. Attack enemies.

To control a square you need to have an army at that square, an army with minimum strength will do. Armies can be moved one square at a time but you cam keep moving them and conquer land until it's strength reaches zero. The game ends when there is only one player left. The game comes with a map editor and 8 ready made maps. A typical map consists of 40x24 squares and wraps horizontally. Land square are grey and water squares light blue.

sample_screenshots.caption: That square did not belong to me

title: Conqueror

description: Grandad and The Quest for The Holey Vest is an adventure game written in STOS. Grandad, who is rather old, has a habit of placing things in strange places and then forget where he has put them. One morning he wakes up and discovers that there is a bit of a nip in the air. He decides that he'll need to put on his string vest but he can't remember where it is. You have to help grandad find it. Guide grandad around his house, gather items, solve puzzles and unlock doors.
title: Grandad and The Quest for The Holey Vest

description: Grandad 2: In Search of Sandwiches is the sequel to Grandad and The Quest for The Holey Vest. It's an adventure game written in STOS. Grandad has decided that he spends far too much time indoors so today he has decided to get some fresh air. He packs his sandwiches, gets on his trike and rides down to the local park. When he gets hungry in the early afternoon he discovers that he has misplaced his sandwiches. He is sure he misplaced them somewhere in Funland and you have to help grandad find them. Guide grandad around the park and gather clues, items and solve puzzles.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is not a nice place
Is the police officer upholding the law in the park or just slacking off?

title: Grandad 2: In Search of Sandwiches

description: The object of Colony is to control more territory than your opponent. You can move your sphere one or two spaces. Any enemy spheres you land next to are converted to your color. Then it is your opponents turn. When all spaces are occupied, the one with the most wins.
title: Colony

description: Jumping Ghost is a one screen multilevel platform game where the aim of each level is to make it to the top of the screen. Every screen consists of seven lines with at least one hole in. These lines move across the screen from left to right or right to left and you have to make the ghost jump between lines to reach the top. The higher the level the more complex the pattern of holes in the lines will be and the faster the lines will move.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm well on my way to beat this level.
Level three is a lot more complex than level one.

title: Jumping Ghost

description: Atari Slalom is a kind of slalom game where you steer an Atari mouse down a track on a colorful background. The mouse wont move by itself so you have to steer it all the time. Arrows on green blocks indicates on which side you must steer the mouse. If you pass a green block on the wrong side you have to start over. A timer measures how fast you complete a course and the record time is presented at the top right corner of the screen. The game comes with five different courses and is written in 68000 assembler.
title: Atari Slalom

description: Ball Park is a labyrinth game in which you guide a red ball through 30 levels. Every level is filled with things like bonuses, one-way paths, keys, enemies, teleports and black holes. Once you move the ball it wont stop until it reaches a square with green arrows. Trying to move through a one-way path the wrong way will make the ball bounce. Hitting a key will change the direction of a one-way arrow. Every level has a time limit so you can't think for too long before you move. You start with 3 lives and now and then you gain an extra life. The game is written in STOS.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here you have to think before you move.
Second title screen and info screen
This is the first encounter with an enemy.

title: Ball Park

description:
Bandit is a simplistic three wheel fruit machine simulator written in 68000 assembler. The simulator has hold, nudge and a special shootout bonus feature, which can yield up to 90 coins.

The game features a high score list with 8 places which you will enter if you quit the simulation while you have enough coins. At the start of each game you have 5 coins.
title: Bandit

description: Bert the Squirt is a platform game written in STOS. The aim of the game is to collect all the fruit in each level. Use springs to jump and watch out for enemies (such as hedgehogs and larvae) and spikes. The game features 80 levels and each level has to be completed within the time limit.

sample_screenshots.caption: The second level is a bit tricky.

title: Bert the Squirt

description: Bomb Disposal is a puzzle game written in GFA Basic 3. The aim of the game is to disarm a bomb. You have 20 diodes which you must place in their sockets in correct order. Every diode has a number that you must match to a hidden number by placing it in the correct socket, two indicators (seq and pos) lets you know if you got the sequence and position right. Once a diode has been placed it can not be removed so a misplaced diode means that the player has to start all over again.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got it in the right place but I should not have placed it first.
Time to select a difficulty level.

title: Bomb Disposal

description:
Bug Spray is a game in which you have to protect your growing plant against hungry larvae and other insects. To fight of the insects you need to use cans of bug spray which are placed on shelves on the sides of the screen. There are three types of spray cans and they are effective against different types of insects. From time to time bonus items appears on the shelves. Once your flower bloom it's on to the next level.

You start the game with 5 lives and you gain an extra life every 10000 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: A sack of fertilizer gives bonus points.
A larvae is eating on my plant.

title: Bug Spray

description:
Carrier Attack is a BattleShip game for one player written in STOS. Both players have 10 ships: 2 carriers, 2 battleships and 6 destroyers. When starting a game you have to place all your ships on a board consisting of 20 x 7 squares; ships can be places horizontally or vertically but every ship needs to be surrounded by free squares. After placing the ships each player takes turn and tries to hit the other players ships. The first one to sink the opponents ships wins the game.

The game can be played at 10 different difficulty levels ranging from "Seaman" to "Kamikaze attack". On the hardest level the computer does three attacks every turn while you only get to do one.

sample_screenshots.caption: Found one of the computers ships.
The computer is attacking one of my carriers.

title: Carrier Attack

description:
Chiropodist in Hell is a text adventure created in STAC.

After a hang-gilder accident you are trapped in hell and your mission is to get out of there. You start the game at a mountain pass surrounded by huge mountains. The accident made you lose your memory and you have a verruca on the left foot. Many of the locations you visit in the game are illustrated with a color picture.
title: Chiropodist in Hell

description:
Clacker is a 10 level puzzle game written in STOS. Clacker is the name of the main assembly droid in the factory of the Cosmic engineers. You have to help this droid fulfill his workload. What you have to is assemble blocks (clacks) into the specific shapes required by each level. The required shape can be 3-in-a-row or Box for example. The game area consists of two 5 x 5 squares divided by the space where Clanker moves and new blocks appears. Speed is of the essence since being too slow will make Clanker lose efficiency points and if the efficiency points reaches zero it's game over.

At the left side of the screen you can see how many clanks you have left to combine and at the right side of the screen you can see the efficiency-meter.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm about to score some points.
Valid block combinations for the upcoming level.

title: Clacker

description: Invaders is a Space Invaders clone. A large group of aliens ordered in 5 rows with 9 columns moves back and forth on the screen and every time they change direction they descend a bit. The more of them you kill the faster the remaining ones will move. Kill every alien in the wave to continue to the next level. Now and then a flying saucer will travel across the screen; killing it will yield additional bonus points.
title: Invaders

description:
Glob is a collect-em-up game written in STOS.

You are trapped in Dr Car-acar-ton's clinic and to escape you need to eat all kinds of cakes and other delicacies that you find in the rooms of the clinic. The clinic has five floors and every floor has a different number of rooms. During your escape you will encounter many bonus items such as immunity, stop and speed. Keys will allow you to enter locked rooms. Certain rooms have been mined with time bombs, if you enter one of these rooms the bomb has to be disarmed before it blows or you will lose a life. Throughout the clinic monsters roam and if you touch one you will lose a life.

The floor of the clinic consists of tiles and there are many different tiles such as normal tiles (regular floor tiles that comes in many different colors), lava tiles (step on these and lose a life) and sliders (make you slide in a certain direction).

sample_screenshots.caption: A room with sliders on the floor

title: Glob

description: Clunk is a puzzle game written in STOS. The object of the game is to clear 50 rooms of blocks as fast as possible. You control the droid Clunk and have to use him to move the blocks. To remove blocks you have to place two or more blocks with the same pattern (the game features 6 different patterns) adjacent to each other. Clunk starts every level with 500 power units which will decrease over time, if you complete a level fast enough you will be able to use the remaining power units to purchase a level password and if Clunk runs out of power units it's game over.
title: Clunk

description:
Crush! is a game where you have to watch out for falling bricks.

A crane at the top of the screen tries to kill you by dropping blocks on you. You have to run around and jump to avoid the blocks and to make the crane drop them in such a way that you can climb them to escape from the level. To escape you must make at least one stack of blocks as high as the walls that surround you and then get on top of that stack. Certain blocks have markings on them that indicates that they are special in some way:* Up arrow: Makes you jump high

  • Left & right arrow: Moves you in the direction of the arrow
  • Down arrow: destroys the column it lands on
  • Red spikes: kills you if you land on it

The game is written in 68000 assembler.

sample_screenshots.caption: Blocks with a down arrow is best to have at the base.

title: Crush!

description:
Dead or Alive...? is a text adventure created using STAC. It's a rainy day and you are on your way home. You decide to take a short cut and end up in a dead end. You see a shop you've never seen before and enter it out of curiosity. The owner offers you a strange crystal that somehow renders you unconscious. The next thing you know you wake up in the street outside the shop, but the shop is gone and so are your memory of where you live. You do remember where your local pub is and decide to pay it a visit only to discover that the place has been boarded up and is soon to be destroyed. That comes as a chock to you and renders you unconscious once again, this time the man from the shop appears and say the word "midnight" before he disappears in a puff of smoke. Your mission is now to find out what is going on and what have happened to you.

Although this game was created using STAC there is no graphics that illustrates the different locations you visit.
title: Dead or Alive...?

description:
Death Camp is a text adventure created with STAC. The year is 1944 and the player is a major in the paratroop regiment. The player has been captured by the Japanese and after an unsuccessful escape attempt they have been transferred to a special prison camp call the "Death Camp". Their mission is to escape from prison camp.

Almost every location they can visit in the game is illustrated with a color picture.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the hospital, a dead body lies on one of the beds.
I tried to take some rice but that didn't go so well.

title: Death Camp

description:
Dennis & Denise is a platform game written in STOS.

Denise has been kidnapped by Mr X. and her wealthy dad has put up a large reward for her return. Dennis, who is heavily in debt, decides to rescue Denise so that he can get his hands on the reward. You have to guide Dennis through six levels consisting of five screens each. On your way through the level you have to watch out for spikes, guns and other traps and you also have to move fast since there is a time-limit for each screen. Several bonus items are spread out throughout the levels, these can for example contain money, teleport you or freeze you.
title: Dennis & Denise

description:
Detonator is a memory game written in STOS. A bomb has been discovered aboard your vehicle and it has a color sequence detonator. You will be sent a color combination that you must enter correctly to disable the bomb. The higher the level the more complex the sequence will be.

The screen is divided into two parts: to the left you have the input area which consists of 9 color buttons arranged in a 3 x 3 pattern and to the right is the status display where you see your score, current level and remaining time.

sample_screenshots.caption: I must remember to press the white button.

title: Detonator

description: Deuce is a memory game written in STOS. The game can be played at three different difficulty levels; at the easiest level you play with 6 pairs, at the middle level with 24 pairs and at the hardest level with 96 pairs. The time limit for completing a game depends on the number of pairs, more pair means more time to play.

sample_screenshots.caption: Playing with 96 pairs is rather hard.

title: Deuce

description: Dizzy Lizzy is a Boulder Dash clone written in STOS. Guide Dizzy on his quest to collect diamonds. On every level you have to collect all of the diamonds before you may continue to the next level. You have to watch out for boulders, Wayne (who will only move when you stand still), dynamite and bombs. Bombs does not go off the moment they hit an obstacle, you have about five moves before they detonate. After a bomb detonates a large area becomes impassible, so the player has to be careful not to get trapped.
title: Dizzy Lizzy

description:
Dizzy Lizzy 2 is a Boulder Dash clone and the sequel to Dizzy Lizzy written in STOS.

You have to guide Dizzy through 40 levels. Complete a level by collecting all the parcels in it. On your quest you have to watch out for snowballs, the snowman and christmas puddings, which will explode if they fall, you get about five moves to take cover. After a christmas pudding detonates a large area becomes impassible, so you have to be careful not to get trapped. If you die an impassable headstone will be left at the spot where you died.

The 40 levels are filled with special objects and special tiles:* Cake: gives bonus points.

  • Cracker: kills on contact.
  • Door: must be opened by a switch.
  • Earth: gives bonus points.
  • Ice: you can't stop while on ice tiles.
  • Key: you need this to open safes.
  • Map: displays the whole level.
  • Rebound: hitting this while sliding on ice will reverse your direction.
  • Safe: contains parcels.
  • Stocking: gives bonus points.
  • Switch: will open doors.
  • Transporter: moves the player to another place in the level.

sample_screenshots.caption: A key and at the bottom lots of christmas puddings

title: Dizzy Lizzy 2: A Winters Tale

description: Mind Warp is a Tetris clone written in STOS. Formations of three or four blocks falls from the top of the game area and you have to arrange them into lines so that they disappear. When forming the tenth line you will reach the next level. The falling speed of the block formations will increase with the level. From level three pre-placed blocks will start to appear in each level, making them trickier.
title: Mind Warp

description:
The Return of Jusse is a game set on the planet Vainox where you have to rescue survivors from a disaster.

Jusse have returned to planet Vainox to warn the inhabitants of the city Zelus-5 about a virus cloud heading their way. At the same time he also tells them how to protect themselves from the lethal virus. Unfortunately only eight persons listened to Jusse and took shelter in protective cocoons. You now have to find and collect these 8 cocoons and return them to your mother ship before the time runs out. You can only carry one cocoon at a time so you have to move quickly to collect them all.

You control your lander type ship by firing its thrusters so that you avoid contact with both ground and other obstacles, you have infinite fuel so you don't have to worry about running out of it. Use the laser to destroy sentinels and steel doors and use the grab to collect the cocoons. If the ship comes in contact with anything else than the cocoons you it will lose shield energy; to recharge the shield you have to dock with the mother ship.

sample_screenshots.caption: One cocoon safely brought to the mother ship

title: The Return of Jusse

description:
Overlord is a board game created using Talespin.

The overlord is an evil being who has been challenged by the timelords. They try to construct magical pyramids that will focus their energies so that they can beat the overlord. You are one of the timelords and you must construct the three levels that a pyramid contains. You must then also be powerful enough to warp to the top of the pyramid so that you may become the new overlord.

The board is divided into 8 squares (planes) and in the middle there is a void where the pyramid will be constructed. You start the game on square 4 with 0 energy, if you don't move to the next square on your turn you will gain one energy unit. Movement around the board is clock-wise and if you complete a lap you will gain maximum power which is 5. As your pyramid grows you will attract attention from the overlord and he might send his evil insectoids after you. An insectoid will survive for one lap an if it during that lap ends up on the same square as you you die and it's game over.

Up to four players (one for each element) compete to become the new overlord.
title: Overlord

description: Dogfight is, as the name suggests, a dogfighting game for one or two players. Player one starts on the left side of the screen and player two on the right side. Try to shot down the opponent, avoid getting hit and avoid the large airship who floats around in the airspace. If you fly too high you will lose control of the airplane and it will crash. Sometimes a truck driving at the bottom of the screen will fire a surface-to-air missile making the situation a bit harder to manage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Flying at night. A surface-to-air missile is in the air

title: Dogfight

description:
Firegame is a board game for one or two players where the objective is to collect 16 house pieces (walls, rooms, roof and windows). Several dangers lurk along the way, fire being one of them. If a fire starts you need to extinguish it using a fire pail. If no player has any buckets the fire will spread and eventually destroy all of the house pieces. If a fire has been put out burnt house pieces must be doused with an extra bucket of water before they can be acquired.

You start the game with $0. Every turn starts with a die roll then you move corresponding number of steps; if you land on a house piece you may buy it (if you have sufficient money), if you land on a fire bucket square you get a fire bucket, if you land on the fire square you start a fire, and if you land on a risk square you may choose to pick up a risk card. There are 15 different risk cards and they may have a positive or negative outcome. Every time you pass start you get $ 5000. A progress meter at the right side of the screen shows how far each player is from the goal.

sample_screenshots.caption: To bad that I don't have any cash
Tried to buy it without any cash
This option makes the game a bit easier
The computer chooses to take a risk card

title: Firegame

description:
Inspired by the meteor-storm bonus level of Deluxe Galaga, the main idea of the r0x gameplay is avoid floating rock particles in vast space. While you avoid rocks, you can increase your score by collecting treasure, save some floating astronauts and collect extra ships and bombs. Game keeps track of best highscores in Arcade mode. In addition to Arcade mode, there is also a two-player battle mode where players compete by saving the floating astronauts.

Game won the Outline 2009 demoparty's game development competition.

sample_screenshots.caption: Collect the letters for an extra ship.
Bombs clear the whole screen at once.

title: r0x

description:
Overscan Invaders is a Space Invaders clone that relies on the overscan technique giving the player 32 colors on the screen at the same time (instead of 16) and at a higher resolution than the standard one.

Gameplay is straight forward: a large group of aliens moves from side to side on the screen and you have to destroy them all before they reach the bottom of the screen. For every alien you destroy the rest will move a bit faster. Now and then a flying saucer will move across the top of the screen, shooting it will give you bonus points. You have to watch out for the aliens lasers, you have three shield blocks that will protect you but they wont last forever.

sample_screenshots.caption: New aliens appears as the game progresses

title: Overscan Invaders

description: In Scary you have to save your girlfriend from a haunted house. You control a bat and you have to avoid both traps and enemies such as ghosts and flying axes when you fly from room to room in the house. Enemies can be shot but you have limited ammunition so it is better to think first and then fire.
title: Scary

description:
Killdozers is a tank based game where you have to make your way to deliver a scientist prisoner and then rush to the exit in a limited time.The game is viewed from the top and features a full game editor where you can create new levels and play with them.

The main originality of the game is in the combat; you have three different type of weapons that give you damage to different role playing like characteristics. The blue bullets attacks the armour of the tanks, the green the shield and the red the life. When you reduce armour, shield or life points from your opponent, you increase your own. This opens up new strategic possibilities like for example, eating the shield of an opponent with green bullets to better kill it with the red ones.The opponents are able to fight together using a number of strategies.
title: Killdozers

description:
Jumble Up is a jigsaw puzzle written in STOS.

The game loads a user supplied image and creates a puzzle with 50 pieces out of it. The game can load Degas-files in both low and high resolution or low resolution Neochrom images. Left click and hold the mouse button to select and move a piece; if you drop it in the right place it will stay there, otherwise it will return to where it came from. Right clicking while playing will show you how the picture looks like unscrambled

The game comes with three pictures.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now the image starts to take form
The selected picture is totally scrambled

title: Jumble Up

description:
Operation Wimp is a simple reflex game written in STOS. The background story is that you have managed to trap the mad wargamer Evil Eddy in your computer and now he is trying to escape via one of your video games. You can not stop him but the longer you delay him the less powerful he will be when he escapes.

When you play, Eddy will charge out of the screen at you and you must then move the mouse over his head and press the left mouse button to stop his advance. If you fail to stop him he will hit the screen and bounce off. If he hits the screen too many times the screen will break and he escapes. For every time you hit him he will gain some speed.

The player can load his/her own background image or draw one in the game.
title: Operation Wimp

description: Guided Missile is an action game for two players where each player controls 8 guided missiles. The aim of the game is to destroy the opponents four installations, just press fire and try to steer the missile to a suitable target. Player one controls the bottom of the screen and player two the top part. The game was created using STOS.
title: Guided Missile

description:
Evasion 2 is a maze game where you have to collect all the dots before the time runs out. To make it harder aliens moves in the maze and if you touch them you die. After each level you are awarded with mines and extra lives. Extra lives and other power-ups (such as mines, smart bombs and freeze pills) can be gained by collecting flashing bonus tiles.

When you have completed the game once you can play it again, but this time with super-fast aliens.

sample_screenshots.caption: This looks easy, only one alien

title: Evasion 2

description:
Four-F is a puzzle game written in STOS.

Fruitman have gotten himself trapped while trying to figure out what Four-F means. You have to help him figure out what Four-F means by guide him through all the rooms and collect all the fruits. For every step Fruitman takes a bit of wall appears behind him so you cant back-track your steps.

There are two game modes: Contest and Random. In contest mode you play a 100 pre-designed levels game and the goal is to collect all the fruit. In random mode the computer will generate random levels and to complete a level you must reach the score shown in the goal field.

There are two game types: Normal and Fill-in. Fill-in enables the player to draw a picture on the screen as he/she moves Fruitman. Copy one or more Neochrome or Degas images to the game directory and it will make the game a bit more graphically interesting.

For every 1000 points you get an extra life.

sample_screenshots.caption: got to think before you move here...

title: Four-F

description: In Planet Lander you have to land your space craft within the given time. You start at 10000 feet with 5000 barrels of fuel and you must land your space craft on a platform measuring 500x500 feet within 2000 microns (the games time unit). A big arrow marks the ideal landing spot but winds makes it hard to land and you may not hit the ground with a speed over 5 feet's/micron.

sample_screenshots.caption: Data about the last game. Only 25% damage isn't that bad, or is it?
After flight analysis. I've could have done better

title: Planet Lander

description:
The Dark Wars is an RPG that takes place in a large secluded clearing in the Invar forest where four towns lies. Clerics had long believed that there was something outside this clearing but other people rejected this as fairytale stories. But when one day contact was lost with the two southern towns some people started to wonder if there was any truth in what the clerics believed. Now war broke out between the two remaining cities, Swordsblade and Eaglesmount and the situation looked very grim for Eaglesmount. But the one night the Swordsblade army got almost annihilated, survivors told the citizens of Eaglesmount that an army of evil orcs from the south had attacked them. After the two towns agreed to cease the fighting an expedition was sent south to discover what had happened to the two towns south of the Invar river. For many weeks nothing is heard from the expedition but then one day a lonely soldier stumbles into Swordsblade and utter the word "undead" before he dies. In his possession a note is found that warns the two towns of a great evil to the south and forbids anyone to travel south of the Invar river. The elders ignores this warning and a reward of 20000 bronze pieces is offered to anyone that can find out what is happening to the south and this is where the player comes into the picture. As a poor adventurer living in Eaglesmount you accept the challenge and get ready.

Before starting to play you need to generate a character; choose between four races: human, elf, dwarf or halfling and between four classes: warrior, magic user or thief. After you've generated your character you start the adventure in the easternmost town Eaglesmount. You now have to gain experience, level up, find other adventurers that want to join you in your quest and, when you are strong enough, journey south and cross the river to discover what evil lurks there. Traveling alone you won't get far so it is important to speak to other adventurers and try to convince them to join you.

The game was written in GFA Basic V2.0.

sample_screenshots.caption: You start the game looking into a corner in the local tavern
Character creation: Even warriors may use spells

title: The Dark Wars

description:
Doctor Boris is an action arcade game in which you have to defuse bombs. The game-play remind a bit of Worm-games since for every step Boris takes a wall segment appears behind him. In addition to the bomb you see sticks of dynamite and skulls on the game board; dynamite is used to blow holes in the wall that appears after Boris and skulls kills Boris on contact. In each level you have to defuse a certain number of bombs before you move on to the next level. The bomb timer starts as soon as the bomb appears in the level so the player has to act fast. Each level is randomly generated so no level will be the same.

The game is written in Fast Basic.

sample_screenshots.caption: Traveling in the wrong direction and the bomb is about to explode

title: Doctor Boris

description:
Inferno is a Boulder Dash clone written in STOS in which you have to guide a demon back to hell. In each of the games five levels you have to collect all the diamonds to continue to the next level. On your quest you have to watch out for boulders that will crush you, eggs that hatch into monsters that will block your way and skulls that will kill you on contact. You may start the game on anyone of the five levels. In each level you will see many brown safes and if you have a key you may open them and retrieve the diamond they are hiding.

The game comes with a level editor that allows the player to create his/her own levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: About to be killed by a monster

title: Inferno

description: Impulse is an action puzzle game in which you must use your laser to activate the cosmic detonator. In each screen you must first kill all the aliens before you can trigger the detonator. When firing your laser it will bounce against the walls until it hits something, a switch, an alien, the detonator or yourself (in which case you lose a life) speed is of the essence in this game so the player both have to aim good and fast. You can't aim your laser gun directly so instead you have to hit rotators that will absorb you laser until you press the fire button when they will release the beam in the direction they are currently pointing.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting level one. This level features four aliens and two rotators

title: Impulse

description: Llamazap is an action game of 25 stages in which you, as a completely hard and unspeakably beweaponed llama, set out to destroy invading alien hordes and protect innocent herbivores from molestation. Usually you fly a spaceship over a bi-directionally scrolling planet, but frequently you must leave the safety of your ship for tentacle-to-hoof combat with your enemies. Your aim is to battle your way through to defeat the last boss on the last level and thereby save the Galaxy and make it a safer place for ungulates everywhere. Along the way you can earn extra kudos by rescuing abducted livestock, saving the dolphins, and rescuing lost and bewildered llamas.
title: Llamazap

description:
Match It is a tile matching game written in 68000 assembler. Match all the tiles in the level to move on to the next level. Tiles can only be matched if a line with at most two corners can be drawn between them.
