There are two types of special tiles: flowers and seasons removing two flowers or season tiles will stop the game timer for some seconds. If you get stuck you have two help options you can use by pressing the help-key. If you complete a level without using any of the help options you will be given one extra as a bonus. Unused help options will be added to the score at the end of the game. The game runs on time and when the time is up it's game over.

The game comes bundled with its source code.
title: Match It

description: First assemble your rocket by collecting the three rocket pieces with your jetpack, then fill it with fuel by collecting fuel drums with your jetpack and finally blast off with your rocket to the next level. After the first level the rocket is already in working condition so all the player has to do is to fill it up with fuel. While picking up pieces of the rocket and fuel drums the player has to defend him-/her-self against an onslaught of countless aliens coming from the left and right. Now and then bonus items will drop down from above and they will give the player extra ammo, extra point and such things. The game features 50 one-screen levels and was coded in 68000 assembler.

sample_screenshots.caption: The level loading screen announces a new type of enemy: Bouncing Bubbles
The sphere around the jetpac guy protects him from the enemies.

title: Jetpac

description:
Paco has become stranded on the planet Mineoes and since he is broke he has to collect gems to afford the ticket home. In each level there is a certain number of gems you have to collect before an exit opens up at the bottom of the screen and you can move on to the next level (collecting all the gems will earn you bonus points). If you discover that you can't collect the gems needed and you can climb up to the surface again you can restart the level without losing a life. As the player digs through the levels care must be taken so that he or she doesn't get caught in a hole that Paco can't climb up from (Paco can only climb upwards if he has dirt or brick walls on both sides of him).

The game is written in STOS and comes with a level editor.

sample_screenshots.caption: This will be a bit tricky

title: Paco and the Tunnels of Doom

description: Flipped: Micro Cars Edition is a puzzle game in which the player must flip tiles so that every tile on the board is of the same color. The game board consists of 9 x 9 tiles and they can be yellow, blue or red. Below the tile board there are three 3 x 3 tile patterns that determines how tiles will be flipped. The player clicks on one of these patterns and then on the game board to flip the selected tiles. Blue tiles will flip to yellow, Red to blue and yellow to red. The game features 100 levels but no time limit so the player can take his time to think about the next move.

sample_screenshots.caption: This level requires a little more thought

title: Flipped: Micro Care Edition

description: First Dominoes is a computer implementation of the classic game dominoes. The game uses a double nine set of dominoes (each rectangular tile has 0 to 9 dots on both long ends). One human can play against up to four computer opponents. The players takes turns placing one of their tiles on the table. Tiles must connect so that the dots on the edges matches. When a player can't place any of his tiles he has to pass. The game ends when a player has no more tiles left on hand or when no more tiles can be placed on the board, in the later case the winner is determined by the number of dots on the remaining tiles: the player with the least dots on his tiles wins the round.

sample_screenshots.caption: Playing with a different color scheme

title: First Dominoes

description:
Headlong is a game where you have to navigate a fast moving space ship through narrow passages.

The evil Magnaran people are planing to strip a rich planet of its resources and then destroy it. To stop their evil plan a skillful mercenary (the player) are hired to infiltrate their base on the moon Signus and destroy it with a fission bomb. Getting in was easy but when the ship breaks down the mercenary steals one of the Magnarans ships and it is now up to the player to get out of the base before the fission bomb goes off. The ship is armed with a laser so smaller walls can be shoot to pieces. Once the ship gets going there is no way to slow down. The player must escape from the enemy base before the time runs out (the bomb explodes) or he/she runs out of fuel.

sample_screenshots.caption: The sparks from my right wing means that I was a little to close to the right wall
Lots of space at the beginning

title: Headlong

description: Horse Racing Simulator is a management game where the player manages his own racing horse stable. Buy and sell horses, see to that they are cared for, set them up for races and make money. Each day there are three races that the players horses can participate in. Once it is race time the player may choose to bet on one horse in each race. Before the game starts a number of auto races can be completed, this is a feature that will build up accurate form for the horses. Each player starts the game with £ 20000 and when the money runs out it's game over.
title: Horse Racing Simulator

description:
Super Scramble is a clone of Konami's Scramble with a few differences. As in the original game the player flies a space ship through a cave system filled with missiles that launch from the ground. But unlike the original game the player has to battle an end of level boss in the form of a space snake after each level (6 in total) except after the last level when the player has to battle the evil darklord himself. The ship is armed with a forward mounted gun and laser bombs. At the top of the screen the player can see number of lives left, score and fuel status. The player has to destroy fuel drums to keep his ship supplied with fuel.

The background story is that the evil darklord Zargor has conquered the galaxy and that their are only a couple of thousand humans left. They have created a spaceship named Cobra so powerful that it can destroy the darklord himself and it is of course the players task to pilot this powerful ship.

The game was created using STOS.

sample_screenshots.caption: Taking out those fuel drums will be a walk in the park

title: Super Scramble

description:
In Phoenix the player has to re-open 15 hyperspace routes which where previously closed by the authorities. Unfortunately they used mines to prevent illegal movements...

The game is played in a first-person perspective with vector graphics. The space ship moves with a constant velocity and the player's job is shoot the mines on the way and to steer left and right so he avoids obstacles. But it is important to be careful: leaving the road causes the space ship to fall out of the hyperspace and lose a life. The game records the last flight which can be used for analyzing and memorizing purposes.

sample_screenshots.caption: High score table (in this case surely without me)
Even on monochrome I fail again (Monochrome monitor)

title: Phoenix

description:
Bellum Internecinum is a Galaga style shot-em-up game in which the player has to destroy as many aliens as possible.

Aliens appears in rows of 5 and moves horizontally on the screen. Now and then one or more aliens break formation and makes suicidal attack runs towards the player. As the game progresses the aliens moves faster, makes more suicidal attack runs and fires more missiles at the player. Every time the players ship takes a hit a small part of it is destroyed this continues until the ship is completely destroyed. After a few waves of aliens bonus items starts to appear, these can increase the speed of the ship, give better/faster ammo and rebuild part of the ship.

sample_screenshots.caption: There is not much left of my ship now

title: Bellum Internecinum

description:
Sharks is a hang-man game, but instead of getting hanged the player gets eaten by a shark.

Guess the word that is hidden behind the red tiles. For every wrong guess the player is moved one step closer to the water and when the player guesses wrong for the 8th time he is pushed into the water and eaten by the shark. If the player manages to guess the word a helicopter comes to the rescue. At the beginning of the game the player can choose which wordlist will be used during the game (the games comes with 14 wordlists). A game lasts for 10 rounds.

The game comes with a wordlist creator so that the player can create his/her own wordlists.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh no! The shark is comming

title: Sharks

description: Wintris is a simplistic Tetris clone. Blocks that forms geometrical shapes falls from the top of the screen. The player has to arrange them so that they form rows. Once a row is formed it will disappear and generate some points, the more rows that can be removed at once (maximum 4) the more points the player gets. If the blocks reaches the top of the game area it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen with high score table

title: Wintris

description:
Sea Fisherman is a fishing simulator in which the player takes on ten of the top anglers from Britain in the British open fishing competition. The player can choose to fish at three different beaches: Foreshore, Fishguard and Porthcawl. Each beach have it's own special characteristics. The player can choose between 5 different baits (ragworm, lugworm, peeler, sandeel and makerel), 8 different hooks and 8 different weights (1-8 oz).

This game was created with STOS.
title: Sea Fisherman

description:
Sub hunt is a shoot-em-up game between a Russian chopper (player one) and an American submarine (player two). The players compete to sink as many enemy ships as possible. There are Four different ship nationalities: Russian, American, Neutral and Iranian. Points are gained by sinking enemy ships, sinking neutral ships will subtract points from the score and sinking an allied ship will set the players score to 0. The fight can take place in three different places: The tropics, the arctic and the Persian gulf. Iranian ships only appears in the Persian gulf and are fair game for both players.

The game was written in STOS.
title: Sub Hunt

description:
Elemental is set on the planet of the same name. The player takes the role of a two-year old Roundline, basically a living ball, who has to pass the great ordeal.

Every of the 32 levels plays out on a non-scrolling field where the player has to evade two enemies and touch certain tiles. This causes objects to appear which can be picked up and dropped at another place. If an enemy touches an object, it transforms into a pill which also has to be picked up and dropped elsewhere. There are save tiles where the enemies can't touch the player.
title: Elemental

description: Verminator is a platformer in which the player takes the control of Jake, an exterminator. The basic idea is that he walks and jumps through the game world and kills all vermin he meets. A radar routes him to the infested areas and teleports help to shorten the way. Every week, indicated by a time limit, he receives money for every killed vermin and the game can be saved. Said money can be reinvested in shops to buy useful items like weapons, extra lives or a permission to use the teleports. If money runs out, he can lend it at a bank in return to heavy interests. An alternative way to gain money is gambling in the casino.
title: Verminator

description:
Intruder is a side-scrolling shooter. The player controls a space ship, flies from left to right and shoots everything on the way; preferably without dying from collisions or enemy bullets. The standard gun shoots both forward and backwards and can be upgraded by collecting power ups on the way. The game uses a gravity system: the player always needs to counter steer st avoid crashing to the ground.

Regarding power ups, the player needs to look out for symbols which have negative effects and should be avoided. Points for the high score list are also handled through power ups and shooting enemies rewards no points. Collecting an extra gives an automatic boost in one direction.

sample_screenshots.caption: Everyday's screenshot from Intruder: many enemies, many points.

title: Intruder

description: Checker is a puzzle game in which the floors of a skyscraper have to be cleaned of mystical stones. With a magnetic card the player gains access to the rooms where he can collect bombs to blow these stones up. Along the way different dangers and obstacles appear which have to be skillfully avoided.
title: Checker

description:
Marlowe is an interactive adventure game in which the player assumes the role of a private detective who has to solve a crime. The story begins in Marlowe's office where he discovers a strange letter from a vanished friend. A mysterious letter puzzle will be just the first step to find him and solve this crime story.

The screen is divided in three windows: on the left, a dialog box is displayed which describes the current game situation and enables communication with other characters. In the centered graphic window Marlowe's location is displayed, and in the aerial view floor plan on the right side the player can choose which buildings or rooms will be entered next. Along the way collected items can be managed in a graphical inventory and used when required.
title: Marlowe

description: Ultimate Tron ST is (as the name implies) a light cycles game where two players tries to navigate their light cycles so that the other player crashes (either into the wall or into the trail of the light cycle). The game speed is adjustable between 1 (very slow) and 999 (very fast). There is no fixed length of a game so the players may play as many rounds as they like. The game was written in Omikron Basic 3.5.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm about to hit the wall

title: Ultimate Tron ST

description:
The Vault is a text adventure in which the player takes on the role as a private investigator.

One day the player receives a letter from Amanda Derock, the current owner of Derock castle. She writes about the murder of her father, who was found stabbed and hung in an apple tree. The victim had a serpent etched into the upper body and a golden sword was found on the scene. It has now been a year since the murder was committed and because the police has made no progress on the case Amanda now turns to the player for help.

When the game starts the player has just arrived to Derock castle and is standing in the castles entrance hall. It is now up to the player to search the castle from top to bottom for clues so that the crime can be solved.
title: The Vault

description:
You wake up lying in the street with a severe headache and some memory loss i.e. you have no idea how you ended up there. Fortunately you still remember where you live. When you arrive at your door you notice that your key is missing and then you also notice that your wallet is missing. Then it strikes you: you have been the victim of a robbery.

AGROS is an adventure game in which the player has to reclaim his/hers stolen possessions. Search the streets of the city, speak with people and examine objects to achieve your goal. The game combines hi-res graphics with a text parser.

sample_screenshots.caption: It seems that I cant walk on water

title: AGROS

description:
Adarod is a board game inspired by the board game Dorada from Ravensburger. All players starts with four game pieces and the goal of the game is to remove them from the table scoring as much points as possible.

A game board is constructed out of 8 different tiles:* Black tiles: Nothing happens here.

  • White tiles: The first game pieces to land here disappears and the tile is transformed into a black tile.
  • Tiles with two fields: The game piece disappears and points is added to the players score. if more than one game piece lands on the same tile the number of points given increases so that the last player to land on the tile is awarded with the most points.
  • Ties with numbers on them: The game piece who lands here must move as many steps as the number says.
  • Lightnings: This tile allows the player to blast one of the opponents game pieces of the board.
  • Teleport tiles: These tiles teleports the game piece to a random board tile.
  • Plus and minus tiles: these tiles will add or remove a game piece for the current player.

A game board editor is rewarded to those who pay the shareware fee.
title: Adarod

description:
In Project Airline the player takes on the role of an airline manager.

When the game starts each player has 30 million DM to spend. As a manager of an airline the player has to buy planes (there are 14 planes to choose from, most are Airbus and Boeing planes) to the fleet hire personnel and make other investments such as hotels and stocks. When the player has one or more aircrafts in the fleet fly routes must be setup; possible destinations are shown based on how far a certain plane can fly. If the player does not believe in fair play he/she can sabotage the opponents operation.

There are three different type of winning conditions (one is selected at the beginning of each game):* Playing time: The player with most money when the time is up wins

  • Money: The player who first reaches the limit wins
  • Bankruptcy: The game continues until there is only one player left

In the shareware version the playing time is limited to 12 game months.
title: Project Airline

description:
Balloons is a puzzle game in which the player in each level has to collect a certain number of things.

Every level contains several balloons that can be popped giving the player a small amount of points. Balloons may also hide all or some of the items that the player must collect to complete the level. Once all items have been collected the exit appears. In addition to balloons and items that has to be collected there are several other items spread out across the levels that might be of use to the player, such as a clock for extra time for example. On later levels moving enemies will appear. At the start of the game the player has three lives. A Life is lost if the time runs out or if the player walks into a trap or falls into a hole.

The shareware version of this game comes with 50 levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Those flash symbols are unhealthy to step on
First level. One of the items is visible right away

title: Balloons

description:
Bits is a puzzle game where the player has to find the hidden bits on the game board. A typical game board consists of 16x8 tiles (the size can be altered by the player from 4x4 to 32x32) and 5 bits (number of bits can be set to any value between 1 and 16). Each tile the player clicks on can either be a bit or a number that indicates how many bits that tile aligns to (horizontally, vertically and diagonally).

The game has five different playing modes:* Demo: This is a beginner mode that give the player help.

  • Extra: A new type of tile that can kill the player is introduced in this mode
  • Rätsel: The computer turns a number of tiles for the player and then the player has to find the missing bit(s) without making any mistakes since every other tile except the bit(s) now will kill the player
  • Doppel: Allows two players to compete. This is a timed mode and each move may not take more than 30 seconds

This game was written in PureC.
title: Bits

description: In Boxy - Gambler the player has to navigate his way from the lower left of the game screen to the upper right without stepping on a mine. The game area consists of 22x15 tiles all grey at the beginning (except the lower left tile, where the player stands and the upper right tile which is the goal. The player has no indication of which tiles that are safe to tread on and which are hiding mines. The number of mines increases with the level. Stepping on a mine results in a lost life, when all three lives are lost it's game over. For each completed level the player is awarded 10 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: After completing a level successfully the positions of the mines are revealed

title: Boxy - Gambler

description:
Slippery Sid is a nine level snake game. In every level the player has to help Sid collect 30 pieces of green food before the time runs out so that he may advance to the next level. For every piece of food Sid eats he grows a bit. Sid also suffers from a skin decease so that he now and then sheds a bit of dead skin (colored red). If Sid touches one these pieces of dead skin he loses a life. A built in cheat mode allows the player to alter Sids size, speed, the number of lives and starting level.

The game was written in STOS.

sample_screenshots.caption: I've shreded several pieces of dead skin

title: Slippery Sid

description:
Snakes & Ladders is a computer implementation of the board game with the same name. Try to be the first to reach the finish line, use ladders to take shortcuts across the game board but watch out for snakes, they will move you backwards. This game has the peculiarity that two game pieces can not occupy the same square, so that the second player to reach a occupied square will end up one square behind it.

The game was written in GFA Basic.
title: Snakes & Ladders

description:
Space Blob is a 15 level platform game in which the player has to help Blob collect crystals and try not to get him killed by enemies or rough terrain. Once all crystals in a level are collected it's off to the next level. In addition to 15 single screen levels there are three bonus screens.

This game was written in STOS.

sample_screenshots.caption: Better watch out of that water drop

title: Space Blob

description:
Space Invaders is an implementation of the classic arcade game. The game has two playing modes: Modern and Classic. Modern features better graphics and some extra features.

Move your base at the bottom of the screen and kill as many aliens as possible. Aliens will move across the screen in a formation of 10 x 5 and for each switch of direction the will close in a bit on the player. The more aliens the player kills the faster the remaining aliens will move. Now and then a mothership will appear at the top och the game area. Destroying it will give the player some extra points, in modern mode destroying a mother ship will on later levels reward the player with better defences and fast shooting missiles.

The game was written in assembler.

sample_screenshots.caption: Time to start a modern game
A mothership flies across the screen

title: Space Invaders

description:
Speculator is a trading simulator. Try to make as much money as possible on the commodity market. Watch the market go up and down and then decide on which position to take, each player can hold up to 4 positions at any one time. Random events (such as price drops to previous low and panic buy up) will affect the the market. Each player starts with 5000 points.

The game was written in Assembler.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now let's see what to do...

title: Speculator

description:
Spaced Weller is a puzzle game where the player must create coloured lines on a magical grid. The grid consists of 7x6 spheres and the players gets points for each row that consists of at least three spheres. Row can be formed either horizontally, vertically or diagonally. When no more lines can be formed it is the next players turn. The round is complete when the time runs out.

There are three special spheres: Purple spheres* that acts as obstacles

  • Blitter spheres that can be used to destroy opponents spheres and purple spheres
  • Bonus spheres that gives extra points once they are included in a line

The game was written in STOS.
title: Spaced Weller

description:
Platform Capers is a Donkey-Kong style platform game where the aim is to collect four keys and make the way to the exit. The player has to climb up ladders, jump over barrels, snails and other stuff to make it to the top of each level so that the key can be collected.

The game was written in STOS.
title: Platform Capers

description:
Light Cycles is as the name implies a light cycles game. Two players tries to navigate their light cycles so that the other player crashes (either into the walls or into the trail of the light cycle). When playing against another human there are 4 game levels from "easy" to "Hell!" that affects speed and obstacles. Each player starts the game with five lives.

This game was created with STOS.
title: Light Cycles

description: Tonic Tile is a clone of the arcade game Arkanoid. You control a bat at the bottom of the screen and must hit a ball upwards to hit bricks at the top of the screen to make them all disappear to move onto the next level. If the ball goes past your bat then it's a life lost. To help you there are icons that fall downwards when certain bricks are hit. These can help you in your game and include shooting lasers, ball sticking to the bat and extending the bat. There are shapes floating around the screen and although they can't hurt you they can make the ball bounce in a new direction. One or two players can play and each player has a turn when the other player loses a life. There are 33 levels and the first 16 can be chosen to play.
title: Tonic Tile

description:
Just Another War in Space is a real-time strategy game in which the player participates in a space war. There are seven scenarios: five standard sets and two with expanded gameplay mechanics. In the first five scenarios, the player receives a ship which has to be used to defeat the enemy army. The player indirectly controls the ship by issuing commands from the command menu. There are about 29 commands available, including using shields or special weapons. Inertia is simulated. On the map are also neutral objects which become hostile if attacked.

In the last two scenarios, each war party gets a set amount of credits to build an army of ships. However, the player does not only buy pre-made ones, but gets to equip them manually. Each ship consists of a hull, pods and weapons, of course each with their advantages and disadvantages. The player can either takes control over all ships or let the AI handle all but one.
title: Just Another War in Space

description:
Star Wars is a horizontally scrolling shooter written in STOS.

In each level the player has to combat enemy ships, asteroids and fire balls and at the end of the level a boss ship will appear. At the top of the screen score, fire and shield are displayed. In each level the player starts with fire set to 100 and for every shot one is subtracted, when it reaches 0 it starts to grow. Fire is used with shields to compute the end of level bonus. The bonus is computed as shield+fire. If the number representing fire has passed 0 and is growing when the level ends it means that the bonus will be computed as shield-fire. If the shield counter reaches zero it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen with a text scroll

title: Star Wars

description:
Plumb Crazy is a Pipe Dream clone written in STOS.

Construct a large enough network of pipes before the time runs out and the water starts to flow. The construction area consists of 9 x 6 tiles with one tile already occupied by the inflow pipe. At the bottom of the screen is the time indicator and once it is full the construction time is up and water starts to flow into the pipe network. At the top right corner of the screen is a number which shows how large the network needs to be to complete the level and at the lower right side of the screen the next four pipe segments are displayed. If the player don't manage to construct a network that's large enough it's game over. From level three special pipes starts to appear (such as one way pipes).

sample_screenshots.caption: The wather flows through the pipe
Two one directional tiles are on the board

title: Plumb Crazy

description:
Lucky 7 is a four wheel fruit machine simulator written in STOS.

Unlike many other fruit machine simulators the player may spin as many times as he/she wants, the game will show the player amount played for, how much he/she has won and the profit made. Each spin costs 10 pence. The game features "nudge", "auto nudge", "auto hold", "super series" and "potluck".

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to win some serious money

title: Lucky 7

description: Hedgehogger is a Frogger-clone in which the player must help hedgehogs to cross the road. The road the hedgehogs must cross have three lanes in each direction. For each lane a hedgehog crosses the player is awarded some points. Now and then turboworms appears and if the hedgehog eats it the hedgehog will move faster. After six hedgehogs have been run over it's game over.
title: Hedgehogger

description:
The Go-Moku (or also called Gomoku) board game is played on a 15x15 board with each player is allowed to place one stone at a time. The goal is to get a row of five stones in any direction (even diagonal). As it is proven that the starting player always can win if playing correctly, the Renju variant with slightly modified starting rules applies to prevent the advantage of the first player.

The game features both variants, it can even alter the board size (9x9, 11x11, 13x13 and 15x15). It comes with an AI that can be adjusted in playing levels (from 1 to 9). Also, help can be shown and there is an undo function for any turns.

sample_screenshots.caption: Color monitor: the graphics are the same, but everything is smaller

title: Go-Moku / Renju

description: Entombed is a 2D side-scrolling puzzle platformer similar in style to Rick Dangerous. The game is set in various Egyptian tombs. There are four tombs to complete and afterwards a fifth and more difficult one is unlocked. Puzzles involve ladders, enemies such as snakes, keys and teleporters. The game was created for a competition run by the UK magazine ST Format.

sample_screenshots.caption: A lot of sharp pointy stuff here...
That bow can come in handy

title: Entombed

description:
A very huge compilation, which was bundled with computer sales for some time. Because of legal issues, the German version includes Winter Olympiad 88 instead of Predator.

The compilation includes 20 games:

  • Afterburner
  • R-Type
  • Gauntlet II
  • Super Hang-On
  • Space Harrier
  • Overlander
  • Super Huey
  • Starglider
  • Eliminator
  • Nebulus (Tower Toppler)
  • Pacmania
  • Predator (UK) / Winter Olympiad 88 (Germany)
  • Bomb Jack
  • Bombuzal
  • Xenon
  • Double Dragon
  • Black Lamp
  • Outrun
  • Star Goose (Stargoose Warrior)
  • Star Ray (Revenge of Defender)
title: Atari Powerpack

description:
Checkmate is a chess program with basic features: it does not only allow a game against the computer, but also player vs. player and computer vs. computer.

The board itself is drawn in 2D, the window on the left is showing the moves in the game in standard chess notation, while on the right a windows is displaying the computers analysis and progress.

Games can be replayed and saved. Some analysis functions help the player. An option allows to create a board position from scratch and play from that position. A small opening library is delivered with the program and can be modified.

The difficulty can be adjusted, basically by the time per move (10 seconds up to 10 minutes per move).

sample_screenshots.caption: Designing a board position to start playing from. Good one?
Monochrome monitor: started a game against the computer

title: Checkmate

description:
RoboCop 2 for the Atari ST, like other versions of the movie license on home computers, combines platforming action, a puzzle mode and first-person gallery shooting, but features unique levels and gameplay mechanics.

The main attraction are the platform levels. The player controls RoboCop on his way to specific goals: the primary goal that ends the level is the destruction of the Nuke drug plant or the arrest of a major villain. Secondary goals include picking up Nuke drug canisters and arresting suspects like scientists or drug process workers. Making all arrests and finding all canisters is rewarded by extra lives. Robo's progress is hindered by hordes of respawning goons coming at him from all sides, attacking with guns and grenade launchers. His standard gun can fire only one projectile at a time, but hidden in crates or dropped by enemies are gun power-ups that include three-way and five-way shots, but all with limited ammunition. No matter the gun, care must be taken because firing rapidly can overheat the gun, requiring a cooling-down period in which no shots can be fired. Besides better guns, there is also an invincibility power-up as well as clocks that extend the time limit and glasses of baby food that restore Robo's health.

After every platform level, a puzzle stage and a shooting gallery follow. In the puzzle stage, RoboCop tries to regain some of his human memories. To do so, a cursor has to be moved over a circuit board, with the goal of hitting all red chips. Moving the cursor leaves a trail, and neither the trail nor any chips besides the red ones may be hit or the puzzle game is over. Completing four boards in succession (each within less then a minute) leads to extra lives being awarded.

In the shooting gallery, targets appear in windows and on the street, and a crosshair must be moved to hit them. But not every target is a criminal, and care must be taken so that no civilians are hit. Good performance at the gallery improves Robo's accuracy for the following level.

The last level of the game returns to the platform game mechanics, but the only goal is to defeat Cain in his "RoboCop 2" form. This takes place over several screens, with Cain sometimes recuperating while sending smaller enemies like flying drones and ED-209 at RoboCop.

sample_screenshots.caption: Taking out a kneeling mortar operator
I'm back in fine form, shooting at angles myself!

title: RoboCop 2

description:
JAY Minesweeper is a very straight copy of Windows's famous Minesweeper. Click a square in a minefield and pray that it isn't a mine. If not, a number is revealed, showing the number of adjacent mines.

The game is made for running as a desk accessory in Atari ST's GEM environment, for high resolution screens only.
title: JAY Minesweeper

description:
Flip Side is a conversion of the Reversi board game.

Two players are setting stones in turns and each stone is coloring all stones which are lying in a lines with stones of the same color. These lines can be horizontal, vertical or diagonal.

This computer conversion features 7 skill levels of the computer AI, has an integrated board editor to set up special board situations, allows two players to play and the AI can suggest moves. On the higher skill levels a normal Atari ST requires several minutes to calculate a single move.

sample_screenshots.caption: Asking the game for suggesting a move
The computer is thinking over the many white stones
Choosing skill level of computer player
Editor: set up stones on the board like wanted
If in monochrome I only get draws

title: Flip Side

description:
Cave Runner II is a platform game clearly inspired by Lode Runner.

In 130 levels, the player have to collect all bottles in a level before a specific time limit is reached. Lot's of enemies and traps make this a difficult task. Cannons are shooting at you, arrows are flying around, boulders dropping constantly and moving enemies have to be attracted to specific positions to pass. There are ladders and ropes to move around quickly, some bonus items giving temporary protection against certain threads (like boulders). Secret passages can be found and diamonds can be collected for additional points.

Each level is a single screen, there is no scrolling. As the game is only running in high resolution (and monochrome colour) and unsing small tiles for the elements, these screens are packed with functional elements and therefore some strategic planning is required before starting to move.

The game comes with an editor allowing the player to change all the existing levels or creating new ones.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 3: a lot to collect, but it has to go fast
Level 2: some keys have to be collected
Level 1: we are the fruit on the lower right

title: Cave Runner II: Caverns of Death

description:
Turbo ST is a racing game, which does not rely on hundreds of racing tracks, but directly booting into a track editor. You can change the two predefined tracks or create new ones. These can be loaded and saved as normal files, so are exchangeable easily. The track elements contain 45- and 90-degree curves, vertical, horizontal and diagonal lines.

There are three themes to assign to the tracks, which alter the graphical representation in game: Rising Sun, High Noon and Alps. The graphic comes with occasionally zooming sprites beside the bitmap road, with the background picture scrolling left and right. There are no AI drivers, so playing the game alone you can only race against the high score.

Up to four players can race against the time in a hot-seat mode on the created or loaded tracks. You car have four gears, switching up and down easily with the joystick. The score is always starting at 9999 and counting downwards with time and you also receive a penalty on the score for crashes.

sample_screenshots.caption: In a two player competition I won
Track editor: my first track is maybe not too challenging
The scenery is basically the background and colors
Am I too fast for the upcoming turn?
Funny enough you can load any file to the track editor. This example comes from the "desktop.inf" file also delivered on the game disk

title: Turbo ST

description:
Xtron is a Space Invaders game, and mixed are some elements from Galaxian.

The player's ship is bound to the lower border and is able to move left and right. At the beginning of each level, all alien ships are approaching the screen in different formations, already firing at the player before they settle to their position on the top of the screen and start single attacks to below.

After every two stages new alien types are appearing. There are no extra weapons and the player ship is limited to very few projectiles at the same time. The background is a scrolling starfield, the user interface is only an optical gimmick beside display of points and players lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Before settling at the top the alien ships enter the scene in a huge formation
These formations also coming from the lower border -- you have to learn which formation is approaching at what point if you do not want to instantly lose a life at the stage start
Finally they build up in this stage. Now single attacks are beginning

title: Xtron

description:
Skate Tribe was coming third in Mandarin's 1989 „Gameswriter of The Year“ contest, in which the producer of STOS wanted the best games created with their tool and promised commercial publication. The result was published on the compilation Games Galore.

The game is an arcade skating game, featuring nine levels, with partly different problems and control methods. All levels are scrolling vertically on the whole screen, there are no GUI elements, even the amount of lives is not displayed.

Level 1 is starting in a town, in which you have to dodge obstacles on the street and collecting money on the way. The money is just there for some points, you cannot buy anything with it. With level 2 fantasy elements come in, two dragons are throwing bombs at you which you have to avoid. In two following levels you are on trails and have to jump on the other side to avoid obstacles. In further levels your skateboard can fly and you have to shoot enemies and a huge dragon is appearing. The final level returns to the town setting of level 1.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level end report - few money collected, but as it has no purpose...
That bus must be late, three skeletons waiting forever

title: Skate Tribe

description:
Brainbox is a quiz game, in which the player plays against the computer. A round is made of nine questions from the categories Books, Science, Sport, Leisure, Places, History, Pot Luck and Art. On getting a question, you have to answer within a time limit, and on a correct answer you get a green cross, else a red circle.

The display is on a 3x3 grid, and control is via keyboard only. The database contains more than 3,000 questions. Playing against other human players is not possible. On giving a wrong answer, you do not get the correct answer displayed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another one in "Art". Red circles: I failed giving the correct answer, green cross: correct answer

title: Brainbox

description:
Spacola is a 2D space shooter. Like in Asteroids, the player's ship is pinned at the center of the screen, adding thrust scrolls the screen in one direction, and stopping must be done with thrust in the opposite direction. You can find some weapon upgrades like a twin shoot, you can shoot asteroids, and after destroying pirate vessels their pilots are crying for help and can be collected for points (the police is paying for them). The galaxy consists of 64 sectors and the beginning sector is always a different one.

Your job as pilot of a space craft is to deliver different goods to a space station. But there are some problems: a lot of pirates are hanging around in the sectors, looking to steal the goods. And even worse: you do not know exactly which space station you are looking for and most of the stations are property of the pirates as well. As with the bad situation, from the outside these pirate owned stations are looking exactly the same as the civil stations. What sounds like a design flaw was part of the monetization of the game: the disk with the game was not only without copy protection, but it was allowed to copy it freely and therefore the possibility to spread it through Public Domain libraries. The star map, which lists the coordinates of the space stations to deliver the goods, was a book with 176 pages, and this book could be bought from Dongleware.

sample_screenshots.caption: A small explosion festival around the pirate's hideout
After respawn, a shield protects you for a short time. At least I also got the pirates vessel, the pilot is crying for help and I should "collect" him to gain some points

title: Spacola

description:
Esprit is the predecessor of the Oxyd series of games from Dongleware, sharing the basic idea, control and many gameplay elements with those games. Control method and physical effects are heavily influenced by the earlier Bolo.

You control a ball in a world with physical rules, like acceleration and gravitation. On touching regular stones, they reveal a symbol. You have to open two stones with the same symbol in a row to lock them. When all stones are locked, the level is finished. Therefore the goal of the game is the same as in Memory. Save controlling the ball, which can only be done with the mouse, in a world with ice on the floor, bumpers catapulting the ball in a different direction or with gravity spots attracting the ball, is very crucial element of gameplay, too. There are many special purpose items to find, some notes are giving you hints, contain the level codes for later start in this level, allowing level skips and more.

Overall there are 100 levels which can be accessed with passwords.

sample_screenshots.caption: One pair is found (touch the top two stones in a row), the other is not... not very difficult to finish
Start of a level. Four stones, that means two pairs to find
Finding items or reading notes are triggering fast scrolling messages
Gravity is activated for the first time, pulling the ball to the centre of the screen with a constant force
Some of the real stones are hidden in the same looking border stones here

title: Esprit

description:
Bolo Werkstatt is a level editor for the Bolo game ("Werkstatt" is the German word for workshop).

You can create new levels by placing all kinds of stones, setting the starting positions for the bat and the ball, and there are options to rearrange the levels (you can create up to 100). The editor itself does not contain the game, therefore you still require the original game. A copy program can copy the original disk on which you then can replace the levels with the ones from the editor. The created disks can either be single sided (no music) or double sided (with sampled music).

The user interface is quite slim: you chose actions with the keyboard, like scrolling through the levels with the cursor keys, selecting stones with characters and setting them with the mouse.

sample_screenshots.caption: As starting positions of bat and ball were too conventional, I change these too
I set up a random level. And also directly shown bolos biggest design flaw: the "Exit" stone, which ends the game instantly, no matter how many lives are left...
Main menu (Color monitor, medium resolution 640x200, 4 colors)
The copy program for the original game (to copy your levels onto).

title: Bolo Werkstatt

description: This Backgammon implementation is straight forward: it offers ten skill levels of the AI, allows demo mode in which the computer plays against itself, a two-player game option, and the loading and saving of a game. The player can take back their last move.
title: Backgammon

description:
The player controls Thunderwing, an „Urban Air Fighter“, which is stolen to help the rebel forces against some suppressor.

The game is a vertical scrolling shooter. The ship is equipped with lasers and can activate the disruptor, a force field around the ship, destroying everything near. There are differently colored enemy formations, which give different rewards on complete destruction: a red formation rewards an update to the basic laser cannon, destroying two blue and two red formation is rewarded with an extra live. Some ground enemies leave a reload to the limited disruptor. There are end-of-level bosses to defeat.

sample_screenshots.caption: Activated disruptor: very bad to see on a screenshot, many grey blocks are flickering around the ship.
Attacking an enemy with upgraded laser

title: Thunderwing

description:
Killing Spree is a shoot-'em-up, which scrolls to the horizon. The landscape is created with polygons, and zooming sprites are used for enemies and details like trees. The player flies with his spacecraft with selectable acceleration, can move up, down, left and right, which causes the landscape also to scroll horizontally. The ship's defence is a single weapon, which is required to shut down energy barriers, turrets or moving enemies like flying saucers, which split into many smaller enemies on destroying, or to attack ships on the ground.

The landscape itself is also an opponent, with walls moving periodically, having the player to tune the acceleration of the ship carefully to pass these obstacles. There is no score counter, the only purpose is to survive as long as possible.

An editor is delivered with the game, allowing to create new fractal landscapes, modifying them, view in 2D or 3D, place ships and save/load the created levels.

The game was released in the game competition on the Outline 2014 convention, winning the second place in that competition.

sample_screenshots.caption: Note the radar in the lower right corner, warning for enemies or obstacles
The landscape is based on a fractal, displayed with polygons, but also zooming sprites are used, i.e. the trees
The game begins in front of an energy barrier protected by a flying saucer. Shoot tower tops to deactivate the field

title: Killing Spree

description:
Hot Wheels is a Super Sprint inspired game, published for the ST User magazine. On 15 tracks, one or two players try to finish first, by either being faster than the opposite cars, or simply ramming the other cars to the track border or pushing them into oil spills, which let the cars rotate uncontrollable for a short moment, resulting in a loss of valuable time. The levels are bigger as one screen, scrolling in all directions, with a horizontally split-screen in two-player mode.

The roads contain narrow curves, and some tracks include alternatives, which the player can choose which one to take. There is no career mode, each track has to be selected individually, and the goal is to win this individual level.

The are many options, you can disable the collisions, the AI controlled cars, the oil or the amount of rounds required to finish a level.

An editor is included, allowing to design your own tracks, including checkpoints and obstacles. The created levels can be loaded and saved to disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: That black spot is a oil spill better be avoided
Two-player game: the yellow car is chasing the red one
Removing collision control allows you to take the direct way. But beware: if you miss the (invisible) checkpoints, the short cut maybe lead to a not counted round

title: Hot Wheels

description: Astro 2000 is an Asteroids inspired game with some extensions over the original game play. The player is controlling a small space craft, and can rotate this and move over the fixed screen. Reaching a border, the ship reappears on the opposite side. The asteroids of the original are still there, but they are in sphere form. On shooting the bigger spheres, they split in several smaller ones, often quicker moving. The bigger asteroids require several hits until they explode. Luckily, if the players ship is hit, not instantly one of the four lives is lost, but only some energy is drained, which can be refilled by an extra, which randomly appears as a collectible. Other extras rewarding a shield, making your ship immune to collisions with the enemies, or freeze all movements of the asteroids for a short time, making the removal easier.

sample_screenshots.caption: The blue asteroids take even more hits until they are destructed

title: Astro 2000

description:
This compilation contains two conversions of Sinclair QL games for the Atari ST. They were sold as a twin pack and were most likely not available separately. Both games are text adventures with random events and real-time elements. Included are:

  • The Lost Kingdom of Zkul
  • West

sample_screenshots.caption: West - I shoot a bank robber and take his key
West - After dying, I come across my previous corpse and dead trusty steed.
West - My trusty steed appears out of nowhere and we ride along until a snake bites my horse, rolls over me and crushes me to death.
West - I fail to catch a tumbleweed. Then another snake appears...

title: The Lost Kingdom of Zkul / West

description:
Robert in the Fire Factory is a remake of the Atari XL game Mr. Robot and His Robot Factory. The player has to walk over all platforms in a level to complete it. Flames, bombs and other obstacles are in the way. When collecting a blue-flashing power-up the player gets a temporary shield that enables him to destroy the enemies. Transporters and other fixed constructions, as well as taking falling damage when jumping to a platform from slightly too high, makes this a challenge.

An editor is included with the program (the build-in levels are not editable).

sample_screenshots.caption: Collecting one of the blue power ups gathers a shield, and enables the killing of the flames

title: Robert in the Fire Factory

description:
Don't worry be happy is a shareware conversion of the German board game Mensch ärgere Dich nicht! (which is very similar to the English board game Ludo, as both are variants of the Indian Pachisi game).

Two to four players race the board to finally enter their home with all four figures. Movement is done via a dice roll, with the difficulty you require a six to leave your starting area. If a figure enters a field with a figure of an opposite player on it, the player can throw this figure, basically sending it back to the starting point of the player.

The game features up to three AI players, but can also played with four humans.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game uses Gem for windows (TT medium 640*480*16 colors)
Player options and AI control settings
A lot of figures on the board (I am playing red against the computer)
On a monochrome monitor the figuares are hard to distinguish (ST high 640*400)
Two figures are in the home and two in very dangerous places...

title: Don't worry, be happy

description:
Tetris II Strikes Back is an enhanced Tetris variant. It features two playing modes: the classic Tetris gameplay and a mode in which predefined patterns of stones are already present in the levels and the level is finished if all of those predefined stones are removed.

For both playing modes the game has a two-player simultaneous cooperation mode, in which the (single, not split screen) play field is twice the width of the single player mode. The players can work together to fill the lines and collect bombs to remove uncomfortable stone formations.

sample_screenshots.caption: Extended playing mode: you have to remove all the predefined stones to finish the level (in this case the blue ones)
Main menu: switch playing mode, amount of players, sound and change keyboard settings
In this case, the heart are the predefined blocks to remove

title: Tetris II Strikes Back

description:
This is a five games compilation from Ocean, containing the following games:

  • Slap Fight (A.L.C.O.N.)
  • Wizball
  • Rampage
  • Arkanoid
  • Enduro Racer
title: U5

description:
This is a two game compilation containing

  • Onslaught
  • Stormlord
title: Action Pak Arcade Fever

description:
The Kruwehl family is surrounded by mystery, not the least of which is the fact that each member of the clan seems to have died in an unnatural way. Furthermore, whoever has tried to find out the secret of the odd, but influential, family has died in the process. Now, as an investigative reporter who has been a little to investigative, it is your turn to die. Attempting to thwart destiny, you enter the Agony manor while its owner is away for the night, attempting to unravel the Kruwehl family's mystery.

Sheer Agony is a graphical adventure made up of digitised stills, with limited mouse interaction. There are 15 point-and-click verbs at your disposal: go, open, close, look, probe, read, swallow, smell, press, turn, push, lift, search, take and put. Using search, you can find objects and pick them up, but your inventory is limited to 9 items, after which you must put down held items in the right spot, or relinquish them forever. The number of items per screen is small, but the manor is quite large and you must use the integrated map to find your way through each floor.

Originally released in French, English and German for the Atari Falcon, Sheer Agony was also re-released in a cut-down version for common Atari ST computers.

sample_screenshots.caption: (Falcon030) The stair down to the cellar
(Falcon030) You find a mysterious note signed by the master of the house, stuck behind a painting

title: Sheer Agony

description: This is a clone of the popular Flappy Bird game, for the Atari ST. You flap the wings of the bird, which is at the mercy of heavy gravitation, to make it pass between tubes blocking its path. Control is via keyboard, mouse or joystick, using just a single button. On the Atari STe, the number of colours is raised from the 30 used on the plain Atari ST. The game comes with full source code in 68000 assembly language.
title: FlappyBird

description: The first game to be made specifically for the new Atari STE machine may seem inspired by Atari Games's Toobin', but is a lot more violent. Floating a small boat down a river, you find yourself attacked from all directions by aliens, dinosaurs, mines and everything else that can explode or fire projectiles. To fend for yourself, your craft is armed with a gun, and pods floating around in the river will also make your life easier. Pure reflex work is not enough to survive, as the current of the river will always pull you down the screen and slow down any movement. This, and the forced scrolling the game uses, may lead to situations where you are squashed between a rock and the top border of the screen – unlike most scrolling games, Whitewater Madness scrolls "downstream" instead of upwards.

sample_screenshots.caption: A floating pod marked "B" near the bottom of the screen
More pods and a diving dinosaur
Smashed against the shore, where a dinosaur awaits

title: Whitewater Madness

description: En enhanced followup to Dynabusters. Added to the original game (a typical Dynablaster clone) are more diverse pickups, more levels, more sounds, some changed graphics and support for a total of six simultaneous players using both the standard joystick ports, Jaguar pads on the enhanced joystick ports and a four-player adapter in the parallel port. In order to keep up the pace in games, the playfield starts to shrink after a set amount of time.

sample_screenshots.caption: Time is running out, so the screen starts to shrink

title: Dynabusters+

description:
From Finland, the land of cave-flyers, comes a two-player caveflying game called Utopos. In a split-screen view, you and a mate control a small rocket in a cramped cave system filled with traps, trying to hunt each other down. Each player starts out on his starting ramp (of which there in fact are several), which is also armed with an anti-aircraft gun that may be rotated at will as long as the rocket is on the ground.

In addition to the one-on-one two-player mode, there is a "race" mode where the two players race around the screen, passing checkpoints along the way.

For a single player, there is a "seek and destroy" mode, where all enemies on a level must be destroyed, upon which a port to the next level is opened.

To make the game more long-lasting, there are several levels to fly around, and an assortment of different bombs and projectiles to arm the ships with, as well as an afterburner that can be installed in place of a weapon.
title: Utopos

description:
Disk 15 is a compilation of 15 games on a single disk. Most games are board-game conversions, but also some arcade games and a drawing program are included in the collection.

  • 3D Noughts & Crosses
  • Sliding Blocks
  • Solitaire
  • 49er
  • Hangman
  • MasterMind
  • Othello
  • Draughts
  • Astro Dodge
  • STDoodler (drawing program)
  • Heli Bomber
  • Sub Hunter
  • Rally Driver
  • Balloon Crazy
  • Diamante Sid

Control is very different through the games: some board games are controlled by the mouse, others by positional arguments typed on the keyboard, while the arcade games are controlled by keyboard only (no joystick), but all with different key mappings, which cannot be changed. Most games can only be left by resetting the computer. None of the games feature sound effects or music, only the keyboard ping of the operating system is present.

sample_screenshots.caption: Othello is also controlled by keyboard input
The helicopter moves automatically from left to right, loosing height on each turn.
Somehow I have to do something here
Balloon Crazy is featuring moving platforms: avoid the wholes in them
I am getting the last two evil submarines (which move from left to right)

title: Disk 15

description:
Verthor is a board game. Two players are competing on a board with numbers. Those numbers can either be positive (red color) or negative (blue color) or neutral (the zero). Each time a number is selected, it is added to the score, so with negative numbers, the score can also decrease.

The trick with the game is that one player can only move the cursor vertically (in the board column) and the other can only move it horizontally (in the board rows). If a stone is chosen and the according row/column is empty, a random new stone appears. This lead to games in which the score first raises for both players, as mostly positive numbers are picked and at the end of the level the score is decreasing, as mostly negative numbers are left on the board. A strict time limit on moves makes this a game for quick thinkers.

The game features five levels with different background pictures and some special stones like random numbers in later levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level finished reveal the background picture
Level 1, arabic numbers. Red numbers are good (positive), blue numbers are bad (negative, so decreasing score) and black is neutral.

title: Verthor

alternate_titles.description: Title used in the scrolling text on the title screen
alternate_titles.title: Lamesweeper

description:
Lamemine is a puzzle game heavily inspired by the Minesweeper variant shipped with Windows 3.1.

The goal of the game is to locate all bombs on the board and mark them. Any field revealed shows the amount of bombs around this field. If there are no bombs surrounding the chosen field, all adjacent fields without bombs around are revealed. If there are bombs around, a number shows how many. On the square board this can be 1 to 8. If the player marks all bombs on the board, the level is won. It is lost if the player reveals a field with a bomb on it.

There are two playing modes: in level mode the game is restarting with higher difficulty after marking all bombs on the board. “Free” mode is selected whenever the user sets own options like the board size or the amount of bombs planted. There are nine stages in “level” mode, with an increasing amount of bombs, making the clearance of the board more and more difficult.

Compared to many other Minesweeper clones, the default play-field size is very huge (38x28 tiles), which can be reduced in free mode.

The game is only running on the Atari Falcon in VGA resolution.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first non-bomb field reveals all connected free fields. Numbers show the amount of connected bombs
Reducing the size of the board makes the game much quicker (size in this case: 20x15)
Uuuups, I revealed a bomb and blew up.
Marking some bomb spots (counter in the lower right tells the amount of remaining bombs to mark)

title: Lamemine

description:
The player and his small ship has to enter a huge alien spacecraft. No further details about the scenery or background story are given in the game or accompanied materials. Triton III is a shoot 'em up game released on a budget price, so maybe further details are not required.

The game scrolls vertically and on some parts parallax scrolling is used. The player's ship always omits two shots which are handed separately. There are obstacles on the ground which are killing the player's ship instantly on collision. Some of those can be shot, others must simply be avoided. The flying enemies, which drain energy on collision, are appearing in formations. Clearing a complete formation, and sometimes the bigger enemies also count as formation, an extra items appear. There are extras containing extra fuel, a shield, increased fire rate, a booster and a mine jammer.

The game features six levels, on death the player must restart on the level beginning.

sample_screenshots.caption: In-fight with a bigger ship which is constantly shooting while avoiding to crash into those ground things. On the lower right corner the current extra weapons collected are displayed as orange items
Ah, an enemy dropped a rapid fire extra, which is very handy. You can see the position in the level marked on the level map on the right

title: Triton III

description:
Unheart is a Boulder Dash variant with deeper focus on puzzle solving than the original game.

The goal is to collect all hearts to open the exit to the next level. As a little dwarf you can dig holes in certain areas. Rocks are falling down if there is a free field below them, which can cause chain reactions like in the original game. The player's avatar can push stones or grenades horizontally. Each of the 69 levels is presented on a single screen.

There are some special items in the levels: grenades explode if they fall on rock or a rock is falling on them, but remain intact if falling on removable ground. When they explode, walls and rocks around the grenade are destroyed, potentially opening previously inaccessible areas. Balloons move up if there is a free field above them. They can transport rocks, grenades or the player upwards. The last special are conveyors which are only passable in one direction.

Without any nasties or other self-moving things populating the levels and with the tricky nature of the special stones the game's pushing and thinking outside the box puzzles are also influenced by Sokoban. The player can instantly restart the level, which is badly required, as the difficulty of the game is very high. There is no limitation on the retries, and even if a time counter is ticking, no time limit is given. The player can freely skip levels without any cheat.

sample_screenshots.caption: A single heart in level 2. But a long way to bring the grenade down
They also take items with them upwards (like grenades... which is required in this level)
The fields with horizontal stripes are only passable in one direction

title: Unheart

description:
Racer 2 is the successor of Racer released in 2013. Unsurprisingly, it is a car racing game.

There are three playing modes: Championship, Challenge and Arcade. While in the Arcade mode the player is just driving for fun, in the Challenge mode the player competes with 7 AI controlled drivers for the win. Finally the Championship is a ongoing competition over all tracks with the ultimate goal to win the competition.

Overall there are 24 tracks, with up- and downhill passages, with the later tracks have to be unlocked first on racing success in the competitions. The 39 different cars in the game are displayed as scaled sprites. Each track is featuring it's own music, while sampled sound effects are mixed in.

Three difficulty levels are supported. The modes differ in the amount of time available to finish and the speed of the AI cars. Gear change can be optionally set to manual control, the default is automatically gear switching.

There are random bonus items appearing on the road, which offer higher maximum speed, kick opponents from the street, flatten the tires of opponents, freeze the time, and even kicking other cars from the road on ramming them. For a more serious challenge, this bonus system can completely deactivated in the options.

Exclusively running on the Atari Falcon computer, the game runs in high color mode (65.000 colors). The roads are texture mapped, but this can be turned off in the options for faster gameplay.

sample_screenshots.caption: On the opposite, the "Casino" track is quite colorful. In the arcade mode, you have to avoid the cars coming from front
Driving downhill. On the last position of the eight drivers, I have a good overview of the race (little joke)
Championship. Most of the tracks are still locked. You start at the lowest tier, but can select the difficulty on each start

title: Racer 2

description:
The exploration space vessel "DARWIN 8" is in troubles: it is invaded by alien robots, who killed the whole crew, leaving the player as last survivor to fight the intruders and clear the ship.

The player blasts his way through 40 levels shooting robots. But there is a problem: the robots are protected by "positronic generators", which have to be destroyed before the moving robots are receiving damage from your weapon. With active generators, a hit with the weapon only stuns them for a very short time. In each level there is at least one of those generators, in others there are up to three. Clearing a level fast awards you with extra points depending on the time remaining, while running out of time is punished with a life loss.

The levels are presented as single screens, with deadly walls in them: touching a stone instantly kills the player, which is also happening on a single hit from any of the robots shots. The level maps are pre-defined and always the same, but on each level start or dying, the position of both the robots and generator are randomly chosen. After each seven levels, the player gains an extra life.

The game was published as cover disk for ST Format, but released into the public domain soon after. In 2010 an extended port with original graphics was released, named Robotz DX.

sample_screenshots.caption: The random position of the generators could be much worse
The exit (black bar) opens if the last robot is destroyed
The different robot types have different colours indicating their type

title: Robotz

description:
A long time after the Human Race left Earth and traveled to the Solar System of Sol, some thoughts about returning to Earth came up. As aliens occupied the abandoned earth, The “Council of the Confederation of Human Kind” decided to send a ship to Earth to conquer the home planet again.

Of course, the player takes control of that Battle Probe and fights his way through 65 levels to expel the aliens by simply killing all of them in this vertical scrolling shoot 'em up game.

The player is attacked by shooting and moving aliens, but also must avoid any ground obstacle dropping a shadow carefully, because those will instantly kill the player. During the level the player's ship is consuming fuel, which has to be refilled by flying over “Fuel” fields. On the ground there are also often colored eyes found: a blue eye rewards some extra points, a yellow eye rewards an extra life and a green eye releases a random effect. On collecting extras, the game is playing a voice sample telling you which item you collected.

sample_screenshots.caption: Everything on the ground that drops a shadow kills you instantly if you are trying to fly over it...
.. that means: I was lost before I knew it
Passing through the first three alien formation. Left two alive. But survived!
Those items named "Fuel" are rewarding you with fuel. Fuel level is shown in the status bar on the right side

title: Battle Probe

description:
Platonix is a puzzle game in which your goal is to clear a complete board of stones. You control a cursor and after moving this cursor on a field, the field vanishes and you cannot go back. Therefore the route to clear all stones have to be carefully planned to avoid a lock in. Often there are several possibilities to solve the level.

Points are only rewarded after finishing a level. The amount is determined by the leftover time from the counter and the amount of lives left after clearing the level. Any ten levels completed a password is given.

The game has a high-score table and the time limit can be turned off in the options.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 4 is a very tricky one
Reaching the high-score table starts with a strangely aligned text

title: Platonix

alternate_titles.description: Alternative title used on media and box side
alternate_titles.title: Platonix Profi-Edition

description:
"Platonix Profi-Edition" is an extended commercial version of the original Platonix public domain game.

You are some kind of wizard and you have to travel in a land of the fairy tales where you have to defeat the evil by collecting stones of wisdom in order to create a powerful spell and bundle the knowledge of human kind. Saving the world is practically done by solving puzzles. Those levels are divided into time zones, which does not affect gameplay, but graphics and music.

In-game you control a cursor and move over stones. On leaving a field, it vanishes and you cannot go back. A level is solved as soon as all stones are removed. Therefore the route moving over the stones have to be carefully planned to avoid later inaccessible stones. Often there are several possibilities to solve the level. Some maps are taken from the earlier free Atari ST game, but there are many new levels added to the “Profi Edition”, overall 100 levels are included.

There are several differences to the predecessor. Graphical wise, there is now variance in stone graphics – but only visually, there are no stones with special functions. By default the map is scrolling, keeping the player's cursor in the centre, which makes parts of the map invisible at times (this effect can be switched off in the options). Time limits are not so short like in the free game, but the player has to survive with only five lives instead of nine. A level password is now rewarded after each level. Overall playing speed is slower, for example you can not instantly restart the level on a button stroke if you are stucked, but have to watch and stop some animations first before re-entering the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: The "solid" block left are just four normal stones, but looking differently

title: Platonix Profi Edition

description:
Vertical Mayhem is a public domain port of Sega's Columns coin-op.

Columns itself is a Tetris variant, but with some modified rules. Figures contain always three stones, are vertically and cannot be rotated (that means: they are only moving in the columns, hence the name). The stones themselves are in different colors and those colors can be rotated inside the three-stones brick by pressing the button on the joystick. The goal is to build rows, columns or diagonals of the same color with at least length three. The bigger the build formations are, the more points are rewarded.

Vertical Mayhem features two playing modes 'Childs Play!' and 'Heaven and Hell' with different graphic sets and game difficulties. After a certain amount of blocks, the level increases in both playing modes and the speed of blocks dropping increases.

The two-player mode of the original is not included in this variant, but a high-score table can be entered on enough points.

sample_screenshots.caption: After rotation we get a nice green row of length four
Survived over 100 blocks and reached level four
Entering the playing mode 'Heaven and Hell'

title: Vertical Mayhem

description:
The second volume of the "Computer Hits" series contained four games on the Atari ST (the Amiga version contained a slightly different set of games):

  • Joe Blade
  • Tracker
  • Tetris
  • Tau Ceti
title: Computer Hits Volume 2

description:
Bloody Run is a competitive racing game heavily inspired by Trailblazer.

Two players are controlling balls, which are automatically rolling over a lane consisting of blocks of different color. Depending of the color, there are different effects on the speed or control. While white and blue fields are nothing special, green ones are slowing your ball, yellow ones are accelerating it. A red field throws your ball in the air, allowing it to cross gaps in the road. Violet fields inverse the control (pushing the joystick to the left moves your ball to the right and vice versa). The „road“ is not the full six fields wide, as holes make it smaller or require it to jump.

Each player has a limited amount of jumps, which can be triggered without a jump field and those jumps are badly required at certain level spots. Falling of the costs some time until your ball is placed back on the road and in full speed. If the end of the level is not reached in a given time limit time, the game is over.

The game is always starting in two-player mode with vertically splitted screen, but progress of both players is independent, so a single player can continue the race if the second player is out, which is basically a single-player mode. High-scores are saved to disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: At least I finished with a high-score
Red reached a huge accelerator plane (yellow), while green is stuck on slowing fields (green)
Red player is ahead on a huge area inverting the controls (violet fields)
Go for the left one, red ball!

title: Bloody Run

description:
Poker Square is an implementation of the single player solitaire Poker game variant Poker Square. In this variation the player places cards randomly drawn from the stack on a 5x5 board. The goal is to achieve points by creating high scoring hands in the rows, columns and both diagonals. That means that after placing all 25 cards on the board the player placed 12 hands (5 in the rows, 5 in the columns and 2 diagonals) whose score is added to the final score.

The game implements all the poker hands like highest card, pairs, straight and flush, rewarding points in their normal Poker order, so a flush is worth more points than two pairs. The game is for single players and a high-score list is created.

sample_screenshots.caption: All the scoring hands are visible in the rules section
Right side is the stack, I placed my first card
After placing all cards, each row, column and diagonals are added up naming the best hand there

title: Poker Square

description:
Sweety Thingies is a conversion of Poux by Nick Kouvaris. The game starts with four rows of candies representing different colors. After a short amount of time, another whole row of stones is added at the bottom, pushing all stones above one line further. The goal is to avoid that any column is reaching the upper border of the board. To do this, stones have to be removed by the player. Stones can be removed if at least two stones of the same color are next to each other. On removal, any stone of the same color with direct (non-diagonal) connection to any removed stone is also removed. Like in Tetris all stones above fall down into the now empty slots. Given that rule, often more than two stones are removable.

The game awards removed stones with points and the level is increased automatically after a certain amount of rows is added. In higher levels, the amount of different colored stones is increased up to seven, making removal more difficult. Compared to the original game, the speed of rows added is much higher. Reaching a big score is rewarded with an entry in the high-score list.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game start: four different colors. Brown seems nice to pick, as 11 stones will be removed
In level 3 it's Game Over as the most left column reached the top border
With my low score I didn't managed to access the high-score table...

title: Sweety Thingies

description:
Kolmik Deluxe Edition is an extended version of the original Kolmik game, which was bonus minigame in the game Pooz from 2007. The "Deluxe Edition" features the playing mode of the original and is adding another playing mode called "Squared Frenzy", extending the game principle of the original.

In the Classic Kolmik playing mode, the play-field are three lanes filled with differently colored stones. Your goal is to create vertical columns with stones of matching color by shifting one of the three rows left or right by one stone. Removed columns are randomly filled. Each shift costs you two moves. By successfully creating a column, you gain an additional move (you can create more than one column by a shift). Classic Kolmik is a conversion of the game Blix by Nick Kouvaris. In the Squared Frenzy mode a 8x8 board filled with colored stones is presented. You can create a vertical column, but also build horizontal rows are allowed. In this mode, you do not shift complete rows, but exchange two stones next to each other. In this playing mode, the amount of moves after successfully creating a column or row is set to the maximum.

In both modes, no time limit is given and only the amount of leftover moves determinate the game's ending. Points are rewarded for building rows/columns, with a significant bonus if more than one are removed in a single move. There are two difficulty settings "Easy" and "Hard". In the more difficult setting, there are four different colors instead of three and the amount of moves is reduced compared to the easier setting. Separate high-score table for the modes and difficulty settings are available.

sample_screenshots.caption: At least I made it into the hall of fame
