Running out of moves finish the game
After removal of many rows, the ways to build columns may require more than one move

title: Kolmik: Deluxe Edition

description:
Earth is under attack of aliens. Luckily a forgotten SDI satellite named "Hercules" is in the orbit and still functional. Badly, the automatic targeting system is broken, so manually control of the weapon is required -- and taken by the player.

Attack Wave plays similar to Missile Command, without reaching it's tactical depth. Waves of alien spaceships approaching from the top of the screen. Left and right the satellites weapons are positioned. If any ship reaches the line below the weapon, it counts as hit. Too many hits will loose you the game. You also have to keep an eye on the energy level of the laser, as any shot requires some of it. Some aliens can even shot, draining further energy.

There are several options to adjust gameplay difficulty, like e.g. changing the speed of the alien vessels.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the lower border the amount of vessels passed the weapon is displayed
Earth is lost. But we are remembered in the high-score table

title: Attack Wave

description:
Jewelz is a puzzle game on a 4x4 board. Starting from the lower left, you can connect fields horizontally or vertically. Any field can only crossed once. The goal is to build a continuous connection to the end point in the upper right corner.

Sounds easy? Well, there is a constraint. The fields are in different colors. And the level is only finished, if you have an equal amount of each color connected. Sounds complicated? Well, an example: if there are two colors red and blue in the level, the line which connect start and end must cross the exactly the same amount of red and blue stones. In many puzzles there are much more fields of one color than others.

A special stone is the gap stone, which does not count as color. With level progress, fields in up to six different colors are on the board and the board itself gets bigger. You must not include all colors, so if appropriate, in a three color level you only connect stones of two colors – if the amount of fields connected in those two colors are equal. There is no time limit and you have unlimited attempts to solve a level. The last solved level is also saved to disk, so you can continue a game without playing the earlier levels again.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 29 introduces orange as new color
Level 2: three red, three yellow and crossing one neutral stone, not counting as color crossed: level complete!
You have seen this instantly, didn't you?
Last spoiler through level 37: all colors are required to solve this one!

title: Jewelz

description:
Spy 4k is an port of the game Spy by Nick Kouvaris. The binary size of the complete game including graphics and music data is exactly 4096 bytes, therefore the appendix "4k" in the game title.

The play-field is an 18x18 sized board. Each field contains a number or a bomb. Moving on a field with a number, the players avatar is automatically moving the amount of fields further like stated on the field (e.g. entering a field with a "4", four additional fields are crossed). The goal is to move a specific amount of fields without moving on a bomb or reaching a board border without having all the moves finished. Having reached the specified amount of moves of a level, the next level with higher requirement of moves is starting.

sample_screenshots.caption: Moved the required amount of fields. Level finished
Locked! Either 5 to the right or 4 to the bottom will reach the border before the moves are finished, which is Game Over
Game Over is also happening if moving in a bomb

title: Spy 4k

description:
Twix is an implementation of the board moving puzzle known as Khun Phaen Escapes, usually manufactured with wood pieces. On a 4x5 board there are ten stones. Four small 1x1 pieces, four 1x2 pieces, one 2x1 piece and a single 2x2 piece. The goal is to bring the large square to the opposite side, which seems to be impossible first, as there are only two free fields to move and rearrange the pieces. Indeed this puzzle is not trivial, the common solution takes 103 steps, the currently best known strategy 79 steps.

In the game Twix you have to move the stone from the left to the right by selecting the piece to move and then move it with the cursor keys. The implementation is quite special, as the game code itself is not executed as an Atari ST program, but as a program for the Hewlett Packard 48SX pocket calculator which is then emulated inside the ST game. This is visualized by a 48SX on the screen and all the action is only taking place in the small monochrome display of this picture.

sample_screenshots.caption: Further fiddling on the right side
The emulator is booting (the display is the small monochrome monitor up right)
Starting position: move the big large block to the right
This will not help me progress further

title: Twix

description:
Chainz (not to be confused with the game Chainz of the same name) is a puzzle game, converting the browser game Chain-reaction by Andrea Gilbert.

On a 3x3 board there are symbols in different shapes and colors. You can connect two symbols if they share the same color or the same shape. Each symbol is only allowed to touched once, but you can connect two fields even if there is a symbol between them. But no diagonal connections are allowed, only horizontal and vertical jumps are possible. The game features 22 levels of increasing difficulty (later more forms and colors are added). There is no save game option so the player has to restart from level one in each game.

sample_screenshots.caption: One jump to the top (color) and one move down (shape) and finished
Level 1: the chain you have to create start in the symbol with the white point
Level 2: although some stones to be removed, it's easy now

title: Chainz

description:
In Nuclear Waste Dump the player takes the role as garbage collector. As the title suggests, it's not about ordinary waste, but nuclear waste. The game is an extended remake of the type-in program Uncle Henry's Nuclear Waste Dump by James Hague released in Antic magazine in 1986.

The game is a puzzle game in which the cans of waste are falling from the top of the screen to the bottom and stacking up if other barrels are already present in the same column. Nuclear Waste Dump is reversing the usual scheme of color-matching used in related puzzle games: the waste bins are marked with four different symbols and your goal is to avoid the placement of similar marked barrels next to each other. If two of them are placed next to each other, the waste explodes and the game is over. The same happens if a stacked column reaches the upper border. The waste bins can be moved left and right, and they automatically fall down after a certain amount of time. This time gets shorter with progress in the game.

There are some special stones appearing randomly: a bomb, destroying the stones around it, a freezing barrel will prevent surrounding bins from exploding even if they have the same symbol. Another special will destroy all stones in it's way falling down. A high-score list is kept in the game and saved on exit.

sample_screenshots.caption: It leaves a wide hole in the formation on the bottom
It is also going down if the timer is reaching zero
You move the barrel at the top left to right and press the button to release it downward

title: Nuclear Waste Dump

description:
Znax is a puzzle game. On a 10x10 board there are stones in four different colors. The goal is to remove rectangular areas by marking four corners of the same color. It is not required that the area spanning under those points is of the same color, too. Once a rectangle is selected, the complete area is replaced with random stones. The bigger the rectangle, the more points you receive.

There are two playing modes giving you 2 or 5 minutes or playing time. Separate high-score tables are present for each of the modes.

sample_screenshots.caption: A small square. It's valid, but maybe not good for many points
Marking is done with the left button, right deletes all markings
Let's go for some bigger rectangles (worth more points)

title: Znax

description:
Pooz is a puzzle game with several playing modes. You control a small guy in the middle of the screen and are only able to move in a small 4x4 area. Pills are constantly appearing at the outside and moving towards the centre. The pills are colored in four colors, while the player itself is also having a color. Pointing to a pill with the same color in the direction of the player, the pill disappears. If the pill is having a different color, the pill is colored in the color of the player and the player gains the next of the four colors.

The different playing modes are "Continual", in which the pills approach from an empty board. With certain amount of points, the next level is reached and the pills appearing in shorter time intervals. If a pill stack reaches the centre, the game is over. In "Level" mode you can decide yourself how fast the pills appear and how many fill the screen on the beginning. Finally "Time Attack" is starting with a completely filled board and you have to remove a certain amount of pills in a given time without any pills added.

Three two-player modes are available in which you either play as team, or against each other or in a mode in a "Combo" mode. Team play is like "Continual" mode in single player mode. Playing against each other, one player can only remove pills at the top and bottom, while the other has access to left and right pills. If a pill is removed, it appears in the opponents area!

With success you unlock cards, and a high-score table keeps track of your success.

sample_screenshots.caption: In level mode you can set the game parameters yourself
I could color the orange below

title: Pooz

description:
Penta is a puzzle game with moving mechanics. The 5x5 board is filled with numbers from 1 up to 25. The goal is to sort them from the upper left corner (1) to the lower right corner (25). You can do this by rotating either columns or rows (e.g. if you rotate a row to the right with number "6" most left, after rotating it will be most left). For each level you only have a specific amount of moves to reorder the numbers. Running out of moves ends the game.

The boards are not pre-defined, but randomly created by the computer making a specific amount of rotations from an sorted board. This amount is increased in later levels or with higher difficulty settings. You can chose between two playing: the "Challenge Mode" in which you progress as far as possible. "Daily new fun stuff" mode presents single levels of four different difficulty settings. A high-score table keeps track of the success of the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: At least some points were rewarded for my effort!
Only two turns left. This will not be enough to solve the problems...

title: Penta

description:
Super Tet is a Tetris conversion. It features both single and two-player game mode.

In single player mode, levels are not increased during play, but are clearly separated: on finishing a level by reaching a certain amount of points, the board is cleared completely and the game increases speed of the stones. Also, from level 3, there are random stones placed somewhere on the board. Two player games can be played in the "Normal" mode, which plays like the single player game, but with the screen divided in two play-fields. The second two player mode, "Tetra Kill" is nasty: if a player forces his stone to fall faster (by pressing the joystick button), this is also happening for the stone on the other players field.

A high-score table is present and can be saved.

sample_screenshots.caption: Later levels are starting with some stones places randomly in the level

title: Super Tet

description:
Shockwave is a modified conversion of Asteroids.

The player's ship is not rotating like in the original game, but can move in all eight directions. There is no flow in the movement, the ship is instantly stopping if the joystick is released. Running over a border enters the opposite site of the screen, which is also true for all the asteroids approaching and split under fire of the player's gun. Some of the destroyed asteroids leave small "M" icons, which represent minerals and should be collected. Minerals are the currency in the game world and can be exchanged for goods between the levels. The shop is entered after each level and is run by an unfriendly alien, but it is selling extensions to the laser weapon (e.g. longer or faster shots), a shield, or extra lives. On later levels additional foes like rockets, shooting satellite stations or huge alien spaceships are coming for the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: Collected minerals can be traded for power-ups between the levels
Out ship looks a bit like a bug
Satellites, alien ships, and asteroids. A lot to blast here

title: Shockwave

description:
Orb is a freeware conversion of the puzzle game Sokoban. The goal of the game is to push boxes spread across a level on marked spots.

The game has not only converted the game mechanics, it even features the levels of the original game. The addition of Orb are some convenient and innovative approaches of control: clicking left on a field moves the player to the spot if no box pushing is required to reach the spot. Double clicking moves the player to that spot too, and pushes any box in the way. Up to four positions can be saved and the player can instantly return to them with the function keys. These functions do not alter the gameplay, but do make playing the game much faster, as by manually moving the player's avatar in Sokoban's levels sometimes require repetitive moving. Classic control via joystick is also supported as well as an undo function for the last move.

The game is implemented as system friendly application, so it can even be played in a multi-tasking operating system. There are two zoom levels, so even on smaller monitors no scrolling is required (although the game can scroll the maps if required).

sample_screenshots.caption: On this monitor, the scrolling makes the game more difficult
Level 1 with small icons. Help is also displayed
The graphic set can be zoomed, if you have a graphic card for higher resolution.

title: Orb

description:
BoinkOut2 is a Breakout conversion. The player controls a bat at the lower border of the screen and has to bound a ball flying around to crush all stones in a level. If the ball passes the lower border, a life is lost.

The paddle is controlled with the mouse and unlike the original game, the paddle can also be moved vertically in a small range. A high-score table keeps track of your success. The game runs with any color depth (from monochrome up to 256 colors).

sample_screenshots.caption: Even an Amiga icon is used as ball
Runnon on monochrome monitor (640x400). In the back: window with high-score table

title: BoinkOut2

description:
Creature Power is kind of a puzzle game. The player's job is to reach a jewel hidden deep in the sea by transforming into several animals.

But before that can be done, you have to qualify in a sub-game: the "Creature Power Frog Race". There are always two frogs competing and over three laps they randomly move forward (no user interaction is required or possible).

The winner of the race is allowed to enter the "Creature Power" part of the game. In a guessing game you are confronted with situation which you have to solve by transforming in a certain animal. In most cases, those picks end miserably (e.g. you pick the eel to swim, and get instantly eaten by a shark). For all the picks to finally reach the jewel you only have a limited amount of time. If an animal dies during your choices, you have to start again in the Frog Race.

sample_screenshots.caption: The moving is randomly, no interaction is possible
Eel was probably the wrong choice

title: Creature Power

description:
Alfreds Kistenlager Schiebereien is a conversion of the puzzle game Soko-ban to be played on the monochrome display. A worker named Alfred must move boxes distributed in a level to their destination spot. All levels are on a single screen.

It features all 50 levels from the original, but also adding an editor to modify existing or add new levels, which can also be saved to disk. Alfred is controlled with the cursor keys and as additional difficulty, you are only allowed to run three times into a wall. If this happens, Alfred resigns and the game is lost, so concentration is required if running long distances. For some convenience, macros with returning to a specific spot are included. The amount of steps and time required to solve a level are shown. A high-score table can be reached.

sample_screenshots.caption: Maybe nobody will have much fun with this level modification I added...
The editor: walls, destination spots, boxes and Alfred can be placed (all with keyboard)
Moving too fast I crushed into a wall and get a warning
The well known level 1 from Soko-ban

title: Alfreds Kistenlager Schiebereien

description:
Space Battle is a Spacewar clone.

On a single screen, two ships are fighting to destroy each other. The ships can be rotated. Unlike the original game, no gravity is taken into account. The big star in the centre of the screen, which was also present in the original can be turned off optionally, blocking shots and destroying any ship on collision. The second ship can be controlled by AI, so single player games are possible.

An addition to the Spacewar design is energy management: either accelerating your ship and shooting the weapon consumes energy. If you have enough energy left, you can transfer energy to your shields protecting yourself or, if energy is running low and you require to flee or continue shooting, you can also transfer shield energy to energy.

sample_screenshots.caption: Red with a risky manoeuvre at the star...
Game start without star in the centre
Title screen with menu (setting all the options)
Fighting with star in the centre

title: Space Battle

description:
tictactoe implements the classic Tic-Tac-Toe game on a 3x3 board.

Either playing with two players or playing against an AI is possible. Playing against the AI you can chose if you want to start yourself or if the AI is starting. The game is implemented as system- and multitasking friendly application.

sample_screenshots.caption: An old "trick" is working against the AI

title: tictactoe

description:
Spitzenreiter (German word for frontrunner) is a football manager game for up to four players. The players can compete in the highest four leagues of German football at the time (starting from the "Landesliga" up to the "Bundesliga"). You goal is to buy a competitive team, make enough money to buy hot players on the free market and win either the league and cup competitions.

Games are simulated quickly, with only text presentation of the events in-game, like scoring goals. During the game, the players only interacts on injuries or if a players is sent off. The multi-player mode is integral part of the game, as all the actions are not in rounds, but all players can take part on mostly all actions (but controlled with a single controller, the mouse). For example in the transfer market players can be selected and all players can make their offer at the same time (there are buttons for all players).

The game does not feature any training settings, and the players on the market are mainly established German professional players with some international additions. Income from TV and stadiums is automatically assigned. Contracts with players has to be renewed, and transfer prices are automatically created by the game.

All in-game texts are in German.

sample_screenshots.caption: Due to injuries and cards, I only have 8 players left in my team. Problem: I am deep in the debts ("Vermoegen"), so no money to buy others
After accumulating debts over 5 bill, your league points are set back to zero, but at least you get a 2 bill reduction.
My only goalkeeper is injured! Now that requires instant action on the transfer market.
Club selection: most (all?) clubs from the top four German leagues of 1993 can be chosen
Main menu: loading and saving games. Set the starting league for all players

title: Spitzenreiter

description:
Spitzenreiter 2 is an enhanced successor of Spitzenreiter. In this football manager up to four players compete in league and cup competitions.

Gameplay is extended from the original version: training days can be assigned on a six week scheme for improving your squad. The financial possibilities are more flexible as in the predecessor, as more options are available: you can set ticket prices, chose sponsors and you can even invest some money in buying the press.

In contrast to the real club and player names featured in the older game, in Spitzenreiter 2 both clubs and players are named with fantasy names, which can be edited. Major changes are made on the user interface, which is now featuring more icons and colors. Games can be saved. All texts are in German.

sample_screenshots.caption: The main in-game menu: access all managers (right) and all options and info screens (left). Mid: chose sponsors, TV money, ticket prices etc.
Top scorers (players of any managers marked in red)
Matches can be played with different systems: 3 points/win, 2 points/win or 2 points with random winner on draw
Main menu: assign leagues and starting capital for all players
Clubs of all four leagues are fantasy names now

title: Spitzenreiter 2

description:
ESLA League Manager III is the final game in the series of German football managing games. For the first time in the series, the game is not only available in German, but also translated to English. Like in the predecessors, up to four players can manage a club in the first four leagues, participating in league and cup competitions (national and international).

The graphical interface is much more colorful and more detailed information about player and team performance are shown, and the options to tweak the gameplay allow a finer control like in the former two games. For example you can set specific starting settings for your team and conditions for winning and loosing the game, like disabling the sacking because of debts, as well as the strength of leagues. You can choose the nation you want to play the leagues in, which is modifying player generation. Like in Spitzenreiter 2, the clubs are fantasy ones, but now they are assigned to a city, so now Liverpool is playing against Manchester, even if the clubs are called "Rebels Liverpool" and "Mjöllnir Manchester". For single matches, tactical formations can be set, you can set a motivation level for the game, bribe the referee or set an extra bonus for the players. Also, the training options are extended, you can either set the pre-season training schedule for six weeks and during the season the training for a single week. Games are still presented as series of the events like goals, but after the match a finer analyses of the game including individual ranks for each player, is shown. On the transfer market you can strengthen your team by buying new players or negotiate the contracts of the players of your squad.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main options: amount of players, their starting league, starting money and stadium
Specific goals for a season can earn you additional money

title: ESLA League Manager III

description:
Premium Mah Jongg is a Shanghai implementation. It features the "Turtle" layout for stones and the standard 144 stone set.

There are two game modes. In "Solitaire" mode, you simply can play without any time pressure while in "Tournament" mode you have, with increasing difficulty, between 12 and 4 minutes to clear the board. If you get any advice from the program to show possible moves, the high score is frozen at this time. If there are no more possible moves left, the game is instantly ended. You can repeat the last move. The high-score table is saved to disk.

The game is running on all GEM machines, with tile sets in monochrome and 16-colors. Especially the monochrome high-res resolution of the Atari TT is supported.

sample_screenshots.caption: Maybe this time I can beat it.
Removed some stones and suddenly no more move is possible. Damn.

title: Premium Mah Jongg

description:
Galactic Empires is a multi-player turn-based strategy game. Up to seven players compete to conquer the galaxy. Each player is starting on a home planet and a certain amount of ships. Each turn, the fleet or parts of it can be moved. Travelling to other worlds takes time, and reaching distant worlds may take several rounds. During each round, random events may happen, from pirate attacks or natural disasters, affecting one or more players and fleets. If a fleet is approaching a world defended by another fleet, a simply fight takes place without interaction: there is a random element involved, but generally the player with the bigger fleet wins.

Being a plain multi-player game, the game offers to print the galaxy map upfront. This is handy, because the input of all players has to be typed in blindly (so no other player can see your commands). Commands are always encoded in three numbers: "move X ships from world Y to world Z".

The size of the galaxy and the length of play in years can be set at the beginning. Games can be saved and loaded. There is no AI for single player matches.

sample_screenshots.caption: About to reach a defended world
As all moves are typed in blindly, printing of the map may help the players to plan their assault
As the world is defended, a fight happens (automatically). No interaction involved, some random element, but we should win this
Loaded a demo game with mostly all worlds settled: world number, player and the size of the fleet on the world (attention: fleets moving are not counted).

title: Galactic Empires

description:
Tautology is an enhanced conversion of Match it. On a 16x6 board different symbols are shown. Two symbols can be removed if a connection between them has only two corners. From most symbols there are four of the same, some special symbols can be interconnected with each other (like the seasons stones in Mahjong).

The original game is extended by offering a lot of options: there are two different tile sets, the player can specify which stones should be in the set, time limit can be turned on and off, and there is a two player mode. In the two player mode each player has it's own board on the screen. There are two modes, "Separate" and "Competitive". In the first, both players are simply clearing their boards, while in the competitive mode the faster player wins a round.

The game runs in Truecolor mode (Falcon only).

sample_screenshots.caption: Competitive two player game with alternative tile set
Two player game: single player game splitted. Player 2 can use joystick 0 or joypad 0.
Entering the high-score is announced with small letters

title: Tautology

description:
Tautology II is an enhanced version of the game Tautology released one year earlier. In terms of gameplay both games play identical and feature the same modes for single player and multi player games. So, still the board have to be cleaned by connecting identical stones or stones from the same set, with a maximum of two edges in this connection.

The successor differs in terms of game options and convenience. The user interface is more accessible, mouse and keyboard controls are added to joystick and joypad control, there are new graphical tiles, and more options are available than in the predecessor. Time limits and the amount of available help calls can be configured for each player, allowing a more interesting multi-player game if the skill of the players is very different. In single player mode you progress in levels after clearing a board, getting more difficult boards in the next higher level.

A high-score table is present. The game runs in High-color mode on the Atari Falcon.

sample_screenshots.caption: The connection of stone removal is now shown
Entered a place in the high-score table

title: Tautology II

description:
Double Bobble 2000 is a port of Bubble Bobble to the Atari Falcon. Gameplay is converted from the arcade machine and not the rather inadequate commercial port to the Atari ST hardware from 1987.

All 100 levels are present, the two-player mode is implemented and game-play and bonus system are adequately converted, even shooting at the walls is rewarded like in the original game. All extra-weapons are there, either the yellow and blue candy, the umbrellas, bombs, and bubbles shooting lightnings, as well as extra bonus point elements like the crown and others. Control of the dragons is precise and can be mapped on the keyboard, but also joysticks and joypads are usable. You can easily jump on your bubbles to gain heights. The famous "Extend" characters are available, and of course the white wale hunting you on taking too long is also available. On clearing a level there is a bit more time to collect bonus elements like in the original. The game is starting with four lives and seven credits.

The graphics are in high-color mode (65.000 colors), so the original platform graphics is redrawn using much more colors. Sampled voices and effects are added as additional effects. A high-score table can be reached. Being a shareware licenced game, on registering the player got an editor, which can handle levels using the mouse, replace graphics. Also, the extension Double Bobble - The Further Adventures with 100 new levels was granted.

sample_screenshots.caption: The "normal" bomb found. Else a lot of lightning bubbles would be required to clear this level
Hint: in this level you can reach a hidden room if some constraints are fulfilled
Many effects are added like the umbrella zooming

title: Double Bobble 2000

description:
Pac Them is a clone running on the Atari Falcon.

It does feature four ghosts with slightly different behaviour, power-pills to take revenge and eat the ghosts for a short time, and a lot of pills to eat to clear the level. There are 20 different level maps which are not taken from the original, but created for this game. An addition to the classic game is the adding of teleporter fields: touching one of this elements, you are instantly ported to the other teleporter, which can be handy to trick the ghosts. Fruits, which are rewarding some extra points are randomly spawning at certain positions in the level. They award 1000 points, which is equal to the amount of points capturing all four ghosts with a power-pill. A high-score table is available and saved to disk. During the game, no music is played, but there are sampled effects.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shareware promotion for <moby game="Ganymed" platform="Atari ST">Ganymed</moby>

title: Pac Them

description:
Argon is a room-based shooter which plays like Cybernoid. A spaceship has to be manoeuvred through a maze of single screens, which are flipped on reaching any border with a connection to another room. The ship can only shoot horizontally, but can turn inside the level so shot left and right. Moving enemies can be shot and transform into coins to collect. Rooms are guarded by either moving enemies on fixed flying paths and turrets, which fire in random patterns. Contact with any wall or obstacle in a level is, like being hit by any shot, an instant death. Occasionally there are shops in the levels which offer e.g. a bigger shot, missiles or a shield in exchange for the collected money.

The ultimate goal of the game is to collect six green magic balls and find the exit of the maze, which is guarded by an end-of-level boss. There is no high-score table, but exploration progress is shown on Game Over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your small ship starts in the upper left corner of the room
Some more extra money to collect
Another unreachable green ball and a long way to pass the turret
The green balls are the primary goal to collect. Six are required to finish the game

title: Argon

description:
Stello is an implementation of the Reversi/Othello board game. Two players with white and black stones are setting in turns, flipping all stones of the other color which are in a line of the same color, either horizontally, vertically or diagonal.

Stello is a GEM program, displaying information in several windows. The user can view the board, move history, analyses information of the board position and the board transition. All those informations can also be exported and printed, directly from the game. The player can play against a strong computer AI, or two human players compete against each others or you can watch the game playing against itself. Games can be saved and loaded. The board and window graphics can be loaded, there are several sets in 2 up to 16 colors on the game disk. Language in-game can be switched during game, with English, German, French and Danish available.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another picture included with the game
File options: loading and saving, and also extended export and printing
Language can be switched during the game

title: Stello

description:
The universe is under attack (again). On EMAR II, home of some rare energy crystals, an alien fleet stopped by. Defence is reduced to a single turret gun named "Kiss My Ass".

Recoil is a Defender clone. You control the ship and can scroll to both left and right by turning your ship into the desired direction. A huge radar map on the bottom of the screen show enemy activities. In the game, there is a twist on the original scheme: your ship is mounted on some building on the top of the screen and therefore constantly rising back to the top of the screen, which makes control a bit more challenging.

The goal is to destroy any moving enemy, while collecting energy and bringing those energy crystals to your base. You have three lives initially and can release a smart bomb as emergency exit.

sample_screenshots.caption: The radar on the bottom is showing the location of the bad guys
Game start: your ship is mounted on the top (and return to there), is always in the mid of the screen. You can turn left and right and shoot

title: Recoil

description:
Graveyard is a slightly extended version of Asteroids. Your ship is mounted in the centre of the screen and can rotate in both directions. If you enable thrust, your ship is not moving on the screen like in the original game, but the screen is scrolling.

You crush asteroids into smaller pieces until they ultimately release some blue crystals which you can collect to get a smart bomb. The smart bomb destroys anything currently visible on the screen. There are three bars on the right: energy, hull strength and the time until a huge alien ship arrives at the scene. On destroying this huge ship, you finish the level. This is not an easy task as you are constantly attacked by very fast fighters and their homing missiles.

There is a radar indicating all items and enemies in the current section of space, from asteroids, minor enemy vessels, missiles, crystals and the big alien ship.

sample_screenshots.caption: Player ship: centre. Everything else: evil
Level boss (the big one), guarded by many fast ships and their missiles. Too much for me
Three bar: T empty which means the guardian has arrived, H: my ship's hull (too low) and E for energy.
Spectacular end... Maybe I should have used a smart bomb
As if the spare explosions wouldn't hinted me on that

title: Graveyard

description:
Ausbruch (German word for "Break out") is a puzzle game played on a board of the size 14x15. In the beginning on each tile there is a small person standing. Each of those little men and women are wearing a sweater in one of four possible colors. If at least two persons of the same color are standing beside each other, they can be removed. On a removal, all tiles connected in the same color are removed.

If you remove at least six persons at the same time, you get an Extra of the amount of tiles removes minus three (so removing 6 gets a "3" extra, 7 a "4" and so on). As you clear fields, the fields above are "falling" down, filling the gaps. Once a row is cleared, a number tile appears randomly. This numbers can be removed when connecting them to the number of same colored tiles, which often is very difficult. More convenient, you can remove them with an extra of the same number (so a "5" extra can not remove a "3" number tile). Removing the numbers is very important, as new persons only appear if less than four number stones are on the board.

If there are no more possible removals, the game is lost. A high-score table can be reached.

sample_screenshots.caption: Selected nine brown sweaters, that will reward a nice extra
If we remove some, all above are falling down
...we have removes 7, 8 and 7 stones to get those extras. We will need them later

title: Ausbruch

alternate_titles.description: Short title used in the manual
alternate_titles.title: PMJ II

description:
Premium Mah Jongg II is an slightly enhanced version of Premium Mah Jongg. The most significant update is that all texts in the game are in English language now, while the former game was in German only. Gameplay doesn't changed, wih playing is still traditional Mah Jongg with the "Turtle" board setup and many convenience functions.

The two playing modes "Solitaire", with no time limit, and "Tournament", with different time limits, are accompanied with an off-line multi-player mode called "Happening". In this mode the game creates eight boards and the game saves those on any amount of floppy disks. Each player participating in the Happening is getting such a disk and can start the game using that disk. The game presents all eight boards with a time limit of 3 minutes for each, and the score for all is accumulated and the results are stored back on disk. According to the manual, the looser of the round has to invite all others to a Chinese Restaurant.

Playing Mah Jongg often end in an board position where further progress in impossible. Premium Mah Jongg II now has a solver included that can determine if a certain position has a solution or you can even restart the same board and check if it is possible to be cleared at all.

The UI was improved to support mostly any Atari video hardware and is now running even on graphic cards in very high resolutions. The high-score table was extended to 100 entries and there is an external conversion tool included on disk to convert the old high-score tables to the new format.

sample_screenshots.caption: Maybe I can solve this one
Score was sufficient for a place in the top-100
Autosolving of the board. Even if the game found up to 67 pairs, it cannot solve the board position. The calculation took several hours on a normal Atari ST.
You can now set the color of tiles and background

title: Premium Mah Jongg II

description:
Only! Valency is a puzzle game in which you have to reconstruct molecules. Each molecule is consisting of atoms in six different colors with connections to each other. On the lower border you have a strip with according atoms, which you can scroll left and right to select an appropriate color. You can only set atoms on spots connected to any atom already added to the molecule (and in each level at the beginning one atom is given). There are some constraints on adding atoms: beside a connection to an already added atom the nearest connection in the selected columns must be of the same color than chosen in the stripe below. Adding always go from the top to the bottom, and if any atom in the chosen column is lower than the free spot, this column is blocked. To reach free spots, you can rotate the atom in 90 degree steps and move the adding column left and right.

The goal in Only! Valency is strictly time based and the game forces you to add the atoms as fast as possible by rewarding better times with higher scores. But you have to be careful: if you have chosen a wrong color or adding to a blocked column, you are punished with fault points. Also, in some situations, you have to add atoms from the left or right, which is valid, but also increasing your fault score.

There are three playing mode: in "Solitaire" mode you have no time limit, but building the molecule faster gets you a higher score. In "Tournament" mode you have an overall time limit for rebuilding the molecule. In "Fallout" you have a maximum time per atom, which is reset after adding one atom. Both time limits in Tournament and Fallout can be chosen by the player. A high-score list keeps track of the players success. There are 300 levels which you can play in any order. Language in the game is either English or German.

sample_screenshots.caption: Some rotating is required in this level
After playing some levels, the game ranks your success with an overall "IQ" value. Lower is better.
In both Tournament and Fallout mode you can set the time limit before the start

title: Only! Valency

description:
Clogged up is a moving puzzle game. On a 6x6 board your goal is to reach the exit with your clog shoe. It can only left and right and the way is blocked by many different stones in different lengths (2-4). All those stones can only be moved in the direction of their orientation, so some can moved up and down, others left and right (in later levels there are blocks movable in all directions). You have to move the stones until the way is free for your clog to move to the exit.

There are six worlds with several levels to unlock, starting with a Dutch theme and an Atari theme in world two. Each level solved is saved so you do not have to play it again. There are no points, but "loscores", which are the amount of moves required until the level is finished. Also, if you only use the minimum account of moves possible, the score is marked as "perfect". For each level solved you get additional help calls, which can be used if you are stuck. In a two-player multi-player mode two identical boards are displayed beside each other and the players simultaneously try to make the position as difficult as possible. After a given time the boards are swapped and each player has to solve the position the other player set up. The faster player wins the round.

There are high-score tables (or "loscore" table in this game), which are saved to disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: Phase 1: Shuffle phase. Each player tries to make the board as complicated as possible
Single player: world 2 features an Atari theme
You can move the stones only in their orientation, so e.g. green only left and right, yellow only up and down
In the top left corner the amount of moves used in this level is displayed. "Loscore" is the current "high-score" (the lower the better) and "Helps" is the amount of hints available

title: Clogged Up

description:
Frog-Race is a conversion of Frog Race on the Commodore PET.

Up to nine players can make bets on frogs. There are five successive races in which the players can place their bets on one of the six frogs competing in the race or skip any bet. Any amount of bet is allowed with a given starting amount of 500£ for each player. Each frog has an individual name and race record. The races are simulated without any user interaction.

sample_screenshots.caption: But in the end frog on lane 2 took the lead
The frog on lane 3 got a good start

title: Frog-Race

description: Crapman has grown tired of his boring life and decides to make a voyage through Europe searching for real love. But to travel he needs money, luckily the streets of Europe are littered with money (in the form of dots). Crapman is a Pac-man clone, collect all of the dots (money) in the level to continue on to the next one and avoid the ghosts. Special bonus items will give the player additional points. Sometimes special bonuses will appear on the level such as extra life, double score and double speed. When it is time to move on to a new country the player will see a cut-scene.
title: Crapman - A Game for Real Heroes

description: In Apparition Finder the player works for the Inter-Dimensional Slime Fabrication Facility as the apparition finder. As the name implies the Inter-Dimensional Slime Fabrication Facility manufactures slime. Slime is stored in huge holding vats and the players job is to rescue ghosts that have been trapped in these vats. There are a total of 24 ghosts to save, 6 in each vat. The player moves the detector at the bottom of the vat and can shoot detector beams into the vat. When a beam hits ecto-plasm a ghost is restored and once all 6 are restored it is on to the next vat. Hitting a ghost twice is not a good idea, the beam will bounce back to the detector and then the player have to start all over again. Time is of the essence since slime is on its way to the tank and once it enters it the ghosts will die.

sample_screenshots.caption: The slime is on its way
All six ghosts rescued in this vat

title: Apparition Finder

description: Alterra is a strategy game where the objective is to use the armies to conquer all of the cities. An army can contain up to eight different type of units. Movement cost depends on the terrain and mountains is impassable except for flying armies. Water may only be entered and exited by cities or by harbours. Own cities produces a certain amount of gold each turn and gold can be used for recruiting units to the armies or hire heroes. Battle outcome is decided by die rolls: both fighting units roll a 24 sided die and if the attacker's roll is higher than the defener's total strength and the defender's roll is equal or lower than the attacker's total strength then the defender takes one damage. Various conditions may give players bonuses in battles, for example if a hero is with the army it will be stronger. Cities can be defended with up to 32 different units. The game comes with two maps and a map editor. As for version 1.01 AI is not yet implemented.
title: Alterra

description: 3D-lab is a simplistic 3D labyrinth game. In each level the player must find the exit. For each level the area of the labyrinth expands: The first level is a labyrinth of the size 4x4, the labyrinth on level two is 5x5 and so on.
title: 3D-lab

description: Aerius is a puzzle game in which the objective is to clear all the colored blocks from the game area. Blocks are cleared from the game are by combining blocks of the same color. The game area consists of three large squares at the bottom of the screen and five small squares at the top. Clicking on a large square that has blocks in it will make the top most row of blocks transfer to the squares at the to of the screen, the player may then choose in which large square the block(s) at the top shall transfer to. underneath each large square are two arrows and if they are enabled they allow the player to turn the area around, left to right and top to bottom.
title: Aerius

description:
Mac Pan is an extended implementation of Pac-Man idea on Atari ST computers with monochrome monitor. Like in the original game, the player controls a circled avatar trying to munch all dots in a level before getting caught by four wandering ghosts. On eating on of the rare power-pills, you can temporarily reverse this and chase the ghosts and kill them for extra points.

The game features four different mazes, all with four power-pills and the possibility to transfer to the other side in the centre of the screen (you leave the screen on one side and enter on the other). On finishing all four levels the game continues in the first maze in a higher level, increasing the aggression and speed of the ghosts. The ghosts themselves vary and speed and follow slightly different strategies to hunt the player. After each 10.000 points an extra life is rewarded. Points can only be collected by eating points in the level and chasing ghosts with power-pills, there are no bonus items like in the original.

The game has a flexible difficulty level: with a slider you can adjust the game's speed, which affect both the player and the ghosts. On very slow setting the game is far easier than with higher speeds. An unique extension to the Pac-Man theme is a temporary speed boost: by pressing the joystick button the player moves quicker for a short time period and so may escape the ghosts. But using this feature comes at a cost: after using the boost, you are slowed for the rest of the life or the level, whichever comes first.

Two different multi-player modes for two players are available in Mac Pan: you can either play after each other trying to beat the high-score. The other mode is a simultaneous coop mode, in which both players play in the same level at the same time. Both players share the score and the live-reserves, so if the last life is lost, the game ends for both players. A high-score table can be reached and is saved to disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: After eating a power pill (cross), the ghosts fade and are can be eaten! Let's hunt them.
Two player simultaneous mode: both player's sprite are looking identical and share the same reserve lives, but have individual scores
After killing a ghost, it's remains must travel to the ghost house (centre of the screen) first, which gives you some additional time
Maze 3 has a more narrow design
The final frame of a single player game. Surrounded by very aggressive ghosts (it's level 2 as marked by "L: 2" at the top)

title: Mac Pan

description:
The "Bouncing Bouble" aliens want to conquer the earth. The player has to prevent this by eliminating all enemies with the "Super Bouble Blaster". Bouncing Boubles is an arcade shooting game inspired by early coin-op games like e.g. Galaga.

On single screen levels, the player controls a small ship, which can be moved left and right and shoot straight up and is confronted with one or multiple enemies of four different types. The first two enemy types are bouncing, that means they fall down and bounce back up, but loose some height on each jump. The circle enemies have no weapons, while the other bouncing enemies drop mines. Both must be eliminated before they reach the bottom. Dropped mines explode at the ground and touching them before the explosion is completely over (indicated by an animation) is deadly. The other enemy types are shooting at the player, firing laser weapons if they are above the player's ship. The last enemy vessel type is the most dangerous one: it does not only shot lasers if above the players ship, but also throwing multiple mines diagonally.

In the first levels all four enemy types are introduced, in later levels they appear in mixed formations with increasing numbers and with more of the more dangerous types. There are 40 levels to be played. On loosing a life, the current level is restarted with all enemies. For each 300 points the player is rewarded an extra-life. There are two playing modes controlling the difficulty: in the single shooting mode you have to press the joystick button for each single shot, while in the easier setting your ship's cannon is auto-firing while the button is pressed.

sample_screenshots.caption: In later levels the four enemy types appear in mixed formations
The third enemy type consists of many smaller ships. If does not bounce, but fires a laser weapon if above the player
First enemy type: the circles are jumping and bouncing from the ground and walls. Destroy before they reach the ground!
Title screen (showing enemies from the last level)

title: Bouncing Boubles

description:
Abalone is an unofficial port of the board game of the same name to Atari ST computers with monochrome monitors.

The players move up to three marbles at a time, setting them on pegs arranged in a hexagonal shape, trying to push each other spheres out of the board. The opponent's marbles can only be moved when a certain alignment is achieved, where the player spheres are in specific superior numbers like 3 to 2, 3 to 1 or 2 to 1.

The game feature single player games with three different AI players, as well as a two-player hot-seat mode. Moves can be taken back with an Undo function. The game can be started on the default board or on a randomly created position.

sample_screenshots.caption: Randomly created boards create additional an additional challenge
Starting screen with empty board (Monochrome monitor)

title: Abalone

description:
PKS-Dame is an implementation of the board game checkers for one or two players.

In single player games the AI can be set on three difficulty levels, from beginner to professional. The game can be started with the default layout or the player can build an specific board situation with the integrated editor. Games can be saved and loaded.

A helpfile with the rules is integrated in the game, although all texts are in German.

sample_screenshots.caption: One stone is upgraded to a queen stone (two circles)
Setting up a custom board situation with the editor
On the color display, the graphic is still monochrome, but missing each second line (Color monitor, medium resolution 640x200x4 colors)

title: PKS-Dame

description: In Zyklop the player controls a blue, spherical cyclops. Help it collect diamonds and avoid the skulls and walls. Diamonds are placed at random locations one at a time. Every time a diamond is collected 50 points is added to the players score and a skull appears in its place. Once enough diamonds have been collected it is of to the next level. The player starts with 6 lives. The game plays a lot like a snake game except that the cyclops doesn't grow larger when it collects diamonds.

sample_screenshots.caption: Firts diamond will be easy to collect

title: Zyklop

description: Zyklop 2 - Hyleilos is the sequel to Zyklop. This sequel features larger levels, diamonds are no longer placed at random locations, there is a time limit for each level, there are special blocks that for example only allows travel in one direction and there is bonus items that can award the player extra points among other things. Every time the player travels between screens the cyclops is stopped. Collected diamonds turns into skulls that will kill the player on contact. Hitting a wall will also result in death. Once every diamond in the level have been collected a door appears that leads to the next level. The game features a total of 26 levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: The door to the next level
Those two diamonds will be easy to collect
Those arrows can only be passed in one direction

title: Zyklop 2 - Hyleilos

description: World Cup is a football management game. The player can choose to manage the team for England, Scotland, Ireland or Wales and the goal of the game is to make the chosen team win the world cup. Team morale plays an important part: winning a game will rise the morale and losing a game will lower it, if it reaches zero the player will be fired and that means game over. Every month the things to be done on certain days can be found in the diary. Every month usually starts with squad selection, except those in which there are a friendly game in then the player first have to choose which country to play against. There is a scout function that gives the player some info about other teams. When the days actions are done the player must press the "Next day"-button to advance the game.
title: World Cup

description: In Tri-Heli II the player pilots a chopper and must collect diamonds that are buried in the ground. To reach the diamonds the player must use the choppers gun to blast holes in the ground. But once the player starts to "dig" a plane that flies at the top of the screen will start dumping dirt over the hole to fill it up. Once a diamond has been collected the player must return to the helipad before picking up another diamond. When enough diamonds has been collected it's of to the next level. The ground level varies between levels. To add to the difficulty guns will drop from the sky from time to time. Once these hits the ground they will start firing.
title: Tri-Heli II

description:
The goal of Travelgame is to visit all of the 36 cities that are listed within the game.

First the player chooses a continent and then a home base. After that it is time to travel. The main game screen shows the current continent and a menu with 8 buttons: Home base, photo, money, time, game progress, Airport, travel and hotel. To finance the trip the player must take and sell photos. On the photo screen the player are presented with eight pictures (divided between two screens) and must click on the one that best resembles the place where the player currently is. If the player chooses to stay at a hotel he or she might meet a person that is willing to pay good for the right photos. Traveling is done by clicking on any of the available cities on the map screen. Visited cities will have a red outline around their names.

sample_screenshots.caption: I've still got plenty of money

title: Travelgame

description:
Tablit 2 is a word puzzle game where the player/players has to form as long words as possible and every new word must start as the last word ended. For example if player one entered end player two may start the next word with "end", "nd" or "d". The more letters that are kept from the previous players word the more bonus points are awarded. After a player has entered a word it is checked against a wordlist (if the players has choose to use one) and if it isn't in the wordlist the player/players may choose if the word should be accepted or rejected. If no wordlist is used the player/players always has to make that choice. If no letters are placed on the board during a turn that player may then swap one or more letters. The game ends either when all the letters have been used up or when the time limit is reached. The game comes with a wordlist of 10000 words.

Game statistics may be exported from the game to a file or to a printer.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ok, lets see how many letters I should keep

title: Tablit 2

description: Super League Soccer is a football manager game. Start with a team in division 4 and try to make it to the top of the league. The game is menu driven, the main menu gives the player access to the next match, the league table, the squad menu, the transfer market, the economy menu, the training menu and other options. The training menu gives the player the possibility to train different parts of the team or the whole team. The only economy options is to take or repay loans. In the transfer market the player may buy new team members. The name of the players and teams is customizable.

sample_screenshots.caption: The results are in: Mobygame won 5 to 0
I can change the name of the teams
A match doesn't get more interesting than this

title: Super League Soccer

description:
Square Off - The Rosetta Stoned Remix is a labyrinth game where the player has to reach the exit without getting trapped or killed. The game area consists of a board with 9 x 9 squares. The start is marked 'S' and the end is marked with a red/orange circle. There are several special squares:

  • Squares the gives points: These are marked with the number of points they give
  • One direction squares: An arrow marks the travel direction
  • Two direction squares: A double headed arrow shows if the player can pass it horizontally or vertically
  • Fire squares: Can fire in one or two directions. These can be used to kill monsters
  • Teleport: These are marked with a T and teleport the player
  • Monster generator: These are marked with a M and will generate monsters when moved over

From level 7 monsters starts to appear on the board. If the player touches a monster a life is lost.
title: Square Off: The Rosetta Stoned Remix

description:
No Name is a game in which you are controlling a bubble with the joystick on the quest to explore rooms and find an exit of a labyrinth. The bubble can be controlled by pressing the button and the joystick up, but without constantly pressing up the bubble is loosing height. Gaining height costs energy and you should avoid running out if the power to control your bubble. Any contact with the walls or obstacles causes the player to loose one of it's five lives. There are doors which constantly open or closes, switches to press to open other doors, and teleporters bringing you to other rooms. Overall there are 27 rooms.

After the player lost all the lives, a statistics about the percentage of explored rooms is displayed and - if enough points are scored - an entry in the high-score table can be reached. There is a continue function allowing to start a new game at the room the last was lost in the previous game.

The game is written in GFA Basic and the source code is also available on the disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: Passed that door and found a room with the next switch. What may it disable or activate?
Using the teleporter brings us to room number 6
You control the bubble left. Below is a teleporter
The door left is turning on and off. Passing it allows access to the switch, turning off the door on the upper right

title: No Name

description:
Mafia: The Game is an economical simulation in the world of crime. In a fictive city, the player can trade with real estates, take loans from the bank in the attempt to get more money. You can rent your flats to people, ensure you have discotheques and guest houses in all parts of the city. All those businesses require money and personal to run, which you can hire on the market.

But in this game, beside your bank account and official business, you also have black money deposit and can trade with drugs, weapons or information. Instead of giving your flats for rent, you can also hire some prostitutes and use the flat as a whorehouse. You can hire chemical staff to run drug production, install betting agencies and other non-legal businesses. If you hire some rowdies, you can send your gang for some protection money or directly to rob a bank. Finally, you can even send a killer to your opponents.

Each month you can set up your things and after this turn, you get a report how your business is developing. There are random events, like the police arrested some of your employees and you can decide to pay the bail money or not. Those random events can be created with an external program in the game package. Games can be saved and loaded. The difficulty of the game can be set by the amount of money you have at the beginning.

The game is only available in German languages and only runs on the monochrome monitor.

sample_screenshots.caption: As I am running out of legal cash, I get a big loan
Main screen with information about your financial situation
Analyses of the last turn: overview over normal accounts, black money, income, and employees
And as I require even more money, I plan a bank robbery. Even planning it is expensive
Trade flats, houses, guest houses and discotheques in all parts of the town

title: Mafia: The Game

description:
Mafia 2: The Game is the successor of Mafia: The Game. As in the original game, your goal is to become the local don in the criminal underground of a simulated city. In this trading simulation you can do some legal business, like trading houses, but you can also build drug labs into those houses, produce a lot of cocaine and hire some dealers to sell your stuff.

The second Mafia game overhauls the user interface completely and is adding some new features, but the major part of the game remains like in the former game. A central office allows you now manage your employees. It is also the place new messages arrive, like you lost money on horse bets. You now have four direct opponents and between each turn you get information about their actions. You can hire informants to get more detailed information. Income from drug production and your dealers work on spreading those is now more clear.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your office. Here you can access analyses of your situation (and answer the phone, on which random events are reported)
The game is also running on color monitors (640x480x16 colors)
After the rounds you see important actions of your opponents
After building some labs and hiring some dealers, our drug business starts off
Game menu: skip time (top panel), load and save

title: Mafia 2: The Game

description:
Formel 1 - Manager is a sporting simulation in German language. The player takes the role of a team manager and has to set up a competing team with a limited budget. You can hire two drivers, buy tires and engines, and compete in races, which are shown as text results. Each type of car part is available in three different models, with different costs and performance. Between the races random events occur, which are sometimes positive, like you get a new sponsor which grants you money, or very negative, like you just bought the most expensive engine and it broke during the training. If you cannot afford participating in a race, because you do not have the required parts for two cars, your drivers are not starting and you do not get any positive effects. After the season you get an overall report and can decide to play again.

The game is written in GFA Basic and only runnable on monochrome monitors.

sample_screenshots.caption: Between the races random event occur: my newly bough Ford V8 engine is broken. Damned!
The season is over. I finished at the end, but with lots of money left over -- I think I should have invested even more
Only the results are presented of the races. Both of my drivers dropped out of the race. No points for me then
You have to hire two drivers (first and second car)
Title screen with animated car (Monochrome monitor)

title: Formel 1 - Manager

description:
Fussball.prg is a small football simulation game in German language. In a league with eight clubs your team is heading for winning the championship. The player takes the role of the club manager, who trades players and set some strategic decisions. For example, the amount of money to invest in your youth center can be set, as well as the amount to for medical services and public relations. Players can be traded freely. The players in the game do not have names, but values. The top players are valued 2.000.000, while a common player is only worth 250.000. Higher valued players propose better chances to win. Creation of the values of the player of a squad in the first place is mainly based on luck: for all the players in the player's team, a value between the lowest and highest can be played by a kind of slot machine. With very good timing this may be solved better, but in general it is random.

The matches are simulated by showing the goals but without any possible interaction by the player. After each match day, the coach can dismissed, if the teams performance didn't matched the expectations.

You can chose the leagues to play in from nine premade leagues in the beginning, but you can also create your own league and team with an external league editor program which is part of the package.

sample_screenshots.caption: Set the amounts to invest in youth, medics, organization and public relations
Final table of the season -- I finished third
I had a lot of luck so far: many players with prices over 1.000.000 yet
Team view: as the players have no names, they are represented by their value. So my team OSNARBRUECK has two players with value 2.000.000
Match view: time is ticking and goals are shown (as text). I am quite satisfied with the current table

title: Fussball.prg

description:
Bauernkampf (english: pawn fight) is a small board game played on a 5x5 board. On the upper side there are five computer controlled pawns, while on the lower side two player controlled knights are standing. Movement of the figures is like in the chess games: pawns can move one or two fields first and capture other figures diagonal only. The knights can move two fields forward and one field to the side (in any direction).

The goal of the player is to prevent that any of the pawns reaches the lower border. There are no scores or time limits, but the overall match history is shown. The game is written in GFA Basic and the source code is coming with the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: It is my turn: so this is a very promising position!
So it is: captured the last pawn and won!
Game Over. The computer gets a point, and I am trying again
The computer only moved pawns from one side first
Game start: entering the name. You also see the base settings: two knights at the bottom, five pawns at the top

title: Bauernkampf

description:
As a manager of a music band, the goal in Top 20 is to create a number one hit in the charts. You can hire musicians, create demo tapes, organize radio gigs, recording a long player and finally create a music video. The game is basically played with a dice and on a board with fields of different types, but this board is not shown by the game, only hints given when moving are given. The game is basically divided in two phases: first set up a band and create a recording, then try to climb up in the charts.

After rolling the dice and moving on the boards events happen according the the field entered. There are different kind of cards, some giving you benefits like a demo tape or you can exchange members of your band. Your band members have different styles of music they can play, like Jazz, Oldies or New Wave. Having the desired amount of members able to play a certain style, the band is playing this kind of music. With event cards, you can exchange the members of the band. Random events occur during the rounds, when sometimes a groupie destroyed your demo tape or somebody spend some money to the band.

Having created a demo tape, a recording in the studio and visited a radio show, you can start to play gigs raising some money. The band can even send on a world tour.

The game is in German language only and written in GFA Basic, the source code is included in the package.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choosing the amount and names of players
Main screen: you can see what you have achieved: demo, radio, LP ("Schallplatte") and video
My band playing oldies successfully got a demo and a visit in a radio show

title: Top 20

description:
Das große Quiz is a quiz game in German language. Up to three players can compete to finish first by answering three questions of all four domains correctly and raising as much money as possible. The delivered four different areas tested are geography, technique, general knowledge and foreign words.

In each turn a domain is chosen randomly. The question is shown and the player with that question can bet on the answer: up to 100% of the player's current money can be set, with 20% as a minimum bet, so on wrong answers. On each question three possible answers are shown and can be selected. After three correct answers in a specific domain, that domain is locked and no further questions in this field can be taken.

The questions are giving in text files, which allow cheating by looking into them, but also easily creating own questions or even new domains. The game is written in GFA Basic and the source code is delivered with the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Question: what metal is won out of "Bauxite"?
Before giving an answer, you get the question and can bet on yourself
The wheel is turning randomly selecting a topic. Domains with three correct answers (small bars lower left) cannot be taken again
After answering, money balance is recalculated, also updating the jackpot on wrong answers

title: Das große Quiz

description:
Super Hangman ST is a conversion of the Hangman pen-and-paper game. The goal is to find a word in a certain amount of rounds. The word has a known specific length and each turn, the player can chose a letter. If the letter is in the word, the letter is shown at all position it is in the word. If the letter is not included, the gibbet grows by one piece until the complete man hangs.

The game is in German, so also all searched words are in that language. There are 466 words included, and the player can chose how many rounds to play.

sample_screenshots.caption: Finally found the word in time. No translation is given here, but alcohol has something to do with it
The underscores show positions in the searched word. No letters picked yet
Some intentional miss pickings to see the graphics grow
Choosing the amount of words (round to play)

title: Super Hangman ST

description:
Shogun is a conversion of the board game by German game company Ravensburger. It is a variant of chess, played on a 8x8 board. Each player has a shogun and seven pawns. The goal is to capture the shogun of the opponent player or decimate the pawns until a player only has a single pawn left.

Moving is quite different from chess: each figure has a number printed on it which represents the amount of fields this figure must pass if moved. A figure can move horizontally, up and down and it is possible to change the direction once in a move (e.g. a pawn with number "3" is allowed move two fields up and one field to the right, but two changes of the direction like one right, one up, one right are forbidden). After moving a figure on the board, it randomly gets a new number between 1 and 4. Each figure can hit any other if the move ends on the field of the opponent figure.

Shogun can only be played with two human players. The game prevents the players from making illegal moves. The figures can be moved with the mouse simply by dragging them to the destination spot.

sample_screenshots.caption: The contact info is coming from a separate info program
Black is moving the pawns aggressively
Starting position (the different looking figure is the Shogun)
If the game shows "Shogun" it's like "Chess": a figure is threatening your chief

title: Shogun

description:
Memory is an implementation of the board game of the same name. 60 cards are placed randomly in a rectangular grid on the board. Each symbol is included in the cards twice. The goal is to find as many pairs of symbols as possible. Each turn, a player is allowed to turn two symbols, and if they do not match, turn them face down again. If the opened cards a a pair of the same symbol, the player is rewarded a point and is allowed to turn another two cards.

The game features four different symbol sets, a default set with abstract symbols, one with company logos, one with numbers and one set called "Profi" (professional) which even more abstract symbols. The game is played against a computer AI. The strength of the computer can be set in steps between 0 to 100, which is the percentage of how many cards the computer can memorise. On 100%, the computer knows any card ever turned, which makes winning nearly impossible.

A high-score table can be reached and is persisted to disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game start. The board is sized 6x10
Selecting the difficulty of the computer opponent (how likely he memorize he cards. 0 is extremely weak, 100 is impossible to beat)
There are four card sets. They are loaded as plain files
In the abstract symbol set there is also a company logo hidden

title: Atari ST-Memory

description:
Memory is an implementation of the board game of the same name. 56 cards are placed randomly in a rectangular grid of the size 7x8 on the board. Each symbol is included in the cards twice. The goal is to find as many pairs of symbols as possible. Each turn, a player is allowed to turn two symbols, and if they do not match, turn them face down again. If the opened cards a a pair of the same symbol, the player is rewarded a point and is allowed to turn another two cards.

The game can only be played as single player against a computer opponent. The strength of the AI can be set from 1 up to 9 and can be altered during the game. There is one set of cards. The game is in German language and only running on the monochrome high-res monitor. The game is written in GFA Basic and the source code is included (version 1.2).

sample_screenshots.caption: After clearing the board it is shown face up and you can try again
Showing a pair. The difficulty level can be adjusted during the game with keys 1 to 9
I ended with a respectable result...

title: Memory

description:
Memory.Prg is an implementation of the board game of the same name. 18 cards are placed randomly in a rectangular grid of the size 3x6. Each symbol is included in the cards twice. The goal is to find as many pairs of symbols as possible. Each turn, a player is allowed to turn two symbols, and if they do not match, turn them face down again. If the opened cards a a pair of the same symbol, the player is rewarded a point and is allowed to turn another two cards.

The game can be played with one to three human players, there is no computer opponent implemented. The game can load different graphical tile sets and offers functions to create an image template for creating those directly from the program. There are three difficulty level. On "Hardcore", after 10 turns, all hidden cards are mixed randomly.

The game is in German language and is only running on the high-res monochrome monitor.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pairs found will not removed, but shown permanently
With the final result of this three player game

title: Memory.Prg

description:
Bert bought the helicopter of Ralph and modified it. The player somehow has a gun and is heading for the park to shoot the helicopter. Two years later, Bert takes revenge by attacking Earth with the help of a mad scientist. In Bert Games, the story does not matter.

The game is consisting of two arcade games. The helicopter part is a clone of Duck Hunt, in which you point to the helicopter and shoot. The cross-hair is controlled with the mouse. On hitting the helicopter it crashes to the ground. You should avoid the falling helicopter to hit Bert, who is standing in the lower right corner. If it hits Bert, the game is over. After using all your munition and Bert being still alive, the game is switching to the second part.

In Bert's revenge for destroying his helicopter, he attacks Earth with laser weapons which must be defended in a Missile Command clone. With the mouse you can drop bombs which destroy any laser beam in that area. If the attacking beams reach the town, you loose energy. The game ends if you have no ammunition or energy left.

The game has a high-score table and is only running on the high-res monochrome monitor. All the in-game texts are written in German.

sample_screenshots.caption: If you shot the helicopter above Bert and it is hitting him on crashing, the game ends
It is not "Game Over", but "Bert Over"...
Game part 1: if advises you that this is Bert

title: Bert Games

description:
Mem is following the idea and the rules of the board game Memory. 40 cards are placed randomly in a rectangular grid of the size 5x8. Each symbol is included in the cards twice. The goal is to find as many pairs of symbols as possible. Each turn, a player is allowed to turn two symbols, and if they do not match, turn them face down again.

The game is a single player game only, with the challenge to solve the board with as few tries as possible. There is no-multiplayer mode and no computer opponent to battle. Found pairs do not vanish, but stay visible on the field. If a board is cleared the score is shown and you can begin again.

sample_screenshots.caption: Finished. Score is shown in the lower left corner

title: Mem

description:
Lombric is a Tron-like game inspired by the 1998 game Viper by Eclipse. In this snake-like game up to three human players move their snake-head across the level keeping a trail of their previous route behind them.
