A collision with either the own tail, the tail of another player or any obstacle in the level kills the player. That player last-standing wins the round. The obstacles and starting positions are randomly placed at the start of each level.

The amount of blocks (obstacles), the amount of players and the speed of the head moving can be manually configured.

sample_screenshots.caption: Yellow crashed in the blue tail
The levels are filled with random obstacles

title: Lombric

description:
Memory recall is a game to train your memory. There are twenty tiles on a board of size 4x5. Like in the board game Memory behind each tile/card an image is hidden. But unlike the board game, you do not have to find pairs, but got commands to find a certain image.

There are two phases in the game: first you can freely explore the images and memorize them. Then in the bonus phase you get an request like "Find a tiger" and you get a higher score for finding it quicker with fewer turns. There are five difficulty levels. In the higher levels, you have shorter time to explore the cards freely and in the lower difficulties you also get information if the tile you turned is in the same column and row like the requested one.

There are 20 digitized pictures in the game, and a high-score table for each of the difficulty levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the lower right is the counter for the search of the image. The penguins were in the mid somewhere???

title: Memory Recall

description:
AtariScene cardbattle EX plus α is a card playing game. Two players having a pile of cards and each round is played with the card on top only. Each card comes with four attributes with values from 1 to 10. The player who won the last turn is choosing one attribute and the cards are compared by the number of this attribute. The player with the higher number wins the round and is getting both cards.

The game does have three difficulty levels: in "1337" you have to win all cards of the opponent, in "Hardcore" the game ends when a player has five cards left and in "Lamer" ten cards left are enough to end.

The game comes in presentation of a fighting game, with sampled speech and music starting only when the cards are played. As the cards are not cars or ships, but people from the Atari demo-scene. The four attributes are

  1. Productivity
  2. Idleness
  3. Oldschool Flavour
  4. Physical Presence

There are 36 different cards in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: I want to read that more often
If the computer selects the attribute to compare, the cards are visible completely

title: AtariScene cardbattle EX plus α

description:
Bob Fossill was promoted to the king of the Sudokuniverse, a land disordered by logical problems. His quest is to recreate order by rebuilding the land, which is done by defeating life forms by solving their puzzles. Bob Fossil's Sudokuniverse is a Sudoku implementation. A squared board of size 9x9 fields is divided into nine 3x3 blocks. In each block the numbers 1 to 9 must exactly appear one. But the same is true for each row and column of the 9x9 board. There are some unchangeable numbers on the board at the beginning.

The game features 20 levels, each with an unique solution. Each level is introduced with the life form to battle. On selecting a field, both row and column are highlighted, making the selection of correct numbers easier. In each field there are also small numbers from 1 to 9 which you can click and highlight as a hint for yourself.

For each level there is a separate high-score table.

sample_screenshots.caption: The starting board: many numbers given
On selecting a field both row and column are marked for convenience

title: Bob Fossil's Sudokuniverse

description:
Filler is a conversion of the browser game Gimme Friction Baby to the Atari ST. On the ground there is a cannon with constantly rotating angle. On firing the cannon, a ball enters the field and bounces off any wall or circle in the level area. If the ball comes to rest, it gets a random size and number between 1 and 3 printed in it. Hitting a circle decreases it's number and removes it from the field if the number reaches zero. If the ball shot crosses the line above the cannon, the game end (which happens after is bounces off from circles in the level). With each shot and bounce you earn points.

The game runs in any resolution and there is a binary for Coldfire-based Atari machines added. The game is written in C and the source code is included.

sample_screenshots.caption: With a precise shot and the ball bouncing between the circles in the upper half, removal should be easy
Incredible bad luck to get such a big circle on the first shot
The ball bounced over the dotted line above the cannon: Game Over
Starting screen: cannon on the bottom, score on the right (Monochrome monitor)

title: Filler

description:
PUNSSi is an arcade game for two players. Each player is controlling a ball and a third ball is on the field which must be pushed to the area of the opposite player by flying into it. The balls are accurately accelerated and the balls are reflected in the angle and impulse of their collision. The player is gaining points when the ball is in area of the opponent.

Some spice to the game are two little droids following both players and trying to catch them (one droid follows one specific player). If a player touched one of the droids, the player is set back to his own starting area and the droid disappears. The remaining droid will split into two droids a short time after that.

The game is only running on monochrome monitors. It is written in C and the source code as well as binaries for Atari machines with Coldfire processors is included.

sample_screenshots.caption: Player 1 better gets the ball to the other side now
Player 2 is in the lead and wins, although just got caught by a droid
Starting position: player 2 is upper left corner, player 1 lower right, and the ball (strange pattern) is in the center. The two small circles are the droids

title: PUNSSi

description:
Charlie is keen about balls. Due to some bad circumstances, he is forced to run away and join the circus. But Dr. Hasselhoff, the circus leader, is only hiring him if he proofs worthy. In the arcade game Double Juggle Vegetabobble you have to help Charlie to join the circus by solving the juggling challenge. There are three vegetables which has to kept in the air, by moving Charlies arms left and right. The balls only have to be touched for a very short time so they bounce back in the air. If a single vegetable falls on the ground, the game is over.

The game has two difficulty modes, with the harder mode featuring faster vegetables. Points are awarded for the time/balls successfully kept in the air. A high-score list keeps track of your success.

sample_screenshots.caption: Entering a name for the high-score table
Main menu: options, play and info
In-game: you control Charlie or better: his arms. Move left and right to adjust them to the spot where the balls fall down

title: Double Juggle Vegetabobble

description:
Ant, duck, flower and snake are trapped at the bottom of some platforms. In the arcade game Bunion Canyon up to four players take one of the characters and try to reach the highest platform. The platforms are moving horizontally and at certain positions there are holes, and often those holes are changing in size during the move. Any of the four avatars can move left and right and jump. If jumping is timed perfectly a higher platform can be reached by jumping through a hole. But beware: you fall down if a hole in your current platform is moving under your feet. In that situation it helps you can run out of the left or right border and re-enter on the opposite side.

As the plain jumping challenge would not be enough, the gods added blue pills, randomly appearing in the levels. Those grant one of four powers to the collector, like a wind to throw opponent players away or to lock them down temporarily. Also, in most levels a hammer is marauding, disabling any player it touches. Disabled players also fall through holes down.

Bunion Canyon is always played with four competitors, but the computer can control any amount of them (even four). The amount of rounds to win for an overall win can be manually configured.

sample_screenshots.caption: Jumping through the holes and avoiding the super-powers of the others... And the hammer of course
Starting position: ant, duck, snake and flower at the bottom. The marauding hammer is also there
Second level: far fewer platforms to climb, but bigger jumps (requiring even better timing)
One of the super-power pills to collect (the blue one)

title: Bunion Canyon

description:
Stupid Balloon is an arcade game inspired by the coin-op Crazy Balloon from 1980. You control a balloon moving through a underground maze, desired to collect all stars in a room. Accelerating the balloon gives it an impulse and it will not instantly stop, which makes navigation tricky. Any contact with the walls will blow your balloon and a life is lost. As if the navigation would not be difficult enough, there is also a strict time limit for collecting the stars. The player has three lives. If loosing a life, the collected stars are now respawned, but the time limit is not reset completely.

The game was created during a 24-hour game creation competition at the Reservoir God's Cwmvention party in 1998.

sample_screenshots.caption: Carefully navigating. But carefully is also slow, mind the ultra-strict time limit!
Level 1 start: controlling the red balloon. Goal: collect all stars before the time limit is up

title: Stupid Balloon Game

description:
Sworm is a Snake variant. The player controls the head of a snake and on eating numbered extras, the tail grows by the amount of elements of the value of eaten extras. After eaten one of the extras, there instantly appear the next one. The level borders can be crossed on all four sides, with the snake re-entering on the other side (e.g. moving out of the upper border let the head appear at the bottom). There are five different levels with different wall structures immanent. Touching one of these obstacles or your own tails instantly ends the game. An additional "zero" level contains no obstacles.

Optionally, bonus elements can be activated: those can decrease or increase the snake's tail, create a random wall element in the level or even restart the level, resetting all structures and the tail, but keeps the score.

As addition to the traditional 2D game, the game can also be played on a 3D cube: six two dimensional play-fields are texture-mapped on the automatically rotating cube and crossing the border of a single 2D map brings your snake on another side of the cube.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu: chose viewing mode (2D/3D), level, and bonus settings
Level 1 with walls. Leaving the level on one side brings you to the other side. But of course, your tail is moving behind
Later level in 3D mode, bonus elements activated: you do not see if they have a good or bad effect upfront
3D mode: you play on 2D fields mapped on each side of the cube

title: Sworm

description:
Static is an implementation of the card game Patience. But: it comes with a twist: it is not only the slow single player game to relax, it is also a hectic competitive multi-player game for up to four players, coming with extensions to the card game. The goal is to finish your four piles before any other player do. As there are some bonus items, you can encourage to finish faster than your opponents, or hinder the others to finish or even steal their cards.

The basic rules are like in the traditional Patience: each player has 7 columns with cards faced down and a deck. Any card at the end of a column or top of the deck can be turned face up. Turned up cards can be stacked by their number, but only if they have opposite color (a black 4 can be added to a red, but not to a black 5). By reordering the columns, additional card become turnable. Fetching an ace opens one of the four top piles, in which the sequence ace up to king of a single color must be laid down. The game is finished if all four kings are on the top piles.

The specialities of the multi-player games separates Static from other Solitaire games: in the deck jokers are hidden: in general you play joker cards on a single opponent. Some prevent the player from drawing cards, lock piles for adding cards and other affect your control of the game like slowing the pointer or even invert the controls. The "Metamorphis" joker let you take control of an opponent player's deck for a short time, letting you cause havoc there. The game offers to take control of any of the players, so as a single player you can play up against three computer controlled opponents.

The game's is highly configurable: for every single of the dozens of extras the amount of appearance can be set (or turned off). The playing strength of the AI can be configured in three levels. Four different graphical sets can be set for each player, the controls can be defined on the keyboard (if not using mouse, joystick or jaguar joypad), music and effects can be configured. The game is featuring a graphical high-score table.

sample_screenshots.caption: The party begins: four player game
Player 2 has a lock effect atm (visible with the card beside the deck. The white bar shows the amount of time until the effect wears off)
Later in the four player game
Configure player control (amount of players, human or AI)

title: Static

description:
Bugger! is an extended conversion of the classic coin-op Frogger for one up to six players. Frogs are standing at one side of a road and want to reach the other side. Carefully jumping up and down the frog can change the lanes on the road, avoiding the many cars driving on it. Cars are not simply passing by with a constant speed in this game, but also accelerate or get slower on occasion.

Beside converting the original game, Bugger! adds different playing modes: after setting a time limit, the goal is to reach as many points (road crosses) as possible. Another mode is limited by the amount of lives: cross the road as many times as possible before until you died for the specific amount of times. The speed of the frogs can be adjusted in three levels: slow, medium and fast. In a multi-player game, up to six human or computer controlled frogs compete with each other. Three frogs are starting at the lower side of the road, three on the upper side. The player with the most points scored according to the chosen playing mode wins. Extensively (and morbid) statistics of the frog's death are shown after each game. A high-score table can be reached.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game is supporting the classic single player mode: a single frog at the bottom, trying to pass the street
More interesting is the multi-player mode for up to six players: three on the top, three at the bottom
Surprisingly, five are still alive at this moment

title: Bugger!

description:
Power Up Plus is the enhanced successor of Power Up. The racing game is inspired by the Super Cars games. The racing track is viewed from the top and is scrolling in all eight directions. Playing a season, a sequence of tracks has to be solved and points are rewarded for the position the player is reaching at the end of the race after three rounds. Collecting enough points to reach the top of the league after the season is the ultimate goal of the game. There are four different track sets: Mini, Easy, Medium and Hard, which basically are separated by the length of the track. The driving skills of the computer controlled opponents can be switched in three levels from Easy to Hard.

The races are spiced up by the weapons each player can use: each car can shot to the front and leave oil to disturb following cars. If hit by either shot or oil, the car is uncontrollable for some moments. The usage of weapons can be turned off in the options. In two player mode the screen is split horizontally, giving both players their own view of their current position on the track. Like in the normal game additional computer opponents are on the street and the season is played. Two additional multi-player modes are implemented: in "Duel", the game's view is a single window. If one of the cars get behind and is getting out of view of the area the leader sees, the cars are set back and the behind player is getting a penalty. The other multi-player mode "Duel Special" is featuring the same rules, but additional computer controlled cars are on the streets.

The game runs on any Atari ST system but is using practically any additional hardware possible (blitter, STE sound) and even can utilize exotic hardware like the MV16 and Replay Pro digital sound systems. A track editor is included with the game, allowing to create new tracks in a convenient way.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main game options: set player's name, one or two player game (and activating the multi-player modes), Tracksets (Mini, Easy, Medium, Hard) or load own track sets
First curve: even without weapon use, chaos and mass accidents are quite common in this game
Some cars dropped oils - better avoid it or some time is lost

title: Power Up plus

description:
Zwyrds Doppelkopf-Programm is an implementation of the German card game Doppelkopf (Wikipedia entry with the game description and rules). Unlike most other card games, the official rules are not widely accepted and each local playing round is choosing from a wide range of additional rules, scoring system and even the type of cards to play. In general, Doppelkopf is a game for four players and two players form a team, but the teams are not known in advance (in a normal game the two players with a Queens of Clubs on hand play together), creating diversified games and tactics. The game is played with 40 or 48 cards, with each card contained twice in the deck. There are a plethora of special rules and modes, some played as "solo", in which a single player plays against the three others (in many different variations), others appear if certain conditions are matched (like a player has only three trumps ("Armut") or holding both Queens of Clubs ("Hochzeit")).

The accurate computer game implementation allows a single human player to play with three computer controlled players. Many of the special rules can be configured: the game allows playing with nines (48 card deck) or without (40 card deck). The actions on holding both Diamond Aces ("Schweine") can be configured as well as the many different extra-points to get during the play. The types of "solo" games can be configured and by default the trump game, Queens, Jack Solo, No trumps ("Fleischlos"), or even King-Queens-Jacks ("Köhler") are integrated. Players can make calls (to increase points), and the game is showing the current amount of points made during the round, as well as the information currently available (who played a Queen of Clubs). The amount of rounds and even the type of scoring can be configured. Special rules in which new cards are instantly distributed (like a player holding five kings or a no trump above a certain card) are implemented and can be configured, too. The strength of the computer AI cannot be configured and is not flawless, but in general the playing style of the computer opponents is very competent. Extensive statistics about the games, reached points, special points can be shown and a gaming session can be saved and continued later.

The game is programmed in GFA Basic and the source code comes with the game. The in-game language is German.

sample_screenshots.caption: Computer announced a "Solo" (playing against the other three. Game type: no trumps at all "Fleischlosen").
Other game: both queen ob clubs were played, so Maschine and AI are teamed up against me and Computer. The scores are still close
Special situation: I have only three trumps. I offer them to the other players ("Armut"). I could also decide to play a "Solo" game here (the other buttons)

title: Zwyrds Doppelkopf-Programm

description:
Lila is an implementation of the ancient Indian board game Leela (Wikipedia, later named Snakes and Ladders) and is using terminology of modern interpretation of the game described in the book "The Yoga of Snakes and Arrows: The Leela of Self-Knowledge" (1993) by Harish Johari.

On a board with 72 fields, up to six players start unborn in field 68. To start moving into life, the player has to roll a six on the dice. If doing so, the player is set on field number 6 ("delusion"). Moving on the fields is straight: you roll a the dice and move forward by the number of fields. The ultimate goal is to complete the circle and reach the field 68 again. On the board are also two types of line connections between fields called "snakes" and "ladders". Entering a field being a starting point of one of those two lines, the player is directly moved to the ending field of those lines. Snakes are negative effects and move the player to a field below on the board, while ladders are shortcuts to fields with higher numbers. If a player if walking over field 68 (e.g. from field 64 with a six), no further movement is possible until this player is rolling the number to reach field 72 ("Tamoguna") exactly and then reenters the board.

Each field is entitled with the names from Harish Johari's book and the game creator advises to read the comments in the book on entering a field (those texts are not included in the game). Games can be loaded and saved. Dice rolls can either be simulated by the computer or the value of a real dice can be entered as number. All in-game texts are in German language.

sample_screenshots.caption: First two players reached the end, while four are still seeking to do so
A ladder "Erbarmen" (mercy) is a huge lift from field 17 to 69: but the player passed 68...
Starting view with the board: green are ladders, red are snakes. Field 68 is in the middle of the top row (640x480x16 colors)

title: Lila

description:
In Roger you control a small ball with feet and a red glasses and your aim is to collect all diamonds in a levels. But those crystals are spread across the area, which scrolls smoothly in eight directions: to reach those, you have to utilize platforms, but also rely on "jumping bubbles". Touching those bubbles, you are accelerated and shot a small way up in the air, reaching further diamonds or the next jumping bubble. The bubbles disappear after contact, but respawn short time after that, so you can reach upper parts of the level again. There are metal spike blobs in the level, which have to be avoided, as they drain some energy from Roger, but crash on contact too. Two special items can be found: extra energy and extra time. The last one is required, as the levels feature a strict time limit. If either time or energy reaches zero, one of the initial three lives is lost.

After finishing a level bonus points for the remaining time is rewarded. A high-score table can be reached. On the game start, a trainer can be activated, enabling unlimited lives and disabling the time limit on the levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Roger is standing on a solid platform. The grey bubble catapults him in the air on contact
Those spiky metal things drain energy on contact -- but often you have to destroy some of those to reach diamonds below them
A typical Roger run: flying from jumping bubble to the next and collecting diamonds in between
A huge jumping scenery: the pill restores energy if collected

title: Roger

description:
Sissy and Sassy have lost their playing card deck. On a journey through Heartland they try to get all the lost cards. In this platform game, the goal is to find the lost cards, hidden in a huge area scrolling in all eight directions. Some cards can be found directly on platforms, other are hidden behind one of the nine magic doors, which are also acting as teleporters to other locations of the game map. The player can jump and should avoid spikes on the ground as they drain energy. Energy can be refilled by some of the bottles lying around (not all regain energy). If energy dropped to zero, the game ends. Beside finding all the cards, there are also 273 gold coins spread over the complete map, which can be searched and collected for points.

There are no enemies or moving obstacles in the levels, so exploration of the levels can be done without fear (except the spikes). The player can change between Sissy and Sassy during the game, as well as saving and loading games. A high-score table can be reached and is saved on disk. On STE machines, a sample is playing in a loop.

sample_screenshots.caption: Nice: a bottle for energy refresh, some coins and a secret door!
Falling is nice if it goes over so many coins
Found a coin: collect those for points
Invisible/hidden platforms can bring us here to a much higher place
Standing on a platform with some spikes above

title: Heartland

description:
Insecticide is a shooting game inspired by Centipede and Robotron. During winter time, insects are bored and playing "Insecticide", and the player has to compete in their competition. Playing a ladybird, you have to hunt ants, bugs and other insects. Your ladybird starts at the bottom of the screen and can move into four directions, and also shooting in the direction currently walking. The levels are single screens, and beside moving enemies, there are static obstacles of insects still in winter sleep.

The levels are single screens, with the enemies moving towards you. Shooting at static obstacles may reward bonus points or the "Bouncer", a bullet moving constantly and bouncing of the walls, crushing any opponent in it's way. After each eight levels, a boss fight has to be done against a bigger bug. On contact with the enemies or getting hit by one of their shots, the ladybug looses some energy. On loosing a life, the game must be restarted from some levels earlier. On collecting enough points, a high-score table can be reached, which is persisted to disk.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can shoot in the direction of moving
The "Bouncer" extra weapon is flying around (small circle mid left). It crashes everything in it's way

title: Insecticide

description:
On the planet Tafoi a war broke out: the Swocki ambushed the local Galluks, wiping most of the population. They are led by the Phenocles, an evil god. And, being a god, this is also a threat to the Alliance, which rules the galaxy. To get a picture of the situation, the Alliance decided to bring in an agent first before starting direct military intervention on Tafoi.

In Fate Master the player controls commander Tsin-Fei to gather information and preferably solving the situation on the planet without military strike. In the flip-screen landscape the commander can discover and collect items, enter doors, and approach enemies. On contact with enemies the game flips to a fighting screen, in which the player can attack or flee. On attack, one of the equipped weapons like pistols or grenades, can be used and in turns the player and the enemy attack until one of the fighters run out of hitpoints. Defeating an enemy is rewarded with gold, which can be used at a vendors to buy new or better weapons. The character has four stats: hitpoints, strength, skill and defence, which are automatically increased if the player reached a new level. On re-entering a room, previously killed enemies respawned.

NPCs give the player quests, like finding a person or special items, reaching certain places, in which often certain items are involved (like you need dynamite to open a blocked door). Games can be loaded and saved.

sample_screenshots.caption: A room with an enemy: it's a Rubble Scooper!
One of those two is a traitor!
Tsin-Fei is beamed down on the surface of the planet
I would have better avoided the fight with only 2 hitspoints left...

title: Fate Master

description:
Sim Pig is a simulation game, in which you have to handle a pig farm. Each turn, you can either buy or sell land, food, or pigs. The player starts with a small farm house and one piece of land with pigs. Each square of land can be used to grow five pigs, so extending the farm can only be done by buying land, which is very expensive. Food is consumed each turn, resulting in constant costs. Income can only be generated by selling pigs, but there are turns in which no demand for pigs is on the market. To increase the demand for meat, you can advertise in different forms for different prices. If pigs are getting ill, a doctor can be called to cure them.

On the same map, a computer controlled player is also building his farm in direct competition to yours.

sample_screenshots.caption: Buying advertisements increase the demand for meat (and therefore your pigs)
Playfield: mid farm is mine, lower left the AI. I already bought another piece of land (2 fields below the house)

title: Sim Pig

description: In The Spitting Fish the player is a fish and the goal is to spit on insects so that they fall into the water and can be eaten by your kids. At the start of the game a hit gives the player 2 points and a miss -1. The points for a hit increases every second level. 5 hits are needed to move on to the next level (once the time is up). If the player has a hit accuracy over 90% or higher 50 points is added to the score when the level is complete. If the score reaches 0 it's game over. At the bottom of the screen a snail is moving to the left once this snail exits the screen the level is over. Before the next level the player needs to pass a math test to get time to the next level. The math test consists of multiplying number of dots on dice 10 times.
title: The Spitting Fish

description: In Slime Nemesis the player helps Rusty Jim to complete his practical test to become a slime exterminator. To succeed with the test Jim must defend the school wall from 20 waves of slime. Every wave is guarded by creatures that bounces around the screen. Shooting at these creatures will make them stop moving for some time. After each level there is a bonus round where coins falls from the sky. During the bonus round the player can not use the flame thrower to shoot at the guarding creatures. After the bonus round the player can use the collected coins in "Slimekiller Inc. General store" to buy upgrades.
title: Slime Nemesis

description: In Sidelong the player is piloting back a ship to the repair pool when a message is received telling the player that an alien ship has been detected within the base and that a bomb has detonated close to the main reactor. The bomb blast damaged the reactor so severe that it will go critical in just minutes. The player must now escape the underground base but the ship is damaged in such a way that there is no break. Luckily the ship is armed with a powerful laser that can obliterate solid rock. However the laser must be used with care since it consumes fuel. The player have infinite lives, but the amount of fuel is limited (and not reset when the player dies) and the time to reactor meltdown is steadily decreasing.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first of many narrow passages

title: Sidelong

description: Rotatus is a shoot-em-up game similar to Gyruss, where the player controls a ship that rotates around the game area. The player has to shoot at enemies that emerges from the middle and travels outwards. A meter to the right of the game area shows the level progress. The game consists of 8 levels. In each level enemies moves at different speeds and in different patterns.
title: Rotatus

description: A Quest for Galaxia is as the name hints a Galaxian-clone. Aliens moves back and forth at the top of the screen, now and then an alien swoops down to attack the player. Certain enemies gives extra points if they are shoot down while they are attacking the player. Difficulty can be adjusted using the function keys: F1 = easy, F9= very hard.

sample_screenshots.caption: A bit different color scheme in this level

title: A Quest for Galaxia

description: The objective of Puzzle Squares is to slide the letters back into the right position. The game area consists of 5x5 squares with 25 black letters in them, theses black letters shows the player the correct position of the letters. The game area is then populated with bigger red letters, these are not in the correct position and must be slided into place. Moves are carried out by pressing the keyboard key that corresponds to the black letter of the red letter that the player wishes to move. Pressing an illegal key, ie a letter that can't be moved results in an audio alert.
title: Puzzle Squares

description:
Pair Off is a card game where the aim is to have only one card left on the table. The game starts with two cards on the table and the rest in the deck to the right. Cards can be paired off in 4 ways: * Cards next to each other can be paired off according to suit.

  • Cards next to each other can be paired off according to rank.
  • Cards that are three spaces apart can be paired off according to suit.
  • Cards that are three spaces apart can be paired off according to rank.

In addition to this cards may only be moved from a lower place to a higher place. A help function shows the player a possible move if there is such a move. At most 18 cards may be on the table at any given time. Once all the cards from the deck is dealt and the player can't make any more moves the player has to press the help button. If there are no more moves then it's game over and the player will be presented with the game statistics.
title: Pair Off

description: In Seapower the player must destroy the enemy ships by shooting at them. Shooting is done by clicking on a square in the game area. After each shot the computer will tell the player in what direction of the ship the shot landed. The player has only 6 shots so care has to be taken when deciding where to shoot. The game area consists of 15x10 squares.
title: Seapower

description: Megamix is a memory game where two players have to compete to match most tiles. The game area consist of 9x6 tiles. Each found pair gives 1 point and the player with the highest score at the end of the game wins.
title: Megamix

description: Megamix 2 - Brainstorm is a memory game where two players have to compete to match most tiles. The game area consist of 6x5 tiles. A timer to the right of the play area shows the players how much time there is left of the game. This game is a sequel to Megamix. The scoring is a bit more complex than in the previous game: the score depends on the tiles that are matched. Tiles have roman numerals on them and the player receives the sum of the as points: matching 'IV' will give the player 8 points. There are also Three special pairs: "*" which will double the score for the player, ":" which will divide the other players score by 2 and "SWAP" which will swap the scores of both players.
title: Megamix 2: Brainstorm

description: Pacman ST is a Pacman clone with two game modes and two speed settings. As in the original game the player must eat all of the small yellow dots to complete the current level. The player must avoid the ghosts that tries to catch Pacman, touching a ghost means losing a life. Eating the bigger yellow dots makes the ghosts edible for a short while. If the player eats an edible ghost extra points is awarded. Now and then bonus items will appear in the middle of the level, these awards the player with extra point if eaten. Playing in classic mode shows the game area with traditional graphics, in modern mode the level graphics have been overhauled. Setting the speed to hectic gives the player an extra challenge since everything moves faster in that mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ghosts are afraid of me now

title: Pacman ST

description:
From Little Acorns is a humorous adventure game that takes place in the next dimension. It is a day like any other, you are waiting for your friend Alvin so you can go drinking at the Amputated Goblin. The player and Alvin are both professional adventurers. In the inn the player hears about a new quest from the government: Return the country to sanity and a decent economic footing. Without much thinking Alvin accepts the quest, it's just collecting a lot of valuable loot and bring it to the chancellor, how hard could it be? When the game starts the player is hopelessly drunk at the Amputated Goblin inn. So the first thing the player has to do before beginning the seemingly easy quest is to sober up.

A the top of the screen the player sees the score, number of moves done and direction buttons (W,N,S,E). In the middle there is a picture of the current location, at the bottom of the screen there is a text window for text descriptions and to the right is the command window where the player can select commands to execute (Take, drop, etc).

sample_screenshots.caption: Well that answer didn't make much sense

title: From Little Acorns

description: In Mission Deadzone the player controls a hovership and navigates caves in search of stranded scientists. The player starts with three ships and a full energy bar. The energy bar decreases over time and if the player is hit by fire. Energy platforms spread out through the caves can be used to fill up the energy bar. Here and there in the caves the player will be faced with passages blocked by energy beams. These beams can be switched off by firing at blue switches (these will then turned red). Firing at a switch will give the player 50 points, rescuing a scientist will give the player 100 points. At the end of each cave there is an end of level boss. Defeating this boss reveals a teleport that will take the player to the next cave.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first end of level boss
Better try to avoid those towers

title: Mission Deadzone

description:
In Minefield, the player competes against the computer to see who can get most tanks to the other side of the minefield.

First, both players places their mines (5 to be exact) on the mine field (represented by a 8x8 grid) there may only be one mine per row. Then the player and the computer takes turns to try to navigate their tanks to the other side. Secondly, a start square is selected and then the player chooses in which direction to go (diagonally or straight); the tank may not be moved sideways or back. Once a square has been used for movement, it is removed from the game and that space may not be used of passage again. The tanks gun can be fired at suspected squares to see if there is a mine there (this can be done twice each turn). Both players have 8 tanks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got one of the computers tanks
The smily face shows that there is no mine there

title: Minefield

description:
Perfect Match is an educational game that mixes the gameplay of a concentration/memory game with the questions of a trivia game. The player is presented with a set of cards with each having a sentence on the hidden side. The task is to flip two cards to reveal their statements. When doing so the player will be asked if they match and if they do and the player answers yes the cards will be removed from the table and points will be earned. Answering wrong will lead to a loss of points. The game can be played by up to four players at a time and the player with the highest score when all cards have been removed wins the game.

There are ten different question sets to play with as well as one with mixed questions. In addition to those there is an editor that allows the player to create new question sets for use in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cards are removed after being matched
Playing a short game on easy level

title: Perfect Match

description:
In the first-person interactive text adventure Wizards Tower, the player plays a young magic user that seeks out the wizard Marek, in hope that he will teach the player more about magic. But as it turns out, the wizard has disappeared and his tower has become home to many evil creatures.

The local population tells the player that many have entered the tower in search of riches but few have returned. The player now stands in front of the tower with one thought in mind: to retrieve the great wizards spell books.

In the beginning, the only thing the player is carrying is a spell book and a dagger. How much the player can pick up is limited by the player's strength and the objects weight. When the player adventures in this game it is important to keep an eye on hit points and power. Once the hit points reaches zero it's game over, and if his power reaches zero, no spells can be cast.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts right outside the tower

title: Wizard's Tower

description:
In the top-down real-time RPG Hero II: The Search for the Stone, the hero (the player) has been summoned by high commissioner Argolak to immediately appear before King Phaesus. The king gives the player the mission to retrieve the gem of far seeing. The gem was stolen by the mad priest Alazar and so far 20 knights have tried to get it but all of them have disappeared.

Before the player can start to play, a character must be created or loaded from disk. A character is created by letting the computer randomly generate values for: Physical, Mental, Toughness, Agility, Persona, Gold, Life points, Protection and Magic points. The game interface consists of three areas: the dungeon is to the left, to the upper right is the command menu and to the lower right is the status display. Once the player has spoken to the king and stocked up he/she must venture into the labyrinth that leads to Alazar. Killing monsters will reward the player with experience points and gold.

The player is free to return to the shop area whenever he/she wants to spend his/her hard earned gold on supplies and better equipment. If two players play, they have to be careful since they can hurt each other.

The shareware version came with a pre-designed labyrinth. Upon paying the shareware fee the player got a version that could load and play any dungeon created with Dungeon Construction Set.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is where the game starts

title: Hero II: The Search for the Stone

description:
In The Enchanted Realm, the player plays the one and only person that can save the world from the Dark Lord. The game starts in the village where the player lives. To the north looms the volcano where the Dark Lord lives.

Overall, The Enchanted Realm is a classic text adventure where the player enters two word commands in the form verb-noun to take action. One words works some times too, like "north" for "go north".
title: The Enchanted Realm

description:
In the text adventure Once a King, the player plays a neurotic and paranoid king who have decided to have a jacuzzi installed. Now this dreadful anachronism leads the player to stumble upon a gateway to the future. The king now boldly steps forward into the gateway.

Once a King is a humorous text adventure with an unclear objective. Since this is a classic text adventure there is no graphics or sound.

sample_screenshots.caption: I had no idea that I could pick that up

title: Once a King

description: Alien Blockade is an adapted version of the arcade game QIX. The player controls a marker and must use it to draw rectangles on the screen while avoiding the enemies. Initially the game area is black, but as the player creates rectangles on the screen a hidden image is revealed. If the player takes too long to draw the rectangles, the time will run out and a life will be lost. When enough percentage of the hidden image has been revealed, it's on to the next level.
title: Alien Blockade

description:
In Empire Builder the player is a property developer in greater London and the goal is to make as much money as possible. The player starts with £500,000. First the player must decide for a company name and then select in which county to begin (there are 20 to choose among). From the game's main menu, the player can choose from the following options:

  • Accounts/Banking: This screen shows the player's financial status.
  • Build: Advances time 24 days.
  • Property design: On this screen the player chooses how many properties of each type that is to be built.
  • Building society: On this screen the player can invest money in property or savings.
  • Job center: On this screen the player can hire workers.
  • Legal eagle: Here you turn to engage a solicitor.
  • Materials: Here you keep track of your materials and buy new one too.
  • Office: This screen shows the player a menu where different reports can be accessed, company status for example.
  • Site plan: This screen shows the number of owned plots, built plots, sold plots and so on.
  • Shares: The stock market, well sort of since the only stock that can be bought or sold is the one belonging to the player's company.
  • Score: This screen shows the player the score.
title: Empire Builder

description: Robot Attack is an edutainment game where the player must do multiplication to stop robots from building a giant killer robot. Robots either drops down from the top of the screen or will emerge on the left side of the screen and moves to the right. At the bottom of the screen the player sees the multiplication that must be solved. When the robot reaches one of the boxes to the right a piece of the giant robot will be put in place. The game has six levels ranging from practice to genius. The speed of the robots and how many multiplications that has to be solved depends on the level.
title: Robot Attack

description: Trionoids is a falling blocks puzzle game that is based on Columns. Groups of three vertically aligned blocks fall from the top of the screen and the player has to guide them to the bottom. The aim is to match three or more blocks of the same colour which can be done vertically, horizontally and diagonally. As matches are made the blocks disappear and others fall down which can lead to chain reactions. While the blocks are falling the player can move them left and right, switch their order and speed up their descent. The goal of the game is simply to get the best score but as time progresses the speed increases. The game ends when blocks reach the top of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Making a match of three yellows

title: Trionoids

description: A platformer game inspired by Super Mario Land on the Atari ST. You control a character (that's best left undescribed) through the platforms while collecting coins and stomping on enemies. The levels are procedurally generated.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hmm... reminds me of another game

title: Super STario Land

description: Frogger is an authentic, unlicensed port of the arcade game Frogger. Help get little Froggy across the road. Each level will increase in difficulty as you progress.
title: Frogger

description:
Seven Little Horror's is a public domain German language role playing game. You control a party of three monsters, out of a group of 10, who roam the country-side visiting villages/dungeons trying to collect seven objects and one key. Obtaining these allows your party to begin the decisive battle of the game.

At the start of the game, each character in the party is chosen to be male or female, along with a race (Waxor, Gnome, Orge, Hunch, Megrim or Thauma) and a class which dictates magic preference. A number of statistics are then randomly assigned based on this information. Vitality relates to the base damage a character inflicts per round. Hit-points is the damage the character can take. There are also spell-points in six different types of magic: Psychic, Vampire, Magic, Devil, Voodoo and Banshee. Only magic is used in combat, and different opponents will be sensitive to different types of magic.

The party begins on an overworld map which shows 19 villages. Some of these allow your party members to heal, to level-up, to save the game or to exchange characters. There are also dungeons labeled "Level 1" to "Level 10" according to the dangerousness of their inhabitants. When these are entered, the perspective changes to a first person perspective in a 3D maze. These mazes may be navigated by clicking in the direction of movement. Clicking on some portraits on walls reveals secret passages, and landing on some squares will rotate the party. In the "Level" dungeons, an auto-map in the top left side of the screen updates as you move.

Combat can occur randomly on the overworld map, or at specific locations in the dungeons. A picture of your opponent is shown and only a single player character can engage in combat per round. There are three main options. To greet the monster, to run from it, or to attack with one of the six magic types. On attack, spell points are deducted and the damage inflicted is related to the spell points left, the character's vitality, susceptibility of the monster to that magic type, and a race or class bonus.

After each battle, loot (gold-pieces) is collected. Experience points are also assigned to the combatants, with the character striking the killing blow receiving the bulk of the points. At regularly spaced intervals, the players can level up which increases vitality by one with more substantial increases to maximum hit-points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Carson the psychic can level up.
Too tough. The party is destroyed.

title: Seven Little Horror's

description: Make a break is a quiz game with a touch of snooker. In each turn the player first needs to select a ball to pot (selecting subject) and then answer the supplied question within the time limit. For each questions the player is presented with four answer options. The number of points that the player gains from a correct answer depends on the color of the ball selected. Selecting the wrong answer means game over. The various subjects are: TV+Films, the past, the world, music, sport, sci + nature, the arts and pot luck.
title: Make a Break

description:
Football Genius is a football quiz game with an extra football twist. First the player chooses his/hers team. Then the computer sets up the tournament. The game then plays out in the following fashion: a question with four possible answers is asked and the player has to choose an answer. Depending on how long it took and if it's the right answer a line will either move up or down a football field on the right hand side of the screen. A match will last for 2x90 seconds. If the line reaches one of the goals it is goal and a point will be given to the team that succeeded.

The goal of the game is to stay in the tournament and win the final.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now I must choose my team
This is not going my way

title: Football Genius

description: Chessnut is a chess game for 0 to 2 players. The game can be played at 9 different levels from 1 to 9. The number represents width of the search (but not the depth which is always 5) that the computer makes before each move. Moves are done by the player by entering the move in algebraic notation, for example: A2-A4. The game board can be seen both from an isometric point of view and from above and the game features several graphic options which makes the game a bit more colorful.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh no the computer took one of my pieces

title: Chessnut

description: International Cricket is a cricket game where the player may choose to play one out of four teams. The four teams are: Derbyshire, Glamorgan, New Zealand and Sri Lanka. Match length can be set to 20, 40 or 55 overs. Game level can be set to 1, 2 or 3. Each player have unique characteristics in the form of batting, bowling, catch, throw, stopping and agility. The view is the same regardless of if the player is a batter och bowler. The game features many animations.

sample_screenshots.caption: My team. Stats about C. Adams
I'm going to play Derbyshire and the computer will be Glamorgan

title: International Cricket

description:
Exodus is a shoot-em-up game where the player flies a spaceship over alien space fortresses.

The background story is that the evil Marque-Wans have enslaved the people of Earth within nearly impenetrable space fortresses that are located in the vicinity of the Marque-Wans home world. The player is the only free hyper-fighter pilot so it is up to the player to free the humans.

The aim of each level is do destroy all of the ground defenses. To stop the player from doing this they will fire back and wave after wave of flying enemies will also try to shoot down the player. On later levels homing missiles will also be used against the player.

The player starts out with five lives and when all is lost it's game over. Fuel is limited and when the tank is empty the player will crash and lose one life. The alien fortresses are built like toruses so the player will just go round and round and never reach an edge in any direction. A map on the right side of the screen helps the player to find the ground defenses.

sample_screenshots.caption: I went down i flames again
Three enemy fliers and a missile, they really got it in for me now

title: Exodus

description: Football Magic is a minimalistic football team management game. Once the player has chosen which team to manage the players interaction with the game is limited to transfer players in and out of the team, changing players shirt number and take/repay loans. Each week there is a match and on given weeks this is a cup match. The player starts in division 4 and the aim of the game is to move up to the top of division 1 by winning matches. If the team preforms badly there is a risk that the team will go bankrupt and that means game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Options. Why loan can be found here and not under financial is anyone guess

title: Football Magic

description:
Decoder is a form of Mastermind game in which the player needs to find the right sequence of colors. The game has three game modes: Mini, Standard and Super. In the mini mode the player needs to find the right four color sequence out of six possible colors and this must be done in 6 tries. In the super mode the player needs to find right five color sequence out of eight colors and this must be done in 12 tries.

Right color in the wrong place is indicated on the side of the board by a white dot and right color in the right spot is indicated by a black dot.

sample_screenshots.caption: Useful knowledge: three colors that wont appear in the final compination

title: Decoder

description:
Gilbert's Challenge is a board game where the aim is to remove as many marble from the board as possible and ideally only have one marble left on the board. The player have three tires and if enough score is generated during those three tries a place on the high score table is earned. If the player manage to only have one marble left on the board the game continues to the next level (there are a total of 25 levels in the game). Removing marbles is done by selecting a marble move it over another marble (horizontally or vertically) to an empty spot, on the easiest level this will remove the marble that was moved over but on harder levels the marble may change color instead and must be moved over one or more times with marbles of different colors before it is removed from the game board. The marbles can be of up to five different colors. Sometimes the player may add extra marbles to the board to make it possible to remove marbles.

The game comes with no instructions whatsoever so part of the challenge for the player will be to discover what rules governs the removal of marbles. The game Features four game modes: Practice, Beginner, Advance and Tournament, it also has.

sample_screenshots.caption: This level is a bit harder

title: Gilbert's Challenge

description: ST Aggravation is a board game for up to six players. The aim of the game is to get all of the players marbles from base (the solid color circles outside of the path) to home (the outlined colored circles inside the path) To start moving a marble a player needs to roll a one or a six. If a player rolls a six and can't use that six he/she gets a new roll. Marbles may be passed on the game board as long as they are not your own. if a player lands on a light blue circle that player may take a short-cut directly over the board the next turn. If a player happens to land on another players marble that marble is said to be captured and is sent back to the base.

sample_screenshots.caption: A bit into a two player game (red & green)

title: ST Aggravation

description: Crown of Creation 3D is a first-person shooter where the player controls the LH14 space-fighter prototype. The game is set in the year 2060 when Earth is attacked by two different alien races: Srintrians and Ke'nath. Flying in space through different missions the player participates in the secret project Codename Omega to save the planet.
title: Crown of Creation 3D

description:
Mission Mouse is a platform game set in a maze spanning 25 separate rooms. You control Mickey, a mouse catcher who has been associating with mice so long that you are beginning to look like one. It is your job to catch 930 mice, while avoiding angry cats, owls, tin-men and other combatants, whose attacks will lose one of your five starting lives. You will also lose a life at the slightest touch against a vertical wall or a low roof, but can fall any distance without harm. Extra lives, represented by hearts, can be found scattered throughout the levels.

Mickey can move left and right, and jump. You can also do these things while bent low to the ground, allowing you to capture the mice in tight spaces. Despite being able to jump, Mickey tends to get between platforms by using elevators, or trampolines which provide much more sudden shift to the platform immediately above him. Police boxes appear on some screens, which allow Mickey to teleport to other more distant parts of the maze.

sample_screenshots.caption: About to capture the last mouse on the last screen.
Mickey can get to the next floor using a trampoline.
Screen 03 has exits in all four directions, plus a police box.

title: Mission Mouse

description: Necron: Aptor Quest is an adventure game with RPG elements where a barbarian finds himself dropped into a castle fighting other barbarians and wizards while trying to discover the secrets of the castle.
title: Necron: Aptor Quest

description: Multicours 4ème is a compilation that includes four programs: three educational programs (Géographie, Sciences Naturelles, Français) and one game, a Breakout variant: Cokteloid.
title: Multicours 4ème

description:
Conquest of Elysium is the original fantasy turn-based strategy game that spawned a long-standing series, as well as the Dominions spin-off. It can be played against one or more AI opponents, or between several human players at the same computer. Staring with just one castle and a group of followers, each player's goal is to vanquish all opposition and become the sole ruler of the realm of Elysium.

In many ways, the game is similar to other fantasy turn-based titles like Steve Fawkner's Warlords or MicroProse's Master of Magic, but offers considerable depth and variety by introducing a vast array of different factions, each with their own unique playing style. These are split into several categories: Warlord, Magic User, Priest or Non-Human, the latter including such fantasy races as trolls, elves, dwarves and so on. While the economy based on taxes and the recruitment of forces into the player's military is the same for all, faction specifics come heavily into play early on, and building up an undead army of a Necromancer for example is not remotely similar to the more straightforward approach of a Human Warlord.

There are pre-set scenarios, but games can be also played on randomly generated worlds that the player can customise by specifying map size, terrain features and the historical period (from early agricultural society to an empire and later monarchy). In addition to the warring players, there are numerous neutral entities that roam the world, from wild animals to brigands to fortified towns and villages. There are seasonal cycles that affect the game world as well: the population will be more cheerful in spring but much less so with the coming of winter. All these features contribute to a dynamic world in which the events of the game unfold.

On the whole, Conquest of Elysium has only minor differences from its direct sequel, which is essentially an updated port to IBM PC compatible platforms. However the latter introduced many changes to art (e.g. replacing almost every static screen), the interface design and layout, and tweaked certain playing mechanics. Several new player classes were also added, and some existing ones were changed compared to thefirst game.

Conquest of Elysium was marketed as shareware, with the unregistered demo version only allowing to play games on customised random maps, with some player classes not available for selection by human players. The save/load game feature was also disabled.
title: Conquest of Elysium

Start of the game, meeting an ant eating plant!
A hostile crab? Not entirely sure, but you can just jump past it.
A fairy moves in for the kill!
A teleporter to the right, even though it looks more like a cover for a well. Press down while on top of it to teleport.

sample_screenshots.caption: Third level fighting outside some houses

description:
After a magic-war between good and evil, good has lost. The remaining good wizards have been turned into owls. The only way for the wizards to regain their non-avian form is to travel through time and across continents to collect some magical boxes and take them to the "Cave of Eternity".

Wizard Royal is a platform puzzle game. There are twenty levels supplied with the game, each containing four or five screens. There is also an in-built level editor. Every screen contains some combination of fixed platforms, ropes and vines for climbing up or across, and water and vegetation which slow your progress. There may also be moving platforms, traps of various sorts and enemies that may block your path or shoot flames/projectiles at regular intervals. Transporters are located on each screen, allowing you to travel to the previous or the next screen.

You control a wizard owl as he wanders between the screens from the selected level. One of these screens will contain an entrance to the "Cave of Eternity", which needs to be opened with a key. Magical boxes lie scattered about on most screens. Once collected, these boxes may be deposited in the unlocked cave at any time. Carrying many boxes at once will cause your owl to slow substantially, so it may be a good idea to get rid of them as soon as possible. Some boxes are difficult to get to, and may require you to use a magic spell to blast a hole in the platform immediately behind you. But be careful this doesn't leave you trapped. Other helpful items include time bonuses, and armor which allows you to pass some traps unharmed.

You start the game with five lives. These may be lost by getting caught in a trap, running into an enemy, or having to restart a screen after getting stuck (after which any blasted sections of platform get re-filled). Losing all lives, or allowing your time to run out will lose the game.

The game was released in both high-res monochrome and low-res colour formats. The colour version also comes with additional digitized sound effects.

sample_screenshots.caption: First screen of first level of colour release.

title: Wizard Royal

description:
Das Grosse Deutsche Ballenspiel (or DGDB) is a Gauntlet variant with a few modifications such as the ability to throw bombs and traps such as lasers. There are a total of 23 levels with the original game. Each level consists of a number of screens, and the aim is to get from the letter A (your starting position) to the letter Z, without running afoul of the prowling monsters or laser cannons. The game can be started from any level as selected on the opening menu.

As in Gauntlet, many of the levels are populated by monsters spawned by generators (or "heads), and the only way of stopping the flow on new monsters is to destroy these. You also have an energy level, which is depleted by running into monsters. If your energy gets below zero, you run into one of the insta-death traps, or you accidentally blow yourself up with explosive, the game ends. But before this happens, you have the option of replenishing your energy a limited number of times.

The game can be played in 1 or 2 player modes. In 2 player, both characters play at the same time. If one dies, the other can revive him by shooting a heart. DGDB was originally released in the public domain, but the level and character editors for the game were sold separately.

sample_screenshots.caption: Try to reach the Z on Level 1.
These enemies are harmless, but multiply endlessly.

title: Das Grosse Deutsche Ballerspiel

description: This is the sequel to Super STario Land and is very much a Super Mario Bros. clone, just like the prequel. You control Mario... I mean STario in his quest to save Christmas and stomp as many cute critters as possible. The game has game mechanics and power-ups that are extremely similar to Super Mario Bros.

sample_screenshots.caption: Grab the first Christmas present and you get bigger.
Shades and fireballs! Christmas is good to me!
Yupp, you can bump enemies from below.
Grab the present before it escapes!

title: STario's Christmas

description: You need to take down the pesky space barbarians by destroying four force field generating globes. Each level contains one globe, guarded by a boss.

sample_screenshots.caption: Closing in on a teleporter, that allows you to skip parts of the level.
Ship has just been powered up.

title: Trauma

description: Amadeus was designed to teach you all about music theory. It contains 20 lessons divided into 3 parts: a lesson, a training exercise (which is then replaced by a musical dictation), and Staphone which asks you questions about what you have learned. At the end of each course, you will get a mark and a mention. Depending on the accuracy and speed of your answers, the mark will be higher or lower; if it reaches 500,000 points, you will be admitted to the next level.
title: Amadeus

description:
Liberator is a vertically scrolling shoot'em up. The player controls his T.H.G.C. (Tactical Hover Gun Craft, basically a levitating hot tub) through enemy controlled territory in search of imprisoned Federation members.

Hostile aliens will descend on your from all directions. You have up to 99 bombs to use in your defense, and there's ammo boxes to pick up that will replace your spent ammo. Upon reaching an imprisoned Federation member you need to fire at the cell gate to release the prisoner. You will then be taken into space where you need to dodge Time Space Gates until you see a flashing gate, fly into is and you will be taken to the next leve. Should you fail to hit the right gate you will be returned to the same level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Someone parked their spaceship in a crater.
Robot heads that fire projectiles at your hot tub!
Start of level one, get a welcoming wave from a local!
Teleportation in progress! Please pass the sick-bag!

title: Liberator

description: Crossland is a vertically scrolling shooter, where you control a spaceship and blast various space nasties. If you shoot enough Fuji symbols you get to play a breakout mini-game. Should you succeed at it, you will get a weapons power-up. The game also contains sampled voices.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shoot enough Fuji symbols and you get to play a breakout mini game.

title: Crossland
